loans.name: Felister

texts.en: Felister is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be disciplined. She operates a boutique where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area that is smart for the business, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough money. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy stock of clothes. Her business goal is to own a mega boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve standards of living. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothes.

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es: Sandra es una ama de casa de 31 años de edad, casada y madre de una hija de 7 años. Vive en un pueblo al sur del departamento y hasta el momento le ha sido difícil emplearse en una empresa. Tiene un espíritu emprendedor y muchas ganas de superarse, por lo que tiene en mente iniciar su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que ubicará en un espacio que tiene disponible en su casa, así podrá aprovechar al máximo su tiempo libre, mientras genera los recursos económicos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar. Cuenta con experiencia en esta labor, ya que trabajó en la tienda de su abuela durante un año y por eso quiere hacer de esto su principal fuente de ingresos. Actualmente solicita el crédito para invertir la totalidad del dinero en la compra de surtido al por mayor (pastas, granos, azúcar, galletería, mecato, gaseosas, entre otros), de esta forma podrá poner en marcha su proyecto productivo, del cual espera recibir buenos resultados para salir adelante con su familia. Sandra se caracteriza por ser una mujer ordenada, activa y pujante, lo que le ha permitido hasta el momento cumplir con los objetivos que se propone, por eso, desea trabajar arduamente en su nuevo proyecto y sacarlo adelante, logrando que sea reconocido en el sector y le genere una rentabilidad para que le permita disfrutar de una estabilidad económica favorable, darle una buena educación a su hija y mejorar la calidad de vida de todo su núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Sandra is a 31 year old housewife, she is married, and she is the mother a seven year old daughter. She lives in a town in the south of her district and has had some difficulty finding employment. She has an entrepreneurial spirit and a great desire to get ahead in life, so she is starting her own business, a grocery store that will be located in an open space in her home. Thus she will be able to take advantage of her free time while generating income in order to help her husband with household expenses. She has experience in this work: she worked in her grandmother's store for a year and now wants to make it her principal source of income. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase an assortment of wholesale goods (pastas, grains, sugar, cookies, pastries, soft drinks, etc.). She will be able to get her project up and running, and she expects good results that will allow her and her family to get ahead.

Sandra is a very lively and orderly woman, which has allowed her to achieve all of the goals she has set for herself. For this reason she hopes to work hard in her new role and make it successful, becoming recognized in the area and generating a good income that will allow her to enjoy good economic stability, provide for the education of her daughter, and improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: purchase a variety of wholesale goods (pastas, grains, sugar, cookies, pastries, soft drinks, and other items).

loans.name: Faaeteete

texts.en: Faaeteete is a 23-year-old married woman with one child. She makes and sells popcorn and ice cake in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Faaeteete needs a loan to buy sugar, foam cups, cordial, chinese lollies, popcorn, plastic bags and cooking oil for her business. She plans to use her profits to support her family. Faaeteete became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy sugar, foam cups, cordial, chinese lollies, popcorn, plastic bags and cooking oil.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 46-year-old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a clothes store where she sells new clothes and also second-hand clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an area fit for the business and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transportation. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be stable within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothes.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 36-year-old married woman with two children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a clothes store where she sells new clothes and also second-hand clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an area fit for the business and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transportation. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be stable within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She also does farming to earn extra income.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothes.

loans.name: Joviline

texts.en:
Joviline is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Joviline is 30 years old and both of her children are in school.

Joviline has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. Joviline has requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of dried fish to sell.

Joviline has been in this business for two years. In the future, Joviline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a single woman. She has 2 children, ages 8 years and 10 years. She describes herself to be jolly. She operates a retail shop where she sells soda, water and beverages. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in a market area, and her primary customers are retailers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds to boost business. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a stock of beverages. She hopes that in the future, she will have her own home. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to pay back the loan and save the rest.

loans.use: to buy stock of beverages.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 23 years old, married and has three children. Two of her children are in school.

Evangeline is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Evangeline has been raising pigs for twelve years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Riem

texts.en:
Riem, 53, is a villager residing in Ruessei Kaev district, a suburban area about 14km far from Phnom Penh. He is married and has four children, whom he loves very much. His children motivate him and his wife in their business of selling fish in order to provide enough for them. The income he earns from this type of business usually goes to food and other home expenses. He’s been in this business for nearly 11 years. Although it’s hard work, it’s a way of earning a life honestly.

Riem is taking out a loan to help with his current business. This loan will be used to buy both fresh and dried fish to sell at his store. His dream is that he can develop his business and increase his sales, so that he can give his family more financial stability, give his children a better education and improve the whole family’s quality of life.

loans.use: buy fresh and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of ten children, Fortunata works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish and raising pigs. Fortunata is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like snack foods, sugar, soap, shampoo, canned goods and other groceries for her general store business.

Fortunata has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like snack foods, sugar, soap, shampoo, canned goods and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 47 years old. She usually sells fish and vegetables for a profitable price in the village. Her offered products are fresh from the ocean where the fish are being caught, and her vegetables are grown organically. This quality of offered products has helped her generate good income and has also resulted in high demand for her products. This convinces her to request for additional business capital of 5,000 PHP to buy more varieties and higher volume of fish and vegetables. She hopes that her requested loan will be approved to further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more varieties and higher volume of fish and vegetables.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man. He describes himself to be social and faithful. He is a photographer and takes photos to earn a living. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase a camera. His business goal is to employ five people within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve standards of living of his family members. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: purchase a camera for his photography business

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 26 years old and married with four children.

Rosalie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like chips, milk, soap, noodles, etc.

Rosalie has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from fishing and raising pigs.

Rosalie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like chips, milk, soap, noodles, etc

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 48 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Emelyn is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Emelyn has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her piggery business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 56 years old, married, and works hard to help her husband earn a living.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and raising pigs. Susan is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like sugar, coffee, milk, eggs, noodles, chips, etc. for her general store business.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like sugar, coffee, milk, eggs, noodles, chips, etc.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en: Marjorie sells juice and snacks at her small stall within the school vicinity. She has been doing this for over one year and earns a net of PHP2,500 per month. She would like to offer more food products for her student customers and teachers in order to meet all their food needs and increase also her sales. She is asking for a loan of PHP5,000 as added capital to purchase stocks of biscuits, candies, breads, coconuts for coconut juice, seasonings/ingredients and more. She hopes to gain higher income through help of this financial assistance to improve her families living standard and be able to save for the education of her three children.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of biscuits, candies, breads, coconuts, seasonings/ingredients and more

loans.name: Lolo Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe   LOLO   sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques au quartier BABEMBA un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur douzième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme  AFOU fait le commerce de pagnes wax dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle se tien en deuxième position à partir de la gauche vers la droite.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  3 douzaines de pagnes wax  et revend en détail  sur place  et au marché à une clientèle composée de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15 000 francs cfa dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the Lolo group are married women who on average are 33 years old with three children. They live mostly in monogamous families in Babemba, a populous neighborhood of the city of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They are on their twelfth loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, to satisfy the needs of their customers.

Ms. Afou trades wax pagnes (type of colorful West-African fabric) in this group of women. She is standing in the second position from left to right.

She intends to use the loan to buy three dozen wax pagnes and retail them for cash on site and at the market to a clientele of women.

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 15,000 CFA francs, a portion of which will be used to pay the loan and its interest and the rest put into savings.

loans.use: buy pagnes (colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Margarita works hard to support her family.

She has a crab culture business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Margarita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing net and other equipment for her crab culture business.

Margarita has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of expandiing her business and repairing her family home.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other equipment.

loans.name: Jiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe  JIGUIYA  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygame à Kadiolo Noumousso un des quartiers de la ville de Kadiolo dans la région de Sikasso (3ème  région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur 11ème  prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme  CHATA fait la transformation et la commercialisation d’amandes de karité en  beurre de karité dans ce groupe de femme. Elle  se tien à l’extrême droite. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt environs 300 kg  d’amande de karité qu’elle transforme et vend en détail sur place en famille à une clientèle composée pour la majeur partie de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 francs cfa dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The seven members of the Jiguiya group are married women who on average are 40 years old with five children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Kadiolo Noumousso, one of the districts in the city of Kadiolo, in Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They are on their eleventh loan with the  Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, to meet the needs of their customers.

In this group of women Ms. Chata processes shea kernels into shea butter for retail sales. She is seated at the far right.

She intends to use her loan to buy 300 kg of shea kernels she processes and retails on the spot with her family, for cash, to a clientele consisting for the most part of women.

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 45,000 CFA francs, a portion of which will be used to pay the loan and its interest, and the rest put into savings.

loans.use: buy shea kernels

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a medical treatment

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es: Carlos Manuel, tiene la edad  de 44 años, está casado, vive con su esposa  que es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras,  esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Carlos Manuel is 44 years old and married. He lives with his wife, who is his greatest priority. With his loan he will purchase fertilizers and fungicides, pay labourers to help with the coffee crop, and purchase some seed-starting trays in order to replant his crops. This is with the objective of increasing the density of plants and taking advantage of the fertility of the soil, the climatic conditions, and other conditions which favour coffee growing. With these improvements to the crops, he hopes to obtain a little profit and thereby improve the living conditions of his family, invest a little more in the crops, and also fulfil some goals. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has had no other loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered the loan with better conditions and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to grow coffee

loans.name: Mutisya

texts.en: Mutisya is a 19-year-old single man. He describes himself as talkative. He operates an electronics shop where he sells televisions, batteries, mobile phones, chargers and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a commercial area and his primary customers are both men and women. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more electronics to resell. He hopes that in the future he will have a happy educated family. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more electronics to resell

loans.name: Señor De Tantanmarca Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE TANTAMARCA, este banco está situado en la comunidad de Yanacona, distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Charmeli tiene 26 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 01 hijo ,la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio ,la socia elabora diversos platos como arroz con pollo, saltado, sopas entre otros, la socia vende en uno de los mercados del lugar a todo sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo  de esta forma que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicitó el crédito para la compra de insumos como carne, arroz, aceite entre otros.
Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de chicha, venta de verduras, agricultura, crianza de animales menores  venta de cds.

Los socios que salen adjuntos a la foto por motivos de salud y trabajo no pudieron asistir a la reunion por ese motivo se les tomo en dos grupos.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Señor de Tantanmarca”. This bank is situated in the community of Yanacona, in the district and province of Urubamba, in the department of Cusco. The member, Charmeli, is 26 years old and has a partner and one child. The member alternates her daily activities with the business of selling food. The member has been making a living from this business for a while, and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. She makes various meals, such as arroz con pollo (chicken with rice), lomo saltado (traditional Peruvian stirfry), and soups, and she sells them in one of the markets to all the clients who request them. She is a responsible and diligent person, and she helps her family to get ahead in this way.

The member is requesting the loan in order to purchase supplies, such as meat, rice, and oil.

The other members make a living by selling maize drinks, selling vegetables, doing agricultural activities, raising young animals, and selling CDs.
The members in the attached photos could not attend the meeting due to health reasons or work commitments; for this reason, the photos were taken in two groups.

The member is grateful for the loan and is committed to complying with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, such as meat, rice, and oil

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel Ángel, tiene la edad  de 53 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y sus hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de preparación del terreno y realizar algunas labores de conservación de suelos para evitar la erosión que se da principalmente por el agua de lluvia y así conservar un poco más la fertilidad y después realizar la siembra del almácigo de chile, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que quiere es poder comprar los mejores productos y de buena calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad, además tener a corto plazo una buena producción. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel is 53 years old, is married and lives with his wife and children who are his main priority. With his loan he intends to buy fertilizers and pay for labour for preparing the land and carrying out some soil conservation work. This will prevent the erosion which is mainly caused by rainfall and so maintain the fertility a little better. After this he will plant chilli seedlings and by doing all of this he will be sure of doing a good job. He wants to buy the best good quality products so that his plants are healthy and develop well, as well as getting a good yield in the short term.

This is the first loan he has had with FUDECOSUR. He had not had other loans from State banks before, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with the loan on better terms and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant chilli plants.

loans.name: Joel Adalberto

texts.es:
Joel de 30 años,  vive con su compañera de vida y sus 4 hijos de 2, 4, 7 y 12 años, de los cuales  2 de ellos estudian, en la escuela del cantón. Su compañera de vida se dedica a oficios domésticos.
Joel tiene 14 años de experiencia en el área de la soldadura, teniendo como resultados buenos ingresos. Esta actividad, la aprendió recibiendo algunas técnicas de parte de los amigos, familiares y la mayor parte la aprendió de ayudante de soldador.
Se le estará ayudando para que Joel,  pueda invertir en la compra de más equipo de soldadura; ya que expreso que con el préstamo quiere comprar un compresor, planta, pulidora, etc. y con esto tendrá la oportunidad de mejorar sus ingresos, será más ágil  y rápido para hacer los trabajos a sus clientes. 
 Su sueño, es tener una vivienda propia y su propio taller de soldadura a corto plazo.
texts.en:
Joel, 30, lives with his common-law wife and their four children, ages 2,4, 7 and 12, two of which go to the local school.  His wife is a domestic employee.

Joel has 14 years' experience in the welding business and earns a good living.  He learned the trade from friends and family but most of his experience is from working as a welding assistant.

Joel is receiving help so he can buy more welding equipment.  He says he will use the loan to buy a compressor, a polisher, etc. which will give him an opportunity to improve his income.  It will allow him to work with more flexibility and be able to turn around customer orders more quickly.

His dream is to have his own home and welding workshop in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a compressor, polisher, etc.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba., perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco. El socio es el Sr. Miguel Arcangel; ; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de madera, el vende en forma independiente en la provincia de Urubamba y por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de madera. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar madera al por mayor. 

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower, Miguel Arcancel, belongs to the communal bank "SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA" which is located in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.  He alternates his daily activities with timber sales which he does independently in the province of Urubamba.  He is able to earn a living this way to provide for his children.  

Miguel Arcangel is requesting a loan to buy wholesale timber so he can expand his business.  He is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy wholesale timber.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco. La socia es la Sra. María; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ganados y tambien vende chicha (bebida a base de maiz),la socia tambien vende jora que es un producto que se utiliza para hacer la chicha,ella vende en forma ambulatoria,la socia quiere mejorar sus negocios de venta de chicha y ganados. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ingredientes para hacer chicha y alimentos para ganados. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower, María, belongs to the communal bank "SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUMPAMPA" which is located in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.  María alternates her daily activities with buying and selling livestock as well as a corn-based drink called "chicha".  She also sells one of its ingredients, jora.  She works as a street vendor and wants to improve her livestock and chicha businesses.

María is requesting a loan to buy animal feed and ingredients to make chicha.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and ingredients to make "chicha".

loans.name: Alfredo Armando

texts.es:
Alfredo de 49 años,  es un hombre que le gusta mucha trabajar y además es emprendedor, porque desempeña muchos roles en el hogar. Posee, muchos deseos de seguir mejorando con sus labores diarias. Actualmente vive con su suegra y una hija de 9 años de edad que estudia en la ciudad.

Alfredo desempeña varias actividades que le generan ingresos, como la venta le comida por pedidos y sándwich, que los elabora con una receta única, ya que los clientes lo prefieren. También, practica el oficio de electricista obteniendo de esa manera un ingreso para la familia.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar materia prima y productos, porque quiere estar preparado para cuando le soliciten la comida, y pueda tener los insumos para elaborarla y entregarla más rápidamente, y también quiere abrir un cafetin para vender sus sándwich a los alumnos que pasan por ahí.

 Tener un negocio mas grande y así tener mas ingresos para la familia. Ese es su sueño.
texts.en:
Alfredo, 49, is an entrepreneur who enjoys working hard and playing several roles in the household.  He also wants to continue to improve in his daily work activities.  He lives with his mother-in-law and nine-year-old daughter who studies in the city.

In order to earn a living, Alfredo sells food and sandwiches on an order basis.  He has a unique recipe that his customers prefer.  He also works as an electrician to earn extra income.

The loan he is requesting through Fundación Campo is to buy raw materials and other products he needs for his food business.  He wants to have supplies on hand so he can deliver orders more quickly.  He plans to open a coffee shop to sell sandwiches to students who pass by the business.

His dream is to expand his business and earn more income for the family.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and products for his food business.

loans.name: Rosa Paulina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco. La socia es la Sra. Rosa Paulina; ella tiene 34 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con la crianza de sus hijos, la socia es ama de casa y su pareja trabaja en el negocio de transporte y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere tener un negocio propio. La socia solicita el préstamo para hacer arreglar su casa y comprar materiales de construccion como cemento,yeso y arena. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower, Rosa Paulina, belongs to the communal bank "SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUMPAMPA" which is located in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.  She is 34 years old and lives with her common-law husband and two children.

Rosa Paulina alternates her daily activities between raising her children and doing housework.  Her husband works in the transport business and together they are raising the family, although she would like to have her own business.

She is requesting a loan to buy construction materials such as cement, plaster and sand to renovate her home.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to renovate her house.

loans.name: Jiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe  JIGUIYA  sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygame à Kadiolo Koko un des quartiers de la ville de Kadiolo. 
Elles sont à leur 23ème  prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme  Kadia fait le commerce  de tubercules et condiments dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle  se tien débout au milieu. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt des condiments:  10 paquets de cube maggi, 3 paniers de gombo séché, 5 kg d’oignon séché qu’elle revend en détail sur place en famille à une clientèle composée pour la majeur partie de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000 francs cfa dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The seven members of the Jiguiya Group are all married women with an average age of 40 years, and an average of 5 children.  Most of them live in polygamous families in Kadiolo Koko which is a district of the town of Kadiolo.  This will be the 23rd loan for this group with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  The group have requested the loan in order to be able to meet the needs of their customers.  

Mrs Kadia sells tubers and other ingredients within this group of women.  Kadia is standing in the middle of the photo.  She will use her loan to buy ingredients, 10 packets of Maggi bouillon cubes, 3 baskets of dried okra and 5kg of dried onions.  She sells her products locally, through retail cash sales, to customers who are primarily women.  She hopes to earn a monthly average of 25,000 francs CFA, which she will use to repay her loan with interest and to save for the future.

loans.use: Pour acheter des condiments

loans.name: Safarmoh

texts.ru:
Сафармох сельская женщина, имеющая пятерых детей. Она около 15 лет вместе с мужем в своем районе Бохтар занимаются сельской промышленностью. Муж работает на грядке и помогает жене. Сафармох ухаживает и следит за скотами. У нее во дворе сейчас одна корова с теленком. Эту корову Вы можете увидеть на фотографии. 
   Сафармох еще в юности в доме у родителей кормила и доила коров, поэтому она много знает о деятельности животноводства. Сафармох в будущем хочет расширить свой скотный двор. А сейчас она торопится увеличить поголовье скота, поэтому запрашивает кредит, чтобы купить двух коров. Она надеется, что они станут началом для продвижения в ее деятельности.
texts.en:
Safarmoh is a woman who has five children and lives in the countryside. Together with her husband, she has been working on agricultural endeavors in the Bohtar district for about 15 years. Her husband helps her and works in the garden. Safarmoh takes care of and watches the cattle. In their yard they now have one cow with a calf. You can see this cow in the photograph.

Even during her childhood, when she was living at home with her parents, Safarmoh fed and milked cows. This is why she knows a lot about the animal husbandry business. In the future, Safarmoh would like to expand her barnyard. But now, she is in a hurry to increase the size of her herd, which is why she is requesting a loan to buy two cows. She hopes that they will be the start of the advancement of her business.

loans.use: to buy two cows to increase her herd and advance her business.

loans.name: Kithumbi

texts.en:
Kithumbi is a married woman who has six children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail shop where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are of all types. 

Kithumbi describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of funds. Kithumbi will use the KES 10,000 loan to add stock of shoes. Her business goal is to have a bigger shop within five years. Kithumbi hopes that in the future, she will be able to support her family financially with her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of shoes.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 45 years old and married with seven children, five of whom are in school. Wilma works very hard to provide for them.

Wilma runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, noodles, etc.

Wilma has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
Leslie is 25 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by farming calamondin (fruit tree) in the Philippines. Leslie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers.

Leslie has been farming calamondin for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Bakary

texts.fr:
Monsieur Bakary est âgé de 38 ans marié et père de trois garçons enfants. Il réside avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une famille nucléaire à Médine, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Bakary après avoir mené beaucoup d’activité sans succès,  s’est initié à cette activité de stockage et commercialisation des céréales (maïs, mil, sorgho) il y a maintenant trios ans. Il dispose de son magasin au marché de Médine. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décide de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant deux années et est à son quatrième prêt. Le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.
Il compte avec ce quatrième prêt  acheter 35 sacs de maïs et 25 sacs de mil en provenance des localités environnantes de Sikasso. Ces marchandises sont d’abord stockées dans son magasin afin d’êtres revendues en gros à une clientèle composée des détaillants et des chefs de famille.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 80.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Bakary is 38 years old, married and the father of 3 boys. He lives with his wife and children in a nuclear family setting in Médine, one of the peripheral districts of Sikasso town (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having run several businesses without success, Bakary started storing and selling cereals (maize, millet, sorghum) 3 years ago. His warehouse is located at the Médine market.

Bakary joined the Soro Yiriwaso MFI 2 years ago in order to be able to satisfy his growing clientèle and is on his 4th loan. The previous loans have been correctly repaid. He plans to use this loan to buy 35 bags of maize and 25 bags of millet from the area surrounding Sikasso. He first stores the grain in his warehouse in order to then resell it wholesale to a clientèle composed of retailers and heads of family. With the help of this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 80 000 francs which he will use to contribute to the family expenses, pay the interest on his loan and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Hamidou Ousmane

texts.fr:
Né en  Octobre 1988 à Zégoua (frontière Mali-Côte d’Ivoire), Monsieur  Hamidou Ousmane est un célibataire résidant sous le couvert de son cousin à Sanoubougou II, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Hamidou Ousmane n’ayant pas eu la chance de progresser aux études et s’est très vite initié depuis plus de dix années à cette activité d’achat et vente des téléphones portables et leurs accessoires (façades, batteries, chargeurs, écouteurs, carte mémoire etc.). 
Son activité est menée dans sa propre boutique à la gare routière de Sikasso avec une clientèle composée essentiellement des voyageurs et surtout des transporteurs. Il est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant trois années et avec laquelle il a déjà bénéficié de sept crédits tous correctement remboursés. Ainsi, Il sollicite ce huitième crédit lui permettant d’acheter à Bamako, 70 téléphones portables de marques différentes, 10 cartons de façades, une quinzaine de chargeurs, 30 paquets de carte mémoire, 30 cartons de batterie, 22 douzaines d’écouteur de différentes sortes, une dizaine de montres différentes, des ceintures, etc. 
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 95.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Hamidou Ousmane was born in October of 1988 (near the Mali / Ivory Coast border). He is single and lives at his cousin's place in Sanoubougou II, one of the popular districts of Sikasso town (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Hamidou Ousmane did not get the opportunity to pursue his studies and quickly got into retail, selling mobile phones and accessories (skins, chargers, headphones, memory cards etc.), which he has been doing for 10 years. He runs his business from his own shop located at the Sikasso bus station and sells to a clientèle mostly made up of travelers and carriers. He is much in demand by his clientèle due to the quality of his products.

Hamidou Ousmane decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso MFI 3 years ago in order to be able to satisfy his growing clientèle and has already benefited from 7 loans, which have all been correctly repaid. He is now requesting his 8th loan in order to buy 70 mobile phones of different brands, 10 boxes of skins, 15 chargers, 30 packets of memory cards, 30 boxes of batteries, 22 dozen different types of headphones, a dozen different watches, belts and other items in Bamako. With the help of this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 95 000 francs which he will mostly use to augment his working capital, contribute to the family expenses, pay the interest on his loan and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Kobiljon

texts.ru: Кобилчону из Б.Гафуровского района города Худжанд 40 лет. Он по профессии сантехник. Женат, имеет сына и дочь. Кобилчон решил унаследовать профессию дедушки. Его дед занимался производством веревок. Кобилчон имеет стартовый капитал в размере 1000 долларов США. Однако этой суммы недостаточно для приобретения оборудования по производству веревок. Такая техника стоит очень дорого и поэтому Кобилчон обратился за кредитом, чтобы осуществить задуманное. Данным бизнесом он будет заниматься при дворе своего дома. Кобилчон планирует взять себе в помощники еще два рабочих. Благодаря кредиту он откроет прибыльный бизнес, и жизнь его семьи улучшится.
texts.en: Kobiljon is 40 years old and is from the city of Khujand in the B. Gafurovskiy District. He is a plumber by trade. He is married and has a son and a daughter. Kobiljon decided to take up the profession of his grandfather.  His grandfather was in the business of manufacturing rope.  Kobiljon has start-up capital in the amount of 1000 USD. However, this amount is not enough to buy the equipment needed for manufacturing rope. This kind of machinery is very expensive, which is why Kobiljon is requesting a loan to fulfill his goal. He will run this business in the yard of his house. Kobiljon plans to have two employees working for him as assistants. Thanks to the loan, he will open this profitable business and the life of his family will improve.

loans.use: to buy equipment for manufacturing rope.

loans.name: Mamoudou Garba

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mamoudou Garba  est âgé de plus de 39 ans marié à deux femmes et père de quatre enfants domicilié avec ses femmes et ses enfants dans une famille nucléaire à Lafiabougou un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso     (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur   Mamoudou Garba après avoir mené beaucoup d’activité sans succès, s’est initié à cette activité de Rôtisseur (vente des moutons et chèvres rôtis) il y a maintenant dix huit ans. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décide de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant plus d’une année  et avec qui il est à son deuxième prêt .
  Avec ce nouveau prêt il compte  acheter 10 moutons, 10 chèvres en provenance des localités environnantes de Sikasso. Ces marchandises sont d’abord stockées dans sa rôtisserie afin d’être abattus et revendus en rôtis à une clientèle composée des chefs de famille.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mamoudou Garba is over 39 years old, married to 2 women and the father of 4 children. He lives with his wife and children in a nuclear family in Lafiabougou, one of the popular districts of Sikasso town (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having tried several businesses without success, Mamoudou Garba started a rotisserie business (selling roast sheep and goats) 18 years ago. He joined the Soro Yiriwaso MFI over a year ago in order to be able to satisfy his growing clientèle and is on his 2nd loan.

Mamoudou Garba plans to use this new loan to buy 10 sheep and 10 goats from the villages surrounding Sikasso town. He keeps the animals at his place of business before killing them, roasting them and reselling them to a clientèle made up of heads of family. Thanks to this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 90 000 francs, part of which will be used to cover the family expenses and pay the interest on his loan and part of which will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats for his rotisserie business.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
La socia alternas sus actividades del hogar con la de la agricultura, ella tiene un terreno en el que cultiva (maíz, habas, trigo, cebada, verduras),la socia tambien cria pollos,los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias.La socia solicita el credito para comprar  pollos.

La socia esta muy agradecida y valora el préstamo otorgado para la realización de sus proyectos y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total del préstamo en el tiempo determinado.
texts.en:
This member alternates her household tasks with her agricultural work. She has a plot of land where she grows corn, broad beans, wheat, barley and vegetables. She also rears chickens, growing them on and fattening them up and then sells them at the various markets. 

She is asking for a loan to buy chickens. She is very grateful and appreciates the loan provided to help her carry out her projects and promises to pay the loan back fully within the agreed time frame.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Irene Irma

texts.es: La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco. La socia es la Sra. Irene Irma;  La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y fideos, la socia quiere ampliar la tienda de abarrotes . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes como arroz,azucar,leche. La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Irene Irma is a member of the “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA” communal bank, which is situated in the district of Urubamba in the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco. She alternates her daily tasks with running her grocery shop. She works from 7am to 2pm and sells everyday essentials such as rice, sugar, milk and noodles. 

Irene Irma wants to expand the grocery shop. She is asking for the loan to buy products for the grocery shop such as rice, sugar and milk. She is happy to receive the loan and promises to fulfil her instalment payments.

loans.use: to buy products for the grocery shop such as rice, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a single woman, and she has one child. She describes herself to be sincere. She operates a retail store where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a highly populated area and her customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to add to her stock of cereals. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: add to her stock of cereals.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco. La socia es la Sra. Felicitas; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de chicha (bebida a base de maíz), también vende jora que es ingrediente que se usa para preparar la chicha, ella vende en su casa, la socia quiere construir su casa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como cemento y yeso para su casa. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA” communal bank, which is situated in the district of Urubamba in the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco.

Felicitas alternates her daily tasks with her business selling chicha (corn based drink) and  'jora', an ingredient which is used to prepare chicha. She sells these from her home.

Felicitas wants to build her own house and is asking for the loan to buy materials such as cement and plaster for her house. She is happy to receive the loan and promises to fulfil her instalment payments.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement and plaster for her house.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl dreams of having a strong and firm foundation for her family and to have more investments for her children’s future. She has four children and all are attending school. Her husband is an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW) and she spends most of her time raising livestock to help finance her family's growing needs while at the same time, showing her motherly love and teaching responsibilities to their children.

She has been in the hog-raising business for 30 years. Initially, she started it with just a small and weak pigpen located in their backyard. Now, Cheryl has established a concrete pigpen and has been able to grow it according to her plan. She is asking for a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy sacks of feed for the maintenance of her hogs. She also plans to use the loan to further expand her pigpen to accommodate new piglets. In this simple way, Cheryl knows that she has been helping her husband in supporting their needs and in improving their living situation. She hopes that as a result of their struggles, their children will study harder and may they graduate soon.

loans.use: to buy sacks of feed for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Juliana requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.

She has been in this business for 30 years.

In the future, Juliana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 53 years old and married. She has two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Lucia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Lucia requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

Lucia has been in this business for six years. In the future, Lucia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Dior

texts.fr: Madame DIOR est une brave femme qui est mariée et mère de famille. Elle est âgée de 37 et évolue dans le commerce de tissus, des sacs et des chaussures. Elle a besoin de ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 20h du soir. DIOR aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle souhaite à l'avenir avoir sa propre magasin pour pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Dior is a brave woman who is married and the mother of a family. She is 37 years old and sells fabrics and bags of shoes. She needs this loan in order to increase her stock of merchandise. Dior begins her day at 8am and works until 8pm. She helps her husband with the daily expenses and the schooling costs of their children. She hopes in the future to have her own shop to be able to increase her revenues and to improve the living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and bags of shoes for resale

loans.name: Fati

texts.fr: Fati est une femme de 54ans mariée à un retraitée avec un enfant de 23ans. Elle exerce dans la vente des articles de bonneterie au marché. Elle s'approvisionne à Lomé. Elle sollicite un quatrième prêt pour la vente des articles de bonneterie et en vue de renforcer son capital. Elle a débuté depuis 2004.
texts.en: Fati is a married 54-year-old woman with a 23-year-old child. She sells hosiery in the market and stocks up in Lomé. She is requesting her fourth loan for her hosiery business in order to increase her business capital. She began her business in 2004.

loans.use: To buy pagnes (brightly-printed West African clothing) and hosiery.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 47 years old; she has nine children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalinda runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, spices, eggs, noodles, etc.

She has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Rosalinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, spices, eggs, noodles, etc

loans.name: Jodelyn

texts.en: Jodelyn would like to invest more capital into her business (selling snacks in school canteen). Therefore, this 41-year-old entrepreneur is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional snacks to sell such as biscuits, various candies, soft drinks and junk foods. She hopes this loan will produce higher income and cure the scarcity they experiencing.

loans.use: to buy snacks.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 44 years old and married with seven children.  With five children in school, Nilda works very hard to provide for them.

Nilda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like chips, milk, sugar, etc. Nilda has been in this business for 11 years.

In the future, Nilda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like chips, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 54 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Cecilia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. She has been in this business for one year.

In the future Cecilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna works hard to support her family. Myrna is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Myrna requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more household items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc. She has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more household items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Divinia

texts.en:
Divinia is married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Divinia is 46 years old and has two children who are in school.

Divinia has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Divinia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell.

Divinia has been in this business for two years. In the future, Divinia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 47 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband works abroad as telephone operator. Her three children on the other hand already have their own families. Despite that, she still needs to work hard to help and support some of her grandchildren's needs since her children's married life status is not good enough. 

Daisy manages a piggery business. She knows that running this business will help her a lot in meeting her family's and some of her grandchildren's needs. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed and some vaccines and medicines.

loans.use: to buy feed and some vaccines and medicines.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: This time, Rosemarie is borrowing a new loan of Php 29,000 to purchase more groceries to sell to her customers. Her fishing business was previously funded through NWTF and KIVA and continues to provide Rosemarie and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 58 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Clarita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell like spices, milk, sugar, soft drinks, etc.

Clarita has been in this business for two years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell like spices, milk, sugar, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros is 57 years old, happily living with her husband and one child. Together with her husband, she manages a business making hollow blocks for a living. For 10 years, the business has served as their main source of income. They use the profits to send their child to school and to meet their daily needs. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy cement and sand to make hollow blocks. Milagros will be very thankful if she will be given the chance to receive the requested amount.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to make hollow blocks.

loans.name: Babylord

texts.en: Babylord is 26 years old, married and has two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Babylord has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Babylord requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. Babylord has been in this business for five years. In the future, Babylord would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 59 years old, married and has three children. She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Eufemia requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional piglets, feed, and vitamins for her business.

Eufemia has been in this business for 12 years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Eufemia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rowena requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net. She has been in this business for nine years now. In the future, Rowena would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net

loans.name: Henedine

texts.en:
Henedine works hard to support her family. Henedine is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

Henedine requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like linen, tailoring chalk, tape measure, etc.

In the future, Henedine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like linen, tailoring chalk, tape measure, etc.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda's greatest dream in life is to let her children finish their studies and get employment someday. 

Imelda is 47 years old, married and has four children. She runs a livestock business, particularly hogs for breeding. She has been running the business since she got married. Imelda has one pig that is a sow that produced piglets. Imelda wishes to borrow a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of her sow and piglets.

She hopes to continuously manage the operation of her livestock business. In this way, she could obtain continuous growth of her income so she could provide her family basic commodities.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of her sow and piglets.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Guillermina; la socia continua con su negocio de venta de verduras y flores, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende su mercadería en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Cusco, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras como tomates, cebollas entre otros.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Santa Rosita de Ayllupampa" communal bank. The bank is located in the Urubamba district of the Urubamba province, which is within the Cusco region.

The member is Señora Guillermina; she still has her vegetable and flower sales business. She has operated this business for a good deal of time, and it's going well, thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. She sells her merchandise in one of the markets of the city of Cusco. She is a responsible and determined person, which is how she is able to provide for her family.

The member is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables like tomatoes, onions, and others. She is happy about the loan and she promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables like tomatoes, onions, and more.

loans.name: Keziah

texts.en:
Keziah is a married woman. She has nine children. She describes herself as innovative. 

She operates a grocery store where she sells tomatoes, fruits and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a competitive area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of capital. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to add stock of tomatoes, fruits and other vegetables. Her business goal is to have a big grocery shop within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to add more stock.

loans.use: to add stock of tomatoes, fruits and other vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Nely

texts.en:
At her age of 53, Nely still dreams of a prosperous life. She became a widow 18 years ago and has four children. With her deep faith to our great Creator, she has successfully kept her four children in school and all graduated with degrees.
 
To make a living, Nely cooks food for meals and runs a small general store. She has to strive harder to meet her adopted grandchild's needs. Nely is wishing for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy drinks and some grocery items to sell in her store. She hopes to increase her income in the business.

loans.use: to buy drinks and some grocery items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie, age 30, is married and lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. PMPC supported her by providing the capital to start her pig raising business. She sold one pig at a time, helping the family survive. She gives her best efforts to raise good pigs in order to sell them continuously. 

Rosie is now trying to expand her pig business. She presented her project proposal to Paglaum MPC to finance the project and has applied for a loan of PHP 14,900. She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs. In addition, she wanted her business to be well known and to build a good business management for her loyal customers. 

With her extra income, she wishes to send all her children to school so they may have stable careers.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for the growing number of pigs.

location.town: Oroquieta-Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Zaven

texts.en:
Zaven and his family live in Vanadzor city. He has a son who studies at the Armenian State University of Economics in the Department of Marketing and Business Organization.  The son is already in the last fourth course in a paid division. 

Zaven at this moment works as a driver at one of the local private companies, but his salary is not enough both for his family needs and for paying his son’s tuition.  This will be Zaven’s second deal with Kiva (the first loan amount he also needed for his son’s education payment). 

Zaven asks a loan of AMD 280,000 for paying his son’s tuition fee. (The thing is that the fee is more than the loan amount, but since Zaven’s son has a newborn baby, the University is going to give a discount to the young father.)

loans.use: to pay his son’s tuition fee

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina works hard to support her family. Cristina is married and has a business buying and selling coconut wine in the Philippines.

Cristina requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy more coconut wine to sell.

Cristina has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Cristina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy works hard to support her family. Juvy is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Juvy requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, chips, can goods, bread, etc.

Juvy has been in this business for 3 years now,.

In the future, Juvy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, chips, can goods, bread, etc.

loans.name: Alexis Edenilson

texts.es:
Alexis de 21 años de edad, quien solo estudio hasta el tercer grado, trabaja de corralero en una hacienda cerca de su casa, actualmente vive con su compañera de vida, con la cual llevan 2 años de estar juntos y su hijo de 1 año de edad.


Él lleva más de 6 años dedicándose al trabajo de corralero,  aprendió el manejo de una hacienda en su casa con su papá que siempre le ha gustado tener animales, y junto a su papá, se dedicaba la cuido y ordeño de las vacas que tenían; ya que no estudio se dedicó de pequeño a ayudarle a su papá con el trabajo agrícola y de esa manera aprendió el movimiento de cómo cuidar animales. 

El préstamo que está solicitando a Fundación Campo, es  para la reparación de su casa, ya que está hecha de adobe y por las lluvias se le está lavando, por lo cual necesita el dinero para comprar 20 bolsas de cemento, ladrillos, 1 camionada de arena, y el restante para el pago de la mano de obra. 

Tiene como primer sueño reparar su casa y gracias al crédito, que se le está otorgando lograra cumplir ese sueño, posteriormente tiene planeado, que en un futuro su familia tengas las mejores condiciones que no les falte nada dentro de su hogar, y que su hijo pueda estudiar ya que él no lo pudo hacer,  quiere que su hijo y sus futuros hijos  se superen y salga adelante con una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Alexis is 21 years old and only studied as far as third grade. He works as a ranch hand in a farm near his house and currently lives with his partner. They have been together for 2 years and have a 1-year-old son. Alexis has been working as a ranch hand for more than 6 years. He learnt the business of looking after a farm at home from his father who has always liked to keep animals. He worked alongside his father looking after and milking the cows that they had. Since he wasn't going to school he helped his father with the farm work from a young age and so learnt the ways of looking after animals.

The loan he is asking for from Fundación Campo is to repair his house, which is made of adobe and is being washed away by the rain. He needs the money to buy 20 bags of cement, bricks and a lorryload of sand and the rest is to pay for labour.

His first big dream is to repair his house and thanks to the loan he is being given he will be able to fulfil this dream. After that his plans for the future are for his family to have better living conditions and not have to go without anything in the home. He hopes his son will be able to study, as he was unable to do, and he wants his son and future children to better themselves and get on in life with a university degree.

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of sand, bricks, a lorryload of sand and to pay for labour, for repairing his house.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel  es un hombre de 51 años, es casado, procreo cuatro hijos, de los cuales tres viven con él. Lastimosamente no asistió a la escuela,  su esposa no trabaja, se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Él es agricultor, trabajo que aprendió de su padre, además de granos básicos cultiva café,  nunca ha tenido otro negocio viaja a pie hasta donde trabaja, solo un hijo le ayuda con el trabajo  de  seis de la mañana a doce del día. 


El crédito lo necesita para repellar la casa, ya que tiene arena y cemento, pero cancelara la mano de obra, y comprara otras bolsas de cemento.

Piensa seguir cultivando maíz y café, piensa que sus hijos mejoraran ya que piensa apoyarlos en el estudio para poder salir adelante, cree que a futuro le hará el piso a la casa para que esta se vea mejor.
texts.en:
Isabel is a 51-year-old man, married and has four children, three of them living with him. Unfortunately, he did not go to school. His wife takes care of the household chores.

He works in agriculture, an activity he learned from his father. Besides grains, he also grows coffee. He has never had an additional activity. He walks to the place where he works. One of his children helps him, from 6 am to 12 pm.

He is requesting a loan to plaster the walls of his house. He has sand and cement, but will pay for the labor and buy more bags of cement.

Isabel will continue growing corn and coffee. He believes his children will be better off, since he will support their education so they can get ahead. In the future, he would like to install the floor in his house to improve the way it looks.

loans.use: to plaster the walls of his house and pay for the labor.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La socia Fortunata pertenece al banco comunal SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA,la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de chicha de jora y a la vez también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, la socia cria a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de alimentos y cuyes.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Fortunata is a member of the SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA communal bank. She alternates her daily tasks with her business buying and selling 'chicha de jora' [a drink made from fermented corn] and also rears small animals. She raises the animals in order to sell them to her customers who ask for them. She enjoys working in this business, which is going well for her because of the effort she puts into it every day.

Fortunata is asking for the loan to buy food and guinea pigs. She is grateful for the loan provided and promises to meet her agreed repayments.

loans.use: to buy food and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Noraly Aymet

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; La socia es la Sra. Noraly Aymet; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Noraly Aymet belongs to the “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA” communal bank. She alternates her daily tasks with her business raising animals such as guinea pigs. She rears these small animals to then sell to her customers who ask for them. Noraly Aymet is responsible and persevering and this is how she manages to bring up her family. She wants to carry on doing this work so she can continue to support her family.

Noraly Amylet is asking for the loan to buy guinea pigs. She is happy to be getting the loan and promises to pay her instalments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel is from Dulapo, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old and is married. 

In 2011, Ethel applied for her membership with PMPC.  Hearing about all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Ethel is asking a financial assistance of PHP 9,000 to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store business. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and expand her business.  She has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store business

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 47 years old, married, and has eight children, one of whom attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilou has a fishing business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 26 years. 

Marilou is requesting a loan from NWTF for 6,000 PHP, which she will use to buy materials such as wood, bamboo, and paints to repair her fishing boat. In the future, Marilou would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as wood, bamboo, and paints to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard is 49 years old and she lives in the village Aramus, which is in the Gegharkunik region. She is married and she has a daughter and a son. Her son is already married and he lives with his family in the Russian Federation. Unfortunately, Alavard’s husband is disabled and he is feeble, so all the work connected with their farm and family care is on Alvard’s fragile shoulders and the only person who, from time to time, helps Alvard is her daughter. 

For several years, Alvard worked as a cook, then she worked as a carpet maker, but now the only income for her family she receives is from farming. She has two cows, two heifers, eight sheep, and twenty chickens. She also cultivates potatoes and carrots. By the way, the village of Aramus is very famous of its sweet and perfect carrots. At the local wholesale market, Alvard sells her farm products: meat, dairy products, and eggs.

Alvard asks for a loan of AMD 400,000 (Armenian drams) in order to buy a lot of animal fodder for the coming cold, winter months.

loans.use: to buy a lot of animal fodder for the coming cold, winter months.

loans.name: Russel

texts.en:
Russel works hard to support her family. Russel is married and has a business buying and selling purified water in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now.  

Russel requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of purified water to sell.

In the future, Russel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of purified water to sell.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en: Boniface is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail shop where he sells sugar, washing soap, cereals and other household goods. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of sugar, washing soap and other household goods. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of sugar, washing soap and other household goods

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 31 years old, married and has two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rosemarie runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Rosemarie requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, spices, soap, eggs, milk, bread, etc.

In the future Rosemarie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, spices, soap, eggs, milk, bread, etc.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine operates a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. Here again she comes to you requesting for a loan of KES 50,000 as she wants to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 38 years old and married. She lives in Poblacion 2, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.
