She hopes this loan will make her living better, and she hopes to send their children to school.

loans.use: to buy household supplies for her family

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: En

texts.en:
En is 57 years old and a married mother of seven children. She lives with her two dependent children in her own house, while the other five have settled down with their families. She works in agriculture, growing rice in paddy fields in Kampong Thom province, and also works as a day laborer. En knows that it’s not easy to get ahead in life, but she is always seeking opportunities that will give her a better life.

En wants to help her employed children with a transportation they need for daily commuting. Because of the lack of funds, she has applied for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 to buy a used motorcycle, which will enables them to work on time and without paying on taxi service daily. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle for her children.

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en: Donatha is 45 years old. She is married to a farmer and has six children. She wants to take a loan to buy more bananas for making locally produced beers. She has a plan to generate savings from the business and expand business volume.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to make more locally produced beers for sale.

loans.name: Churek

texts.ru: Чурек 52 года, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает 4 детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Чурек - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Чурек занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Чурек, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь. Дополнительным доходом являются денежные переводы сына, который находится на заработках  в России.  Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Чурек обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков с дальнейшим откормом. Доходы от кредита Чурек планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на улучшение материального состояния своих детей.
texts.en:
Churek is 52 years old.  After the death of her husband, she has been raising their 4 children and running the household on her own.  Churek has secondary specialized education.  Her family's main source of income is raising of livestock, a business that she started 10 years ago with a purchase of cattle for 5,000 KGS.  Thanks to Churek's hard work, her household now has two milking cows and one horse.  Her son supplements the income by working abroad, in Russia, as a translator.  Her entire monthly income is 15,000 KGS.  

In order to expand her business, Churek applied to the microfinance bank of Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 130,000 KGS, to purchase calves.  Churek plans to re-invest some of the profits back into her business by purchasing additional livestock and save the rest with the goal of improving her childrens' financial situations.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.en:
Bernarda is 61 years old and married, with five children. 

Bernarda is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 19,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional livestock for her business.

Bernarda has been buying and selling livestock for 15 years now and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock for her business.

loans.name: Saingry's Group

texts.en:
Saingry, 28, is married and has three children. She resides in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district, in Battambang province. One of her children is in school. To support the family, she has been farming rice for three years, while her husband works as a paid worker for others. Together, they can earn about KHR50,000 per day and can save about KHR20,000 each day, for future needs.
 
Saingry’s group consists of two members, who are both female. Saingry has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles. She completely paid back the previous loans to VisionFund, and she successfully used the loans to better support her family. She and her group member are applying for a new loan. Saingry will use her portion of the loan funds to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland. She hopes to reap more rice, to increase her family’s income and make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland

loans.name: Niña Charry

texts.en:
Niña Charry is 29 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Niña Charry is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Niña Charry has been farming rice for six years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Soern's Group

texts.en:
Soern is a citizen from a rural village located in the Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district. She is 48 years old and married with two children. For the last ten years, she has been selling grocery items and raising ducks and chickens. With the current business, she can earn about KHR85,000 per day and can save about KHR20,000 each day for the future needs.
Soern is just with VisionFund for this this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Soern is going to use her portion to buy chicken and ducks feeds to nourish them and use a portion of it to spend buying grocery items for resale. She hopes to fatten her chickens and ducks so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy chicken and duck feed for nourishment

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es:
Ana de 47 años, estudio hasta 4 grado,  esta soltera actualmente,  pues hace 9 años que se separó del esposo de ella. 

Es madre de cuatro hijos, los cuales aún viven con ella, 3 de ellos trabajan y uno estudia  en casa de ella.

Ana se dedica al comercio, tiene un pequeño puesto fuera de su casa donde vende refrescos, enchiladas, nuégados, pasteles de masa con papas. Se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace 4 años, decidió dedicarse a eso porque fue la única forma de ayudar a su familia; luego que se separara del esposo. Antes de dedicarse a esta actividad, realizaba los oficios domésticos en casas de la colonia, dónde le pagaban por sus servicios aún tiene esta entrada de dinero; pero es de medio tiempo.  

Ana necesita el dinero, para ayudar a su hija menor a graduarse  la universidad.  Ella no tiene la posibilidad de adquirir el dinero suficiente para solventar los gastos de graduación. Ella pagara la parte final de la tesis de graduación y comprara los insumos necesarios para el acto de graduación.

Desea seguir luchando fuerte, por sus hijos aunque ya son grandes, ella espera verlos triunfar y lograr sus sueños y cuando pueda ayudarlos en lo que necesitan, ese es su sueño para su familia.

Un día pretende instalar su  propio negocio en su casa,  para ya no salir a trabajar lejos y poder ayudar de mejor manera no solo a sus hijos sino a su demás familia.
texts.en:
Ana, 47, completed fourth grade.  She’s currently single for she separated from her husband nine years ago.  She’s mother of four children that still live with her; three of them work and one attends school.

Ana’s a merchant.  She has a small stand outside her house where she sells refreshments, enchiladas, fried cassava balls, potato turnovers.  She’s been in this activity four years and decided to go into this because it was the only way to help her family after her separation from her husband.  Before going into this business she worked as a domestic employee in houses in the neighborhood earning a salary for her services.  She still has this source of income but it’s only half-time.

Ana needs the money to help her youngest daughter graduate university.  She’s unable to get enough money to cover graduation costs.  She will pay the final graduation thesis costs and will buy the necessary things for the graduation ceremony.

She wants to continue working hard for her children even though they are grown up already.  She hopes to see them succeed and reach their dreams and to help them whenever she can; this is her dream for her family.

One day, she intends to open her own home-based business to not have to go out to work far away anymore and to be able to better help not just her children but the rest of her family too.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's final thesis costs and graduation fees.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente reside en la zona de Isla en Guayaquil.  Empezó con esta actividad de venta de dulces desde hace 3 años, cuando sufrió el despido de la empresa donde trabajaba.  Le agrada mucho lo que hace ahora, dado que si puede ver las ganancias día a día.  Trabaja solo, todos los días, de 12 a 8 pm.  Es viudo y tiene un hijo que ya es mayor de edad.  Desea a futuro, poder conseguir un local comercial en el cual pueda distribuir los productos que vende y también dar trabajo a otras personas con condiciones, para mejorar los estilos de vida suyo y de todos.  De igual forma, le gustaría poder formar una familia y casarse.  Ahora necesita el dinero del crédito para la compra de confites para su venta.
texts.en: This client lives in Guayaquil’s Isla zone.  He started selling sweets three years ago when he was laid off at the firm where he was employed.  He enjoys what he does now because he earns daily profits.  He works alone every day from noon to 8pm.  He’s a widower with an adult son.  In future, he wants to be able to get a commercial site to distribute the goods he sells and also to provide employment to others in similar conditions to improve his and all of their lives.  Similarly, he’d like to get married and form a family.  He needs the loan money to buy sweets to sell.

loans.use: to buy sweets.

loans.name: Ingrid Xiomara

texts.es:
Ingrid de 22 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Solo pudo estudiar hasta bachillerato. En su casa convive solo con su abuela y no tiene a nadie que dependa de ella.

Ingrid se dedica al comercio y distribución de tambos de gas propano, tiene un año trabajando de esta forma. Adquirió la experiencia necesaria, cuando trabajo para una empresa que se dedicaba a lo mismo. Hoy en día es su única fuente de ingreso. El producto lo llegan a dejar cerca de su casa los distribuidores, y ella se encarga después de distribuirlo en la zona con el apoyo de un amigo.

El préstamo será utilizado, para comprar 100 tambos de gas propano y así satisfacer toda la demanda de la zona, al ser una persona con visión al futuro, espera obtener mejores ingresos y así algún día establecer una tienda formal que venda productos de primera necesidad y también comprar una motocicleta para repartir el producto.
texts.en:
Ingrid, 22, is single and has no children. She was only able to study through high school. She lives with her grandmother and doesn’t have any dependents.

Ingrid makes a living selling and distributing tanks of propane gas. She’s been doing this kind of work for one year. She gained the necessary experience when she worked for a company doing the same kind of thing. Today, that is her only source of income. The products are delivered to her home. Then, she is in charge of distributing them in the area with the help of a friend.

This loan will be used to buy 100 tanks of propane gas to meet the demand in the area. Ingrid is a forward-thinking person; she hopes to obtain more income to some day start up a formal store that sells essential products and also to buy a motorcycle to deliver the products.

loans.use: to buy 100 tanks of propane gas.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La socia Lucia se sigue dedicando al negocio de siembra y cosecha de verduras,la socia vende las verduras en los diferentes mercadosla socia vende zanahorias,tomates,zapallos entre otras verduras,la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las verduras.La socia solicita el credito para comprar semillas.

La socia esta feliz ocn el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Lucia continues growing and harvesting vegetables that she sells in various markets.  She sells carrots, tomatoes and squash, among others.  She works from 7am until 5pm and has been in this business several years.  Her dream is to have a locale in which to sell the vegetables.  She’s requesting the loan to buy seeds.  She’s happy with the loan and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy seed.

loans.name: Purificacion

texts.es:
La socia Purificacion se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura y crianza de animales como cuyes y gallinas y la socia tambien siembra verduras como repollo,choclos,zanahorias y zapallos,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de agricultura y crianza de animales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los animales.

La socia esta feliz con el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Purificación continues working in agriculture and raising animals like guinea pigs and chickens.  She also grows vegetables like cabbage, corn, carrots and squash.  She works from 8am until 6pm and has been doing very well in business for 7 years.  Her dream is to expand the vegetable and animal sales and she’s asking for the loan to buy guinea pigs, chicks and feed for them.  She’s happy with the loan and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chicks and feed for them.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
This is Ramona. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy ingredients needed to make dish-washing liquid. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy more ingredients needed to make dish-washing liquid. The more items displayed at the store the better as more items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Ramona hopes to be more successful in her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients needed for making dish-washing liquid for her business.

loans.name: Mizuka Youth Group

texts.en:
Mizuka Youth Group is composed of young people who are passionate about football. Upon winning numerous local trophies, the youth decided to embark on economic activities that will make them self-sufficient. As a result they started growing and selling vegetables, distributing water, and showing movie screenings. Antony, on the far left, has a passion for football and is married with one child. His desire is to see football players have decent lives after their professional career is over, and he believes that is possible through entrepreneurship. 

Last year, the group successfully completed a Junior Achievement entrepreneurship program where the program built their capability to grow and expand their businesses. Upon graduation the group carried out market research and observed the demand for rabbit meat within their community. Antony and his fellow group members hope to take a loan to start a rabbit rearing business which will supplement the group's vegetable and water business and will increase their realized income.

loans.use: to purchase materials required to build a rabbit rearing unit and rabbits

loans.name: José Luís

texts.es:
José de 39 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene 4 hijos, Héctor de 11 años de edad, José de 7 años de edad, Elmer de 5 años de edad y Alonso de 2 años de edad; solo el menor de sus hijos no estudia. Él estudio hasta 2° grado y todos dependen de sus ingresos.

José comercializa pollos de engorde, encuba los huevos hasta los 22 días y después de nacidos los alimenta y vacuna por 7 semanas hasta que alcancen el peso de venta. Todo lo que sabe lo aprendió de su hermano, quine fue capacitado por la fundación CAMPO. También es agricultor, trabaja con granos básicos, pero su principal y más grande fuente de ingresos es la venta del pollo.

El Préstamo será utilizado en la compra de 3 sacos de concentrado de crecimiento para pollo, 4 quintales de formula, insecticida y abono foliar para sembrar frijol.

José tiene como meta, darle el estudio completo a sus hijos ya que es un privilegio que él no pudo tener, quiere comprar un medio de transporte para movilizarse con sus aves y venderlas, además de comprar sus insumos, también espera poder hacer unas reparaciones en su casa.
texts.en:
José is 39 years old and has a partner and four children: Hector, 11; Jose, 7; Elmer, 5; and Alonso, 2. Only the youngest of his children does not go to school. José studied until the 2nd grade. His family depends on him for income. 

José sells chickens reared for meat. He incubates the eggs for 22 days, then feeds and vaccinates them over seven weeks, when they reach a good weight for sale. He learned this business from his brother, who was trained by the CAMPO foundation. José is also a farmer; he grows basic grains, but his primary source of income is from selling chickens. 

The loan requested will be used to purchase three bags of chicken feed, 400 lbs of fertilizer, insecticide, and a nutrient spray for growing beans. 

José's goal is that his children complete their education, a privilege that he didn't have. He would like to buy a means of transport in order to sell the chickens and purchase supplies. He also hopes to be able to make some improvements in his house.

loans.use: to buy 3 bags of chicken feed, about 400 lbs of "18-46-0" fertilizer, insecticide, and nutrient spray to grow beans.

loans.name: Jose Rogelio

texts.es: José es originario de la Cuidad de León, un joven humilde y emprendedor de 28 años de edad, estudiante de la carrera de Ingeniería Civil. El con dedicación y esfuerzo quiere ser un hombre de provecho. Su meta es obtener su título universitario y ayudar a su familia económicamente. Solicita el crédito para pagar el curso de titulación  y alcanzar su anhelo de graduarse y empezar su futuro como profesional. Estima que este crédito será de mucha ayuda ya que lograra su sueño y mejorara su calidad de vida.
texts.en: José is from the city of León. He’s a humble, enterprising, 28-year-old man studying Civil Engineering.  With dedication and effort he wants to become a successful man.  His goal is to get his university degree and help his family economically.  He’s requesting the loan to pay for his final course and reach his goal of graduating and starting on his future as a professional.  He believes that this loan will be of much help for him because he’ll reach his dream and will improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to pay final course fees.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia Josefina nació en el centro poblado de Huayocari del distrito de Huayllabamba,la socia pertenece al banco comunal PRO MUJER DE HUAYOCARI,la socia continua dedicándose a la agricultura y ganaderia,la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de fertilizantes y abono para su chacra.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Josefina was born in the populated settlement of Huayocari in Huayllabamba District.  She belongs to the Pro Mujer de Huayocari communal bank.  She continues working in agriculture and raising livestock.  She’s been in this business for some time and does well thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day.  She wants to be able to continue working to continue supporting her family this way.  She requests the loan to buy fertilizer and manure for her field.  She’s grateful for the granted loan and commits to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Yerson Alfredo

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia y agricultura,el socio los ganados los hece engordar y crecer y luego los vende en diferentes ferias y el socio en sus terrenos siembra maiz y papa,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es ampliar sus pequeños negocios de agricultura y ganaderia.El socio solicita el credito para comprar ganados y alimentos para los ganados.

EL socio esta contento con el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This member continues in the cattle-raising and agriculture business.  He fattens up the cattle, makes them grow and then sells them in various livestock fairs.  He grows corn and potatoes on his land.  He’s been in business several years and does very well.  His dream is to expand his small agricultural and animal husbandry businesses.  He’s asking for the loan to buy cattle and cattle feed.  He’s happy with the loan and commits to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy cattle and cattle feed.

loans.name: Merling Margarita

texts.es: Merling es originaria de la ciudad de León, estudiante universitaria de la carrera de Contaduría pública y finanzas. De 21 años de edad, casada y madre de un hijo el cual tiene a su cargo y ha sacado adelante junto a su esposo y familia. Ella con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado estudiar, hoy en día cursa el último año de su carrera. Solicita este crédito para pagar su curso de titulación con el fin de ser una profesional con éxito. Su meta es poder graduarse y así brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Merling’s from the city of León.  She’s a university student majoring in Public Accounting and Finance.  She’s 21-years-old, married and mother of a son who she cares for and is raising alongside her husband and family.  With much effort and dedication she’s been able to study and is currently in the final year of her career.  She’s asking for this loan to pay for her final course in order to become a successful professional.  Her goal is to be able to graduate in order to provide better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to pay final course costs.

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is a 39-year-old married man living in the Tsalka District with his wife and four school-age children. Levan rents out two perforators (construction tool) and this rent is the only income for this large family.  

Levan owns a car and plans to use it as a taxi and start a business, but he needs money to change his car’s fuel system. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative of Kiva and MFO, permitting the vulnerable poor to start or re-start businesses. A loan of $1,100 will help Levan to pay for changing his car's fuel system from petrol to natural gas, which is cheaper than petrol and will reduce the cost of transportation by 40 to 45 percent. This will allow Levan to offer cheap service to his customers and attract them. 

With this Startup loan, Levan will start a taxi business and generate income for covering food and everyday expenses. The increased income will be used for his family's wellbeing.

loans.use: to change the fuel system of his car and start a taxi business

loans.name: Jitahidi Youth Group

texts.en: Jitahidi Youth Group was formed when a group of young people who were in the business of garbage collection decided to come together to provide socio-economic support to each other. As a result, the group established a merry-go round where they would provide micro loans and emergency loans to its members. Joseph, on the far right, is a single father raising a child with the help of his parents. He has successfully completed training on life skills, and he hopes to use the loan in starting a poultry business. The group was identified by Junior Achievement and they are currently undergoing an entrepreneurship program with the objective of building their capacity to grow and expand their businesses. Through market research the group has seen the opportunity for selling eggs and chickens in the community and have already constructed a brooder for their venture. Through mentoring from Junior Achievement, the group will be able to embark on a poultry business and be successful, given the demand for the product and the newly acquired business skills that the members of the group have.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed for chicks to start a poultry business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the school fees of her daughter for the four years

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.ru: Исмоил трудолюбивый и честный человек. Ему 48 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Исмоил имеет высшее образование по специальности экономиста. Он работал во многих местах после окончания университета. Данное время он работает заместителем директора в частном санатории. Он выполняет свою работу отлично и поэтому его коллеги очень уважают его. Исмоил хочет, чтобы его дети получили высшее образование. Его дочь Нодира учится в Российско-Таджикском университете. Нодира учится на втором курсе. Она является одной из успешных студентов. Нодира планирует продолжать свою учебу после окончания университета в магистратуре. Исмоил должен оплатить за учебный договор своей дочери и с такой целью он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Ismoil is a hard-working and an honest man.  He is 48 years old, married and has three children.  Ismoil has a university education in economics.  After graduating from the university, he worked in a variety of places.  Currently, he is working as a deputy director at a private nursing home.  He performs his job perfectly and his colleagues respect him for it.  Ismoil wants his children to receive university education as well.  

His daughter, Nodira, is studying at the Russian-Tajik Slavonic University.  Nodira is a sophomore.  She is one of the best students at her school.  After graduating from the university, Nodira is planning to continue on to study for a Masters degree.  Ismoil is asking for a loan to pay for his daughter's tuition costs.  He is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for his daughter's university education

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
La socia Nicolasa pertenece al banco comunal PRO MUJER DE HUAYOCARI,la socia continua dedicándose a la agricultura la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a esta actividad el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, a la vez la socia continua dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Nicolasa belongs to the Pro Mujer de Huayocari communal bank and continues working in agriculture.  She’s been in this activity for some time and does well thanks to the daily effort she puts into her business.  She also continues raising small animals.  She’s a responsible, hardworking person who supports her family this way.  She’s asking for the loan to buy guinea pigs for her business.  She feels grateful for the granted loan and commits to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; La socia es la Sra. Gladys; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cuyes y pollos, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes para su negocio. 
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Santa Rosita de Ayllupampa" communal bank. Her name is Gladys. She has a business selling guinea pigs and chickens. She raises these small animals and later sells them to the customers that request them. She has been working in this business for a good amount of time and it is going well, thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day.

She is a responsible and diligent person, which helps her to move her family forward.

Gladys requests this loan so that she can purchase guinea pigs for her business. She feels fortunate to get the loan and she promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine is 41 years old. She is married with four children. She has been in the business of selling foodstuffs for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cassava and sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more cassava and sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita, a 57-year-old woman, is from Ozamiz City; she is married and blessed with six children. 

From her desire to help the family, aside from corn production she has engaged in firewood vending to earn additional income for her living. Her family has been in this business activity for 10 years already as their main source of income. 

In 2010, she became an active member of Paglaum MPC with good credit standing. She enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. And now, she wants to obtain financial assistance in the amount of Php 15,000. This loan is intended for land redemption to acquire more space of land for corn production. The income from her business will be the pay-off for the loan she requested from PMPC. She dreams of nothing more than to have a  happy and healthy life with her family and an adequate income out of her business.

Rosita deeply wishes to remain a member in good standing with PMPC and repay her obligations in a timely manner.

loans.use: to redeem farmland

loans.name: Banzi

texts.en:
Banzi operates a retail selling business,  selling from home to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of theft in his business. 

With the loan he is requesting he wants to purchase sacks of rice, wheat flour and sugar for resale. He dreams of expanding his business to earn more income in the future and he appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice, wheat flour and sugar for resale

loans.name: Luis Felipe

texts.es: Luis desde hace aproximadamente 10 años se dedica a trabajar de manera independiente en su propio negocio. Inicialmente montó una pequeña cafetería pero con el paso del tiempo, su clientela fue solicitando nuevos productos y esto le ha permitido hacer crecer su negocio hasta lo que es hoy en día. Trabaja solo todos los días de la semana, pero en algunos días del mes, debe contratar a una persona que le colabore. El cliente es un hombre trabajador y pujante, con el ánimo de superarse día a día busca nuevas opciones que le permitan hacerlo, por eso se motiva a solicitar el préstamo, pues desea comprar surtido al por mayor (gaseosas, mecato, galletería, jugos, café, confitería, entre otros), así se abastecerá para la temporada de navidad que se aproxima, tiempo en el que las vitrinas deben estar bien surtidas para satisfacer la alta demanda de sus clientes.  Luis dice que quiere seguir trabajando aunque su labor es muy esclavizante, pero lo motiva las ganas que tiene de cumplir el sueño de tener su casa propia, para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
For about ten years Luis has been working independently in his own business.  Initially he set up a small snack bar but as time passed his clientele started requesting new products which has led to his business’ growth to what it’s become today.  

He works alone every day of the week but on some days of the month hires a helper.  He’s a hardworking, driven man who very much wants to improve every day and seeks ways to do so.  This is what motivates him to seek the loan because he wants to buy stock (soft-drinks, packaged snacks, cookies and crackers, juices, coffee, sweets, etc.) at wholesale to stock up for the approaching Christmas season when display cases need to be well-stocked to meet customer demand.

Luis says that he wants to continue working even though his work is very demanding but he want to continue motivated by his wish to reach his dream of owning a house to improve his living conditions and well-being.

loans.use: to buy stock at wholesale.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
This is Marife. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for a 19,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her child’s education and cover their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marife hopes to have more customers and dreams that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine works hard to support her family. Geraldine is married and has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines.

Geraldine requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell.

Geraldine has been in this business for five years now. In the future, Geraldine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente reside en el sector de Isla en Guayaquil.  Empezó tiempo atrás cuando se capacitó en una fundación para no videntes.  Luego comenzó con la producción de productos químicos y le ha ido muy bien hasta ahora.  Posteriormente también emprendió con la venta de bebidas desde su hogar, como agua y malta.  Trabaja sola, todos los días, de 8 am a 10 pm.  Es viuda y tiene 3 hijos, quienes son todos mayores de edad.  A futuro, le gustaría poder comprarse un vehículo para poder movilizarse y también tener un local para distribuir los productos que elabora.  Por el momento, necesita el crédito para la compra de químicos y bebidas para su comercialización.
texts.en: This client is from Guayaquil’s Isla sector.  She started out some time ago after getting training  at a foundation for the visually impaired.  She started producing chemicals and has done very well to date.  Later on she also started selling beverages like milk and malt at home.  She works alone every day from 8am to 10pm.  She’s a widow with three adult children.  In future, she’d like to be able to buy a vehicle to get around in and also to have a locale in which to sell the products she makes.  For the moment, she needs the loan to buy chemicals and beverages to sell.

loans.use: to buy chemicals and beverages.

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 34-year-old Grace from Mutare. She is married with two children and one is attending school. She also cares for one other dependent. Grace runs a sewing business producing wedding gowns. The business has been in operation for seven years. She says the main challenges faced are low demand in winter seasons and stiff competition. 

Grace has requested a loan of $600 to buy material for sewing gowns. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve general family welfare. In the future Grace plans to operate a big company with at least five employees. Grace is a member of Ebenezer group.

loans.use: to buy materials for sewing wedding gowns and decorations

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh, who is 38 years old, is married and has three children, one son and two daughters. Her husband is a driver for hire. 

She supports her family through the income she earns from selling rice. She has been in this business for eight years. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Anh intends to take a loan to increase her working capital and buy a larger quantity of rice to stock her store. The additional capital will enable her to increase her sales.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more rice to stock her store.

loans.name: Mimoza

texts.en:
Mimoza is photographed here in front of the existing stable that she wants to rebuild and she is seeking lenders help in this regard. A total amount of 300,000 Albanian Lek will help her achieve the goal.

Mimoza is in her mid-forties and married; she has four children who are still attending primary and secondary school. For the past twenty years she has been running her own little agricultural activity,  selling dairy and veggies to local people. The place where she resides and of course runs her activity is in the very rural northern Albania in an area that is been prone to flooding for years now. Most of the times when these catastrophic disasters take place, farmers unfortunately don’t get any help from the government. It is said, though, that the new government will take precautionary measures to prevent these disasters happening.

loans.use: to rebuild an existing stable

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es: Ana tiene 22 años de edad, ella es estudiante de la ciudad de Chinandega, es una joven de escaso recursos; con mucho esfuerzo y perseverancia  ha salido adelante. Tiene el apoyo de su familia. Su Sueño es graduarse y ser una profesional de provecho, con valores y deseo de superación. Ana  quiere triunfar en la vida y apoyar a su familia ya que ellos nunca la han dejado sola en toda su vida y su mamá es la que la motiva para que cumpla sus metas propuestas. Está solicitando junto con sus padres financiamiento para pagar su curso de titulación y cumplir su mayor sueño.
texts.en: Ana, 22, is a student in the city of Chinandega.  She’s a young woman of scarce resources who with much effort and perseverance has gotten ahead.  She has her family’s support.  Her dream is to graduate and become a successful professional with values and drive for self-improvement.  Ana wants to succeed in life and to support her family since they’ve stood by her always her entire life; he mother motivates her to reach her set goals.  She and her parents are asking for this loan to pay for her final course to reach her greatest dream.

loans.use: to pay her final course costs.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El socio Miguel pertenece al banco comunal PRO MUJER DE HUAYOCARI ,el socio continua dedicándose a la  ganadería y agricultura, el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día, el socio a la vez continua dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de fertilizantes y abono.

El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Miguel belongs to the Pro Mujer de Huayocari communal bank and continues working in animal husbandry and agriculture.  He’s been in this business for some time and does very well thanks to the daily effort he puts into it.  He continues raising small animals like guinea pigs and chickens.  He’s a responsible, hardworking man who supports his family this way.  He’s asked for the loan to buy fertilizer and manure.  He feels grateful for the granted loan and commits to make his payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Ernesto Walter

texts.es:
Ernesto tiene 35 años de edad, trabaja como empleado de limpieza en una pequeña empresa de su ciudad, con este trabajo puede solventar sus gastos de manutención y poder salir adelante; Ernesto cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable.

Ernesto esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que podrá comprar enseres para su vivienda como platos, vasos, entre otros y poder comprar un televisor, así podrá ir mejorando su calidad de vida y luchar por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su negocio propio”
texts.en:
Ernesto, 35, is employed in the maintenance department of a small firm in the city.  This job provides for his support and he’s able to get ahead.  He believes he does well at work because he’s very responsible.  

Ernesto is grateful to Kiva lenders because he’ll be able to buy furnishings like plates, glasses and others for his house and will also be able to buy a television set and improve his quality of life this way.  He will strive to make his great dream reality: to have a business of his own.

loans.use: to buy a television set and other furnishings.

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
This is Ruel. He previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of their Jeepney unit. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

He would now like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their Jeepney unit and also to buy some equipment for their repair shop. His profits from the business will definitely help him to cover their daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Ruel hopes to have more jeepneys and dreams that his children will finish their studies. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney (public transport vehicle).

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en: Arnold is very industrious and he looks forward to improving his life. Here again he comes to you requesting  a loan of Kshs 45,000 to purchase mechanical gadgets for his bicycle repair business. He appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase mechanical gadgets for his bicycle repair business.

loans.name: Dania Scarleth

texts.es: Dania es una joven  de 21 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Chinandega, casada y madre de un hijo. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y familia. Siendo tan joven ha luchado por cumplir su mayor sueño  de graduarse y brindarle a su hijo una vida mejor. Dania es estudiante  de una de las universidades de la ciudad y con entusiasmo y dedicación ha salido adelante, quiere en futuro ser una excelente profesional con compromiso y metas propuestas. Es emprendedora ya que sabe lo que quiere y como llegar a cumplir su sueño.  Su sueño es de tener su título e iniciar una vida profesional. Está solicitando el préstamo para pagar su curso de titulación ya que será de mucha ayuda para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dania, 21, is a young woman from the city of Chinandega.  She’s married and mother of a son.  She has her husband’s and her family’s support.  Being so young, she’s striven to reach her greatest dream of graduating to provide a better life for her son.  

Dania is a student in one of the city’s universities and with enthusiasm and dedication has gotten ahead.  She wants in future to be a successful, committed professional with set goals.  She’s an entrepreneur and knows what she wants and how to reach her dream.   Her dream is to get her degree and start her professional life.  She’s asking for a loan to pay her final course costs which will be of great help for her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to pay her final course costs.

loans.name: Kelly De Los Angeles

texts.es: Kelly es una humilde y emprendedora  joven originaria de León. De 24 años de edad y soltera.  Ella es estudiante de la carrera de Quimica y Farmacia. Desde niña ha soñado graduarse y establecer su propio negocio (Farmacia). Su meta es culminar sus estudios universitarios con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida y así ayudar económicamente a su familia ya que esta es el ejemplo de motivación para su vida. Solicita el crédito para pagar el curso de titulación. Estima que el crédito va  hacer de provecho para su vida ya que cumplirá su sueño de ser profesional.
texts.en: Kelly is a humble, young entrepreneur from León.  She’s 24-years-old and single. She’s majoring in Chemistry and Pharmacy.  She’s dreamed of graduating and opening her own pharmacy since she was little.  Her goal is to complete her university courses and improve her quality of life to also help her family economically since they’ve set the example that’s motivated her life.  She’s asking for the loan to pay her final course costs.  She believes the loan will be of use for her life for she will reach her dream of becoming a professional.

loans.use: to pay her final course costs.

loans.name: Luís Orlando

texts.es:
Luís de 32 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene 2 hijos de 8  y de 10 años de edad. En casa conviven 4 personas y todas depende de Luís.

Luís es comerciante, tiene 4 años de poseer una tiende que comercializa productos de primera necesidad y granos básicos, para solventar los gastos de su familia y la demanda de los habitantes de la comunidad.

El préstamo será invertido, en el fortalecimiento de su negocio, hay demanda en el lugar y por recurso propio no puede cubrirla, ampliara la oferta mediante la diversificación de productos (granos básicos, detergentes, bebidas, etc.)

En un futuro, tiene pensado comprar un vehículo para distribuir su producto a otras comunidades y de esa manera poder incrementar sus ingresos y dar mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
Luís, 32, has a spouse and two children aged 8 and 10.  Four people share his home and all are dependent on him.  He’s a merchant.  He’s had a store specializing in basic staples for the last four years to cover his family’s expenses and to supply his community’s needs.

The loan will be used to strengthen the business. Demand exists in the area and he’s unable to fill it with his own resources.  He will expand offer by means of product diversification (basic grains, detergent, beverages, etc.).

In future, he’s thinking about buying a vehicle to distribute his goods to other communities to increase income this way and provide his family with better conditions.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Saliou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Saliou est un homme de 33 ans qui s’active dans le commerce de produits cosmétiques et divers et  cela depuis 15 ans .Il est marié et responsable de famille.
Avec le crédit, Il va acheter  des parfums, des poudres pour bébé,des crèmes, du lait pour le corps, du beurre de karité...
Saliou prend en charges les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants mais les bénéfices lui permettent aussi de pouvoir diversifier les produits et services et d’améliorer les conditions de vie. Il commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 20h.
texts.en:
Monsieur Saliou is a 33-year-old man who has sold cosmetics and other items for 15 years. He is a married man who supports his family. With this loan, he will buy perfume, baby powders, creams, body milk, shea butter...
Saliou takes charge of the daily expenses of his family and his children's education fees, but his income also allows him to diversify his products and services and to improve his living conditions. He starts his day at 8:00 am and finishes at 8:00 pm.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is forty-four years old, married to Walter and a mother of four children. She sells groceries and cereals in Kinoo in the outskirts of Kangemi. She has been in this business for three years now and gets a monthly income of thirty thousand shillings.

This will be Damaris' fourth loan with KADET. She plans to use the entire loan to buy groceries and cereals for her business. In the future, she wants to improve her family's standard of living and also expand her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries and cereals for the grocery store

loans.name: Nempapa

texts.en:
Nempapa is 55 years old and married with 5 children. She has a hotel business and also deals in livestock selling. She has been in this business for 13 years. She gets a monthly income of 14,000 KES.

Nempapa plans to use the loan to buy more stock of hotel supplies such as rice, flour, cereals, cooking oil and milk. She also plans to use part of the loan to buy more cows which she will sell at a profit.

This is her 3rd loan and she will use her profits to buy more livestock, flour and sugar. Her future hopes and dreams are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy hotel supplies such as flour, rice and cereals.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a man with a disability but very hard-working and independent. He comes from Chiga, a sub-location in Kisumu, Kenya. Charles has a barber shop. He has been a barber for some years.

Charles gets a monthly income of KES 5,000, and has applied for his first loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase new barber equipment especially electric shavers as a way of improving his business. He will use the anticipated profit to upgrade his business by replacing the old equipment.

His dream is to grow the business to be the preferred barber shop so as to support his family fully.

loans.use: To purchase new barber equipment especially shavers

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es una joven que trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa en un mercado de su ciudad, con lo cual tiene un ingresos para poder salir adelante, ya que es madre soltera de 4 hijos.

Margarita agradece el apoyo de los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como pantalones, shorts, polos, entre otros y de esta manera poder salir adelante y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Margarita’ s a young woman working in her small clothing sales business in a market in her city; she earns income to get ahead since she’s a single mother of four children.

Margarita is grateful for the support Kiva lenders provide because thanks to it she will be able to buy merchandise like pants, shorts, shirts, etc. for her business thus getting ahead and continuing to strive to make her great dream reality: to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Nelson Adolfo

texts.es:
Nelson es un joven de 21 años el cual tiene su negocio de servicios de belleza, especialmente realiza manicure, pedicura, entre otros, Nelson es muy detallista y por ello cree que su negocio esta creciendo ya que se esfuerza mucho por mejorar cada día. 

Nelson agradece el apoyo que le brindan los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá comprar muebles, mesitas de manicure y lámparas para su negocio, especialmente para mejorar el ambiente de su local, con ello podra atraer mas clientes y mejorar sus ingresos, asi seguirá luchando por hacer realidad su sueño:” Tener un spa en su casa”.
texts.en:
Nelson, 21, is a young man with a beauty services business.  He specializes in manicure and pedicure, among others.  Nelson’s very detail oriented and believes his business is growing because he strives daily to improve it.

Nelson’s grateful for the support provided by Kiva lenders because thanks to it he will be able to buy furniture, manicure tables and lamps for his business especially to improve the locale’s environment.  With this he’ll be able to attract more customers and improve his income. He will continue striving to make his dream reality: to have a spa in his house.

loans.use: to buy furniture, lamps and tables.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
This is Margie. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Margie dreams that her business will continue to grow and flourish and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Armie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Armie works hard to support her family.

She has a paper mache business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready to wear clothing. Armie is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy raw materials like colored newspapers, magazines and paste for her business.

Armie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like colored newspapers, magazines and paste for her business

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is 24 years old, female and married. She has two children, 5 years and 1 month old, respectively, whom she supports. Dama was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET officer, and she runs a grocery business which has lasted for three years now. It is located at Miwani in Ganda. In her business she earns a monthly income of 5,600 KES (Kenyan shillings). 

She is taking her second loan of 20,000 KES, which she intends to use for adding stock to her business of vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, omenas (fish) and cabbages. Her previous loan of 10,000 KES was paid back successfully. Dama will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her business and family's future are to educate her children and have a bigger business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, omenas (a fish) and cabbages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years.

Nenita has requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like pants, blouses, curtain and other ready-to-wear clothing.

In the future, Nenita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like pants, blouses, curtain and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: José Arnoldo

texts.es:
José de 52 años de edad, esta casado y 4 tiene hijos, dos niñas y dos varones, en casa también convive con sus esposa y en las labores agrícolas le ayudan su dos hijos.

José es agricultor, tiene 40 años de experiencia trabajando y agradece a su padre quien desde pequeño lo llevo a la parcela y le enseño a trabajar y a cuidar el cultivo.

El préstamo será utilizado, para compra insumos agrícolas, fertilizantes, herbicidas y plaguicidas y otros relacionas con el cuido del cultivo de granos básicos.


Espera obtener una buena cosecha y asegurar el alimento de la familia para temporada, y si el grano tiene un buen precio vender parte de la cosecha y así obtener una buena ganancia.
texts.en:
José, 52, is married with four children, two girls and two boys; he also lives with his wife at home. His two sons help him with the agricultural chores.  

José has 40 years’ experience working and is grateful to his father who took him along to teach him to work and care for the crops when he was little

The loan will be used to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizer, herbicide, pesticide and others related to basic grain crop care.

He hopes to get a good crop yield and insure his family’s food for another season and if the grain is well-priced to sell part of his harvest to earn a good profit.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 41 years old and married. She has two children, 17 and 13 years old, whom she supports. She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer. 
Jacqueline has a retail shop which she has operated for two years.  It is located at Kibaoni. From the business, she earns a monthly income of 5,000 KES. She is taking her second loan of 10,000 KES, which she intends to use to add stock to her business by buying omo, kangas and sugar. 
Jacqueline paid back her previous loan of 10,000 KES successfully. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future are to grow her business and educate her children onto tertiary level.

loans.use: to add stock by buying omo, kangas and sugar.

loans.name: Rony Bladimir

texts.es:
Rony de 26 años de edad, esta soltero y no tiene hijos, es agricultor desde los 12 años y siempre tuvo el deseo de ayudar a su familia con los gastos de esta.

Al ver que como agricultor, no le iba tan bien como esperaba debido a los bajos precios de los granos básicos, decidió trabajar en una panadería; para ello antes recibió un taller de panificación que a la vez le acredito y facilito el empleo. Hoy en día, tiene 3 años de trabajar como panificador y al tener mejores ingresos contribuye a los ingresos de la familia.

El préstamo será utilizado, para la compra de un vehículo que beneficiara a Rony para el traslado de su vivienda al lugar de trabajo y para distribuir producto.

En un futuro, Rony espera estar solvente y con otro préstamo montar su propia panadería y distribuir su producto por sus propios medios.
texts.en:
Rony, 26, is single and has no children.  He’s been working in agriculture since the age of 12 and has always wanted to help his family with expenses this way.

Seeing that he wasn’t doing as well as expected working in agriculture because of the low prices of basic grains, he decided to work in a bakery but to do so took a baking training course that he completed and that made his getting a job easier.  Today, he’s been working as a baker for three years and earning higher income is able to contribute to his family.

The loan will be used to buy a vehicle that will make getting from home to work easier for Rony and also to distribute his products.

In future, Rony hopes to be solvent and to use another loan to open his own bakery and distribute his products by means of his own.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina, is 35 years old and a widow. She has four children, 18, 14, 10, and 7 years old, whom she supports. 
,
She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer, and she is a fish monger. She has been in her business for five years, which is located at Msoloni. In her business she earns a monthly income of KES 5,000. 

She is taking her first loan of KES 20,000, which she intends to use in adding stock to her business by buying more fish. Amina will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. 

Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family are to educate her children and live a better life.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is a private entrepreneur from the Miasnikyan village of Armavir region. She lives with her son and her school-age daughter. 

It's already more than 8 years since she runs a local store, where she sells grocery products and household goods. To be able to continue running her business in a sustainable way, Laura needs a loan of USD 2,500 to purchase new goods to resell in her store. The latter will help her to become more competitve. 

She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution, but unfortunately wasn't able to repay it back. However, thanks to her hard work during the recent times, Laura has been able to run her business in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. 

Laura and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain and develop their small business.

loans.use: to purchase new goods to resell in her store

loans.name: Nancy Miriam

texts.es:
Mirian es una mujer de 45 años, muy trabajadora, con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado tener su negocio de alquiler de trajes típicos y disfraces a domicilio, Miriam le pone mucho empeño a su negocio porque su negocio es su únicas fuente de ingresos para poder sacar adelante a su familia, ya que es madre de 2 hijos, a quienes quiere mucho.

Mirian esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que me han brindado podrá comprar mas trajes y disfraces ya que en estos meses siempre se realizan corsos y carros alegóricos, de esta manera podrá atender mejor a sus clientes y podrá mejorar sus ingresos, y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un spa y darle una profesión a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Mirian, 45, is very hardworking.  With much effort and dedication she’s succeeded in having her business leasing traditional costumes and attire.  Miriam puts much effort into her business because it’s her only source of income for family support; she’s mother of two children she loves very much.

Mirian is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she will be able to buy more costumes and traditional attire because these approaching months are filled with parades and floats and she’ll be able to provide better customer service and improve her income.  She will continue striving to make her great dream reality: to own a spa and provide professions for her children.

loans.use: to buy costumes and traditional attire.

loans.name: Jarlin Jose

texts.es: Jarlin tiene 22 años de edad, es habitante de puerto Sandino, es un joven luchador que su mayor sueño es terminar su carrera y darle ese orgullo a sus padres que tanto lo han apoyado en todo el trayecto de su vida. Él es perseverante y tiene bien claro sus objetivos propuesto para llegar alcanzarlo, quiere llegar hacer un profesional completo. Cursa el último año de la carrera de Ingeniería Industrial. Solicita el crédito para pagar su curso de titulación. Su sueño es ejercer su profesión y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jarlin, 22, lives in Puerto Sandino.  He’s a young hardworking man whose greatest dream is to finish his career and make his parents who have supported him throughout his life  proud.  He’s perseverant and has clear set goals to reach; he wants to become a complete professional.  He’s in the final year of Industrial Engineering and is asking for the loan to pay for his final course.  His dream is to practice his profession and to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to pay final course costs.

loans.name: Xochilt Maria

texts.es: Xóchitl es originaria de la ciudad de León, tiene 22 años de edad, soltera y actualmente  es estudiante de la carrera de Contaduría Pública y Finanza .Con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo ha salido adelante, gracias al  apoyo  de su familia incondicional ha logrado su sueño de terminar sus estudios. Ella se encuentra a un paso de ser profesional y cumplir su mayor sueño que es de graduarse y llegar a iniciar un futuro profesional con éxitos y perseverancia. Solicita el crédito para pagar su curso de titulación. Estima que este crédito le ayudara ya que lograr obtener su titulo.
texts.en: Xóchitl, 22, is from the city of León.  She’s single and studying Public Accounting and Finance at present.  With much effort and sacrifice she’s gotten ahead.  Thanks to her family’s unconditional support she’s succeeded in completing her studies.  She’s one step from becoming a professional and reaching her dream of graduating and starting a successful life as a professional.  She’s asking for this loan to pay her final course costs.  She believes this loan will help her for she’ll get her degree.

loans.use: to pay her final course costs.

loans.name: Elvia Cecilia

texts.es:
Elvia de 34 años de edad, esta casada y tiene una hija, es ama de casa y su esposo trabaja en construcción como albañil. Elvia trabaja, lavando ropa ajena y cuidando niños, también ayuda a su esposo en las labores agrícolas que él realiza.

El préstamo será utilizado, para comprar fertilizantes, tienen establecido una parcela de maíz que necesita ya la última fertilizada, para asegurar la cosecha y con esta obtendra el alimento para la temporada, si el grano llegara a tener buen precio, podría optar por vender parte de su cosecha y utilizar el dinero para otra actividad productiva.
texts.en:
Elvia, 34, is married and has a daughter. She’s a housewife and her husband works in construction as a bricklayer.  Elvia works taking in laundry and babysitting and also helps her husband with the agricultural chores he does.

The loan will be used to buy fertilizer.  They have a plot of corn growing that needs the final application of fertilizer to insure a good crop yield.  With it they will insure food for the season and if the corn is well-priced she will opt to sell some of the crop and use the money for some other productive activity.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a married woman with five children, one of whom is in school and the rest are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past year, Mbeyu has operated a kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 10,000 loan, Mbeyu wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Almend

texts.en:
Almend is 38 years old. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in high school. She lives in Guinabot, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. 

Almend has been engaged in a sari-sari store business for 20 years, earning a monthly income of PHP 7,000. She requested a new loan to purchase various groceries as additional capital for her grocery store and sacks of rice and corn to sell to her customers. She is also planning to be a a dried fish stockholder. 

Almend has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) since 2004. She aims high, so her business can earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase various groceries and sacks of rice and corn to sell.

loans.name: Xiomara Carolina

texts.es:
Xiomara de 25 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 2 hijos, una niña de 6 años de edad y un niño de 10 años de edad. Xiomara es ama de casa y comerciante, vende ropa, jugos, licuados y bisutería en su mayoría, su esposo trabaja en un taller de enderezado y pintura para vehículos y los fines de semana ayuda a Xiomara con la venta. Ambos mantiene la familia.

Para mantener su negocio, Xiomara viaja a la ciudad mas cercana para comprar lo que necesita, se traslada 24 km. Para llegar al lugar de comprar ya sea en autobús o vehículo particular.


El préstamo será utilizado, en la compra de ropa de ambos sexos y para todas las edades y así mantener bien equipado el negocio, ya que espera que en un futuro su negocio sea el mas fuerte de la zona.
texts.en:
Xiomara is 25 years old, married, and has two children; a daughter who is 6 and a son who is 10 years old. Xiomara is the head of household and a businesswoman. She sells cloths, juices, smoothies and jewelry and her husband works in a paint and bodyshop. On the weekends, he helps his wife with her business. They both support their family. 
To supply her business, Xiomara travels to the nearest city where she purchases what she needs, a journey of 24 kilometers. To get to where she purchases her merchandise, she takes a bus or a private car.
The loan will be used to purchase clothing for men and women of all ages and to keep her business well stocked. She hopes she will have a strong business in her area in the future.

loans.use: purchase clothing.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es:
Mauricio de 41 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene 3 hijos de 13 años de edad, 16 años de edad y 20 años de edad, todos estudian. Solo pudo estudiar hasta 6° grado.

Mauricio es comerciante de ganado, los animales los compra a clientes que ya tiene y luego los vende en la plaza donde se vende el ganado. También es agricultor y administra una tienda, todo esto lo aprendió de su abuelo, que se dedicaba exactamente a lo mismo que él hace hoye en día.

El préstamo será utilizado, para comprar ganado y después venderlo en la plaza, también comprara productos para la tienda, azúcar, aceite, detergente, bebidas, entre otros. En un futuro, espera comprar un vehículo nuevo que le facilite el traslado de animales.
texts.en:
Mauricio, 41, has a life partner. His three children, ages 13, 16, and 20, are in school. He was only able to finish 6th grade. Mauricio sells cattle, which he buys from customers and later sells during the cattle-buying season. He also farms and runs a store, all of which he learned from his grandfather, who pursued the same trades.

He will use this loan to buy cattle to resell and merchandise like sugar, oil, detergent, and beverages for his store. Someday he hopes to buy a new vehicle to transport the animals.

loans.use: to buy cattle and merchandise like sugar, oil, detergent, and beverages for his store.

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth, who is in her early 60's, is a widow with two children, a boy and a girl, both in school. Elizabeth has been selling ripe plantain for six years. She works from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. every working day, making a very good return. 

Her previous loans repaid, Elizabeth is requesting her third loan for GHS 800 from ID-Ghana to buy a big bag of plantain to sell. She used her business profits to cover school fees and household expenses and dreams that one day her children will have completed university so they can support themselves and help her. 

Eliabeth is requesting this loan with four others: Emelia sells charcoal, while Sarah, Adjetey, and Cynthia sell fish. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the entire loan amount.

loans.use: To buy a big bag of plantain to sell

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is married, with six children, all of whom are adults. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Hadija has operated a clothes-selling business for the past three years. She sells in a shop to her town dwellers, passersby, and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the KES 50,000 loan, Hadija wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.en: Bahtiyor is 30 years old. He is married and has 2 children. He has always wanted to provide them with good living conditions. His wife is a nurse in kindergarten. She has a small salary. Bahtiyor decided to start new business in order to generate an income to contribute to his home’s finances. He worked in Russia as driver. Now, he is coming back to Tajikistan and does not have a job. Because of this, he studied the course To Get Ahead’ to learn business skills. He will manage with business alone. His father and grandmother also live with him. He is asking for a loan of 3000 USD to buy Sprinter minibus. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a Sprinter minibus for his new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay coffee harvesters.

loans.name: Jose Alonzo

texts.es:
Jose es un joven de 19 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica y trabaja en su pequeño negocio de renovadora de calzado al cual le dedica alrededor de 9 horas al día, de esta manera puede tener los ingresos para poder salir adelante.

Jose está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar una maquina remalladora, con la cual podrá realizar una mejor confección del calzado, de esta manera podra mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Estudiar una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en: Jose, 19, lives in the city of Ica and works in his small shoe repair business. He works about nine hours a day to support himself. Jose thanks the Kiva lenders, whose help will let him buy an overlock machine. The machine will make his shoe repair work better, increase his earnings, and allow him to keep striving to achieve his great dream: "going to college."

loans.use: to buy an overlock machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school fees and materials for his daughter.

loans.name: Marie Gorethe

texts.en: Marie Gorethe is 29 years old. She is married with one child. She has been in the business for the past four years. With the loan, she would like to buy more animals for sale, such as goats and cattle. The profits from the business will be used to save for the better future.

loans.use: to buy more goats and cattle for sale.

loans.name: Zvikomborero Group

texts.en:
Joyce managed to buy top of the range quality fabric for tailoring. She says the business has greatly improved in that she is now able to maintain a reasonable stock for resale. Joyce says the extra income generated has helped her to a great length in paying fees for her child and looking after the family.

Joyce has requested a loan of $600 to buy more materials for the business. Joyce is a member of Zvikomborero Group.

loans.use: to buy good quality fabric.

loans.name: Lola

texts.en:
Lola is a girl from Northern Tajikistan; a small village in rural area. She has a big passion to learn and explore new things. When she came to IMON office, she seemed very upset and worried.

She needs money to continue her education, and that’s why she came and asked for loan. She is a student of the 2nd course in Khujand Statel University. Usually girls from this area are not allowed to study, but she is so motivated and inspired. She really wants to study and get a high degree. So, it’s a good person to help.

loans.use: to pay for her education.

loans.name: Surayo

texts.ru: Сурайё родилась в 1971 года. Она великодушная женщина. Сурайё замужем и на воспитании имеет 5 детей. Сурайё уже несколько лет занимается собственным бизнесом. Она торгует на местном рынке тканями. Сурайё выделяет огромное внимание на образование своих детей. Ее дочь Мафтуна учится на 1 курсе Таджикского Национального Университета по специальности юриста. Сурайё очень гордится своей дочерью. Она является спортсменкой. Мафтуна имеет 5 золотых медалей, 2 серебренных и 3 бронзовых медалей по карате-до. Сурайё должна оплатить за учебный договор своей дочери. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Surayo was born in 1971. She is a generous woman. Surayo is married and is raising five children. Surayo has had her own business for several years. She sells fabric in the local market. Surayo pays a lot of attention to the education of her children. Her daughter, Maftuna, is a freshman at the Tajik National University, majoring in law. Surayo is very proud of her daughter. Her daughter is an athlete. Maftuna has five gold medals, two silver and three bronze medals in karate-do. Surayo needs to pay her daughter's tuition. She is asking for a loan to pay tuition. She's awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: pay for her daughter's education.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es: Don Mariano es originario de la ciudad de Boaco. De 73 años de edad, casado y padre de 8 hijos, todos independientes. Es de oficio comerciante y se dedica al negocio de pulpería. A la edad de 55 años  empieza con este negocio el cual lo tuvo que establecer debido que su trabajo anterior no le generaba muchos ingresos; con mucho sacrificio y dedicación a logrado mejorar su calidad de vida. Cuenta con el apoyo de su familia. Su expectativa es prosperar en su negocio logrando mayores ventas e ingresos.
