Solicita el crédito para comprar productos como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pasta dental, jabón y golosinas con el fin de surtir su pulpería y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Su meta próxima es mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar y su plan futuro es convertir su pulpería a una miscelánea.
texts.en:
Mariano, 73, was born in the city of Boaco. He is married and has eight grown children. He is a merchant and runs a small grocery shop. He started the business when he was 55 because he didn't earn very much at his job. He improved his standard of living through sacrifice and dedication, and his family support his efforts.

He expects his business to prosper by increasing sales and income. He has applied for a loan to buy merchandise such as rice, beans, sugar, toothpaste, soap, and candy to stock his store and meet customer demand. His next goal is to renovate his house and then expand his shop and offer more variety in the future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, beans, sugar, toothpaste, soap, and candy.

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.en:
Life makes us to do different things, to feel different feelings, to be in different situations. One of our customers, Muhayo, decided to be a teacher, an English language teacher. She lives with her parents. She is 22 years old. She is not married.  She loves spending her time with kids, teaching them and looking at their achievements. 

The salary of teachers in her region is not enough to buy any big things. So Muhayo came to the CSC MDO IMON International office and asked for a loan to buy furniture because she does not have normal furniture in her house. She is asking for a loan in the amount of TJS 3,000 (somoni). She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her household.

loans.name: Salat

texts.en:
Salat is 41 years old, and a married mother of four children in school. To survive the entire family from hardship, she does paddy rice and cassava farming as the main source of income. She has occupied this business since she was 20 years old. This is the first micro-loan for Salat with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

She decided to apply for this loan to support her daughter who wants to hold a bachelor degree, specializing in Finance and Banking. She will spend this entire portion to solely pay tuition fees for her daughter. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after she graduates.

loans.use: to apply for this loan to pay tuition fees for her daughter.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Swunurai

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Swunurai from Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe, which means “he who does not sleep". She is married with one child who attends school. Swunurai runs a retail business, selling women's and men's clothes and shoes. The business has been in operation for 5 years. She says the main challenges faced are lack of working capital and high competition.

Swunurai has requested a loan of $500 to buy more clothes and shoes for resale. She says that the extra income generated as a result of this loan will enable her to pay school fees for her child. In the future, Swunurai plans to own her big fashion boutique.

loans.use: to buy more clothing for resale.

loans.name: Gloria Karina

texts.es: Gloria tiene 21 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de chinandega y estudiante universitaria de la carrera Ingenieria Industrial. Es casada, su esposo la apoya en todas las decisiones que ella toma, a pesar de su nivel económico han podido salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación para cumplir sus metas propuestas  y se siente orgullosa de lo que ha logrado hoy en día. De igual manera su familia la apoya, su mama quiere y desea que su hija sea una excelente profesional, pero primero quiere que obtenga su título; Se siente orgullosa de su hija y de lo que ha logrado. Gloria solicita el crédito  para pagar su curso de titulación  y sus metas en la vida.
texts.en: Gloria is 21, originally from the city of Chinangega and university student of industrial engineering.  She is married, her husband supports her in all decisions that she makes, in spite of their economic level they have been able to get ahead with much effort and dedication to achieve their set goals and she feels proud of what she has achieved up to today. Her family also supports her; her mom wants and wishes that her daughter becomes and excellent professional, but first, she needs to obtain her degree, she feels proud of her daughter and what she has achieved.  Gloria requests the credit to pay for her final degree course and for her goals in life.

loans.use: to pay for her final degree course.

loans.name: Nadzuwa

texts.en:
Nadzuwa is a married woman who has been blessed with three school-going children. She lives at her house, which has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rental bills.

Nadzuwa has operated a business selling charcoal, selling from home to her neighbors and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase charcoal for resale.  She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch is 63 years old and blessed with four children. She is a local citizen from Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district. 

Touch's main source of income is from dessert selling and rice farming on two hectares of farmland.  This is not the first-time loan for Touch with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  Her past loan enabled her to support the needs of her family and keep her kids in school. 

For this cycle, she is seeking a new loan in order to pay tuition for her son. She hopes that she can fulfill her son’s dream in pursuing the bachelor degree majoring in physics. 

She hopes that her son can get a good job after graduating.

loans.use: To pay tuition for her son

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Abdurahmonjon

texts.ru: Абдурахмончон холостой молодой человек в возрасте 22 лет. Почти два года Абдурахмончон работал в России. Вот уже 9 месяцев как он вернулся в свой родной район Яван. У него здесь имеется машина, но она не пригодна для работы, поскольку технически сломана. Для ремонта ему необходимо 500$. Для него это огромная сумма, но ему придется отремонтировать, чтобы начать зарабатывать и поэтому он просит эту сумму в кредит. Абдурахмончон единственное решение своей безработицы видит в предоставлении услуги такси. Он планирует перевозить пассажиров из села Явана до города Душанбе и привозить обратно. Он много времени будет проводить на дороге, но такая работа ему нравиться. Для Абдурахмона такси будет единственным доходом. Он просит Вас помочь! Он надеется на Вашу доброту и милость!
texts.en: Abdurahmonjon is a young man, 22 years old, and unemployed. Abdurahmonjon worked in Russia for nearly two years. Nine months ago, he returned to his hometown, Yavan. He has a car, but he can't use it to make a living because it is broken. He needs $500 to repair it. For him, it is a huge amount of money, but he will have to repair the car to start earning. Therefore, he is asking for that loan amount. The only solution Abdurahmonjon sees to his unemployment is driving a taxi. He plans to carry passengers from the village of Yavan to the city of Dushanbe and back again. He will spend a lot of time on the road, but he likes this kind of work. The taxi will be Abdurahmonjon's only source of income. He is asking you to help! He is looking forward to your kindness and mercy!

loans.use: repair his old car to begin providing taxi services.

loans.name: Shahrizada

texts.ru: Шахризада родилась в 1992 года. Она трудолюбивая и умная девушка. Шахризада учится на 1 курсе Российско-Таджикском Университете. Она учится в заочном отделении. Шахризада дополнительно занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она имеет достаточный опыт по введению бизнеса и знает все тонкости своего дела. Шахризада не замужем и живет с родителями. Ее мать занимается предоставлением услуги парикмахера у них дома. Шахризада и ее родители не имеют достаточно денег, чтобы оплатить за учебный договор. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 950 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Shahrizada was born in 1992. She is a hard-working and intelligent girl. Shahrizada is a freshman at the Russian-Tajik University. She is a distance-education student. Shahrizada also works sewing women's clothes. She has enough experience to start a business and knows the ins and outs of the business. Shahrizada not married and lives with her parents. Her mother works as a hairdresser out of their home. Shahrizada and her parents do not have enough money to pay tuition. She is asking for a loan of $950 US to pay tuition. She's awaiting your kindness and hoping for your mercy.

loans.use: pay tuition

loans.name: Sambath's Group

texts.en:
Age 36 and a resident from Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Sambath is married and has four children. Nowadays, she has only one son who still needs her support as this son is still in school. For the sake of her entire household, Sambath manages a vegetable garden. Her husband also works at a construction site to earn more income to supplement the needs of the family. 

This is the third loan for Sambath with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has wisely managed her past loans to improve her business as well as her living conditions in a gradual manner and has repaid the past loans with success. Now, in a group of four, she is a leader. For Sambath, she will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine for her family. She hopes to own a clean latrine so that she can prevent relevant disease caused by the lack of hygienic practice.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy all the supplies needed to sell vegetables and buy livestock to earn money.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Juan Miguel

texts.es: El Sr. Juan tiene 26 años y es soltero, el se dedica al servicio de fotográficas, el vive en la zona de Hogares de Fátima de la ciudad de la Paz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, Juan va a usar este préstamo para  la compra de materiales y algunos equipos para abrir su estudio fotográfico, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo para empezar este nuevo emprendimiento que por la falta de efectivo no la podía hacer realidad el préstamo le hacía mucha falta, Juan enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen muchos fotógrafos en las distintos acontecimientos sociales en los que trabaja y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando cámaras fotográficas y demás equipos y materiales que necesita y su deseo es tener un estudio fotográfico con todos los equipos modernos para brindar a su clientela un servicio de calidad.
texts.en:
Juan, 26, is single and a photographer. He lives in the Hogares de Fátima neighborhood in the city of La Paz. This is his first loan cycle with the institution. Juan will use the loan to buy supplies to set up a photography studio. He needs the loan because he lacks money to start the new business. 

Juan's business faces competition, as there are many photographers at the different social events where he works. He will use his profits to buy cameras and other needed equipment and materials. He wants his studio to have all the modern equipment so he can offer great customer service.

loans.use: to buy supplies to set up a photography studio.

loans.name: Fathona

texts.ru: Фатхона родилась в 1994 года. Она училась в средней школе отлично и активно участвовала во всех внеклассных мероприятиях активно. Фатхона отлично учила такие предметы как Права, история, английский язык, математика и т.п. Она с детства всегда мечтала стать дипломатом и сделать международную карьеру. После окончания средней школы она поступила в Российско-Таджикский Университет. Она данное время является студенткой 2 курса по специальности Международное Отношение. Фатхона не замужем и живет с родителями. Она не из богатой семьи. Ее родители не в состоянии оплатить за ее учебный договор. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Fathona was born in 1994. She was an honor student in high school and was active in extra-curricular activities. Fathona studied subjects such as law, history, English, mathematics, etc. Since childhood she always dreamed of becoming a diplomat and working internationally. After the graduating from high school she enrolled in the Russian-Tajik University. She is currently enrolled in two course in her major, International Relations. Fathona is single and lives with her parents. She is not from a wealthy family. Her parents are unable to pay her tuition. She is asking for a loan to pay tuition. She's awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: pay her university tuition.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary is the featured borrower of this group. She came along with her group member to acquire a total loan amount of GHS 1900 from Kiva's partner, ID-Ghana, because they have always been neighbors and friends. 

Mary is a 58-year-old married mother of one child. She has been selling 'koobi' (salted fish) at her residence for twenty years. Her child is at the high school level, he is 18 years old and sometimes he assists in the sale of items. 

Mary is acquiring a loan amount of GHS 600 from Kiva's partner, ID-Ghana, to buy 'koobi' from the wholesale market to sell to customers. Mary is at the middle in the picture. As for Grace and Hannah, they sell drinks and comb-supply respectively.

loans.use: To buy 'koobi' (salted fish) from the wholesale market to sell to customers.

loans.name: Lincoln Arley

texts.es: Lincoln es un hombre trabajador de 44 años de edad, que se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, tiene un pequeño puesto de venta de películas para video juegos, ubicado en el centro de la ciudad. El negocio inicialmente era de venta de correas pero debido a la gran competencia que tenía, decidió cambiar de productos y por ello compró un saldo de películas de video juegos y poco a poco fue introduciendo videos musicales y consolas de juegos, trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 9:00 am y de esta manera genera los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento a su familia, conformada por su esposa y sus dos hijos, además con mucho esfuerzo y organización, él pudo completar el dinero para comprar unas propiedades de las cuales recibe un ingreso adicional por concepto de arriendo. Su empuje y dedicación le han permitido salir adelante y por eso siempre busca nuevas alternativas para seguir avanzando, como la que encontró en el crédito que solicita para comprar surtido al por mayor (películas de video juegos y videos musicales), con el fin de abastecerse para la temporada de fin de año que se aproxima, en la que se aumenta la demanda de estos artículos de entretenimiento, época en la que también sus ingresos aumentan notablemente, beneficiando a todo su núcleo familiar ya que tiene la oportunidad de ofrecerles mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Lincoln is a hard-working 44-year-old man who works as an independent merchandiser. He has a small stall where he sells video-game movies. It's located in the city centre.

Lincoln originally started out by selling belts, but he decided to change products because of the stiff competition that he faced. He purchased a surplus of video-game movies, and then gradually started to introduce music videos and game consoles into his stock. He begins work at 9:00 am and works from Monday to Saturday. This is how he generates enough income to support his family, which consists of his spouse and their two children. In addition, with a lot of effort and organization, he was able to get enough money to buy some properties, which provide him with additional income by way of rental payments.

His drive and dedication have helped him to get ahead. For this reason he is always seeking out new alternatives to continue moving forward, such as the opportunity that the loan he is requesting will provide. He will use the loan to buy wholesale stock (video-game movies and music videos) in order to stock up for the impending holiday season, when demand for entertainment items goes up. Lincoln's earnings also increase significantly toward the end of the year, which benefits his whole family and gives him the opportunity to offer them better living conditions and well-being.

loans.use: to buy stock wholesale (videogames and music videos).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fees.

loans.name: Festus

texts.en:
Festus is a 26-year-old single male. He has one child, 17 years old; a family member whom he supports. He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a Kadet officer, and he has a retail shop where he sells mali mali (household items). He has been in this business for three years, which is located at Timboni in Watamu. In his business, he earns a monthly income of KES 34,000. 

He is taking his third loan of KES 70,000, which he intends to use in adding stocks to his business by buying clothing materials, Vitenges, buckets, home utensils, and basins. His previous loan of KES 40,000 was paid back successfully.

Festus will use the anticipated profit to expand his business by making it a wholesale shop. His hopes and dreams for his future business and family are to grow his business and live a good life.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials, Vitenges, buckets, home utensils, and basins to sell.

loans.name: Rafoat

texts.en:
Rafoat is a business woman. She is 43 years old. Her experience in agricultural business is 17 years. Her husband is an agrarian as well. They working together from the day that they met each other. 

They grow crops and vegetables. It’s a really good and happy family. They respect and love each other almost 25 years. Actually, when the family starting business together, it helps very much, because they have support of each other. 

Rafoat asks for loan to extend her business. She wants to buy more seeds for new sowing season and make her harvest bigger.

loans.use: To buy seeds for new sowing season

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.ru: После окончания средней школы, Нилуфар поставила себе цель стать известным филологом своего города. С этой целью она поступила в Таджикский Национальный Университет. Нилуфар студентка 4 курса. Она очень умная и трудолюбивая девушка. Учиться отлично и активно участвует на всех мероприятиях университета. Родители  Нилуфара простые рабочие, ее отец бухгалтер, а мать домохозяйка и они не в состоянии оплатить за учебу своего ребенка. Нилуфар обратилась в Имон Интернешенл с целью получения займа для оплаты учебы в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: After graduating from high school, Nilufar set a goal of becoming a famous linguist in her city. Pursuing this goal, she enrolled at the Tajik National University. Nilufar is a senior. She is a very intelligent and hard-working girl. She is an excellent student and actively participates in all of the university's activities. Nilufar's parents are ordinary workers: her father is an accountant, and her mother is a housewife. They are unable to pay for their child's school. Nilufar asked Imon International for a loan to pay tuition. She's awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: pay tuition.

loans.name: Fadzai

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 48-year-old Fadzai from Harare. She is married with three children, one is attending school. She also cares for one additional dependent. Fadzai runs a retail business selling women's, men's and children's wear. The business has been in operation for 12 years. She says the main challenge is competition. Fadzai has requested a loan of $800 (USD) to buy more clothes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to pay university fees for her son. In the future, Fadzai plans to open a big clothing shop in Karoi.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ro's Group

texts.en:
Ro is 39 years old, blessed with seven children, and is a villager from Pursat province. Her family solely relies on a single agribusiness, rice farming, which is able to generate her about 19,300 KHR per day. 

Including this loan, Ro is a third-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid back her past loan completely and it has supported her business and stabilizes her living condition at a gradual pace. 

For this cycle, she teamed up a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop. She hopes that she can boost her crop on time and make a good yield with a high return in profit so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en:
San, a mother of three dependent children, is 32 years old and a rice grower on one-hectare area located in Pursat province, where her residential area is. She has occupied this business for eight years, earning about 38,000 KHR per day. San, who has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s  partner) for the past three loans, has succeeded in repaying back the past loans completely, and it has enabled her to improve her living better than before. Additionally, she managed to set aside some money to buy a cow to support her farmland. 

Now, she forms a group of three to get a new loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy potash, and gasoline, which will be used on her hand-tractor for plowing. Additionally, she will spend some portion of her loan to buy pigs for raising as extra income. She hopes that she can make more income to expand her business better than before.

loans.use: to buy potash, and gasoline to use on her hand-tractor for plowing, and buy pigs for raising as extra income.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is a married man living in a rural area in Swazi-Kyamuhunga in Bushenyi District with five children and one additional dependent orphaned after the death of the father. In order to support his family Johnson has been burning and selling charcoal as his major source of income for the last two years. He also does some farming, which gives him more income to meet the needs of his family. 

Johnson has requested a loan to buy a piece of a forest where he will get firewood for burning charcoal. He has future aspirations of acquiring a machine for quicker tree cutting. Johnson is hopeful that his future will be bright.

loans.use: To buy a piece of forest

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 25-year-old married male. He has two children, 4 and 2 years old respectively, whom he supports. He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a Kadet officer, and he has an electronics workshop. He has been in this business for one year, which is located in Timboni in Watamu. In his business, he earns a monthly income of KES 7,950. 

He is taking his first loan of KES 20,000, which he intends to use in adding stocks to his business, by buying electronic materials and tools for repairs, to use in his work.

Joseph will use the anticipated profits to expand his business. His hopes and dreams for his future business and family are to grow his business and live a good life.

loans.use: to buy electronic materials and tools to be used in repairs at his work.

loans.name: Henry

texts.es: El señor Henry tiene estudios a nivel bachillerato, es soltero no tiene dependientes, trabajos desde muy niño en diferentes actividades como ser la agricultura y otros, los trabajos que realizaba era para apoyar a su madre; con sus hermanos menores trabajo por varios años en la parcela agrícola de su madre sin embargo al enfermar ella se vieron en la necesidad de vender dicho lote, su madre se dedico al comercio y el señor Henry trabajo como herrero con un tío que tenían en la zona, después de varios años de trabajo logro conseguir otro trabajo como ayudante de mecánico en el que mejoro sus ingresos esto le permitió culminar los estudios a nivel secundario, en el poco tiempo que trabaja logro comprar algunos equipos para iniciar con su propio taller de herrería con el que pretende iniciar su propio negocio y de esta forma permitirlo a sus hermanos menores culminar sus estudios sin problema, el señor Henry contaba casi con gran parte de los equipos que la permitieron realizar algunos trabajos sin embargo requería de otras herramientas que le permitieran realizar trabajos que le permitan tener una mejor ganancia por esta razón  solicita un crédito para comprar herramientas que le permitan trabajar con mayor frecuencia el rubro de la herrería.
texts.en:
Henry is single, has his high school education, and has no dependents. He worked from a very young age in a variety of jobs, including agriculture and others. He worked in order to support his mother. Along with his younger siblings, he worked for many years on his mother's plot of land. However, when she fell ill, it became necessary to sell the land. 

Henry's mother works in sales and Henry works as a blacksmith with an uncle that lives in the region. After having worked for a number of years, Henry managed to get a second job working as a mechanic's assistant. This improved his earnings, and allowed him to finish his secondary school studies.

In the short time he has spent in this job, Henry has managed to buy some tools to start his own blacksmith workshop, with which he plans to begin his own business. This way, his younger siblings will be able to finish their studies with no problems. 

Henry already has a large amount of the equipment he needs for his blacksmith workshop, but nevertheless he needs other tools which will allow him to take on projects that will bring in higher earnings. For this reason, Henry is requesting a loan to buy tools that will let him work more often in his blacksmith's shop.

loans.use: to purchase blacksmithing tools.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia is 35 years old and from the Khashuri district. She is married and lives with her three young children. 

Lia’s husband is the only one earning money in the household, working as a construction worker locally. His earnings are modest, and the family lives under the poverty line.  Lia gets small-sized social assistance from the local government to feed her children. 

Like a majority of middle-aged Georgian women, Lia stays home and takes care of her family. She is an excellent mother and housewife who tries to give her children all the best. 

Lia sorrows that she is not able to generate income for the family.  That is why she has decided to start her own business and go to Turkey to purchase clothing and linens for resale. She will sell the items from her house among her community members. 

The increased profit will be reinvested in the same business, and Lia will be able to continue the business. 

Lia believes in your kindness.

loans.use: to start trading in clothing and linens

loans.name: Ret

texts.en:
Ret, 31, is a widowed mother blessed with three schoolchildren. She resides in Pursat Province. For her family, one and half hectare of rice farming and a half hectare of corn farming are the main source of income. This has returned about 16,700 KHR per day. 

This is the third microloan for Ret with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loans, which she has repaid completely, have enabled her to expand her business. For this cycle, Ret is seeking a loan of 1,400,000 KHR in order to pay a plowing fee for her farmland. She hopes that she can prepare her farmland and replant on time so that she can expand her farmland to a larger scale.

loans.use: to pay a plowing fee for her farmland.

loans.name: Lon

texts.en:
Lon is a young man residing in Takeo province, where he does his agribusiness and rice farming. Lon wants to pursue a bachelor degree, majoring in Business Administration. So he applied for an education loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) as a first-time borrower, to pay for his tuition fees.

He hopes that he can hold a bachelor degree and get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: to pay for his school tuition fees.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 32 years old and a mother of two.  She has been running an interior decor manufacturing business since 2000.  With the income she makes from her business, she has been able to see her children through school and ensure they have food on their table.  As competition is increasing in the sector, she wants to diversify and start doing wedding and outdoor events décor.  She has already started getting bookings and now needs to position herself to be able to take on new clients who are interested in her products.  Linda would like to use this loan to buy flower vases, water glasses, fabric for decor and a portable stage.  Her goal is to open an outlet where clients can walk in and see a variety of her decorations on display.  

PENYA assists borrowers with entrepreneurial skills training through the Start and Improve Your Business (SIYB) Program.  PENYA also helps them form Village Savings and Loans Associations where they save proceeds from their businesses that will then become the future sources for additional loans and business investments.  Finally, PENYA carries out mentoring and monitoring visits to ensure that the businesses are being run viably.  Through linkages created with extension workers and some buyers, PENYA borrowers have access to further training in the production and selling of their produce.

loans.use: to buy flower vases, water glasses, fabric for decor and a portable stage

loans.name: Orn's Group

texts.en:
Orn is 27 years old and the young mother of two little kids. She resides in the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. Orn is a local farmer who grows rice and cassava as her main source of income. She earns about 32,000 KHR a day to cover her family's daily basic needs.

This is Orn's first microloan with VisionFund, Kiva's partner. Orn teamed up with a group of three borrowers in order to get a loan. As the leader, Orn will spend her entire loan portion to buy cassava seedlings and insecticides for her crops. She hopes that she can earn a good income and send her children to school until the tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy cassava seedlings and insecticides for her crops.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Aizhamal

texts.en:
Aizhamal is a student of AUCA, department of International and Comparative Politics. Here is her story:

“The opportunity to study at AUCA means the world to me. I have an ability to not only perform what is expected of me, but also to reach above and beyond the expectations.
 
The old Soviet education system proposed that getting quality education means only reading books and attending classes. Being followed by this habit, I was not involved in any extracurricular activities up until the 8th grade. That time I realized that it is not enough to become a competitive student and leader of the local community. 

In the last 3 years, I have been devoting enough time to study sciences at school, as well as to my English and Russian language clubs and to leading the Issyk-Kul Volunteer Community. Since last summer, I also have been volunteering at a small newspaper called “Balykchy” as an independent journalist. Writing articles about social and economic events, featured stories, and sometimes poems, compose my jobs main responsibilities. 

After my participation in the “Youth in the 21st century” media camp, I found new interests: documentary photography and debates. Unfortunately, those are not available in Balykchy and many other small cities in Kyrgyzstan. Among all of my extracurricular activities, public service became the most beneficial to me as well as to the local community. Being a chairman of the community, I have learned to be more organized and independent, and communicate more efficiently with very different people. 

Another thing worth mentioning is that AUCA gives another opportunity to all its students; a Kiva loan, which helps them cover their tuition fees. Taking this opportunity, I am also applying for the loan, so that I could cover my tuition fees.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is 34 years old and is a father of 3.  He has been operating a grocery shop since the beginning of 2012, after he was trained by PENYA in the Start and Improve Your Business (SIYB) Program.  Romeo has now started running a hardware store after realizing that villagers were traveling more than 80 kms to the nearest town to buy their supplies.  At his shop, he is able to provide supplies to people from the surrounding villages.  Romeo will use this loan to purchase stock for his shop in bulk. He will purchase supplies such as farming machinery spares, seed, fertilizers, cement, plastic-ware and other general hardware supplies.  He also plans to expand his shopping space and build his own so he can stop renting the space he is currently using.  With the proceeds from the shop he is able to provide for his family and send his children to school. 

PENYA assists borrowers with entrepreneurial skills training through the Start and Improve Your Business (SIYB) Program.  PENYA also helps them form Village Savings and Loans Associations where they save proceeds from their businesses that will then become the future sources for additional loans and business investments.  Finally, PENYA carries out mentoring and monitoring visits to ensure that the businesses are being run viably.  Through linkages created with extension workers and some buyers, PENYA borrowers have access to further training in the production and selling of their produce.

loans.use: to purchase farming machinery spares, seed, fertilizers, and cement for resale in his hardware store

loans.name: Beverly Johelin

texts.es: Beverly es una joven emprendedora, originaría de la ciudad de Managua.De oficio comerciante y se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos y joyas de plata. Esta agradecida con Kiva y MiCredito ya que gracias al financiamiento logro invertir en su negocio y logro obtener mayores ganancias. Solicita este nuevo crédito para comprar: pulseras, anillos, cadenas de plata, celulares, accesorios, entre otros con el fin de surtir su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Estima que este crédito sera de mucha ayuda ya que obtendrá mayores ventas e ingresos.
texts.en:
Beverly is a young entrepreneur from the city of Managua. She works as a merchant, selling cosmetics and silver jewelry. 

She is grateful to Kiva and MiCredito, because she has been able to invest in her business and obtain better earnings thanks to her previous loan. 

Beverly is requesting this new loan to buy bracelets, rings, silver chains, cell phones, accessories, and other items with which to stock her business and meet the needs of her customers. She believes that this loan will be very helpful, since she will increase her sales and her income.

loans.use: to buy bracelets, rings, silver chains, mobile phones, accessories, and other items.

loans.name: Shakira

texts.en:
Shakira is a 43-year-old married woman who has mothered seven children.  She is hopeful that with her hard work she will help them grow and have the best education. 

She is a tailor and has done tailoring for the last six years.  She has seen the business grow from one level to another in the last six years. In addition to tailoring she also sells matoke and this boosts the incomes of the family greatly. Her business is located in Bugongi trading centre, and her customers are mainly the local people.

She would like to use the loan money (UGX 800,000) to buy textiles for her tailoring. This will help her to make more income. 

Shakira’s main challenge is competition, which is stiff in the area and which affects her sales and hence income. She works six days a week and ten hours per day, and this she says has helped her serve her customers on time, which helps her win their favor.

She is very positive about achieving her dream in life.

loans.use: To buy textiles for sewing clothes

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: Don Luis es originario de la ciudad de Managua, tiene 64 años de edad, es casado y tiene 6 hijos que ya son independientes. Un señor con mucha fortaleza de mantener su negocio de la venta de productos básicos, con el sueño y fuerza de seguir luchando para mejorar. Solicita el préstamo para comprar productos básicos como: frijoles, arroz, maiz, azucar, aceite, etc con el fin de surtir su negocio y aumentar sus ventas e ingresos. Estima que el crédito sera de mucha ayuda ya que podra invertir y mejorar su calidda de vida.
texts.en: Luis is from  the city of Managua.  He’s 64-years-old, married and has six children all of whom are independent now.  He’s a man with much strength to stay in business selling basic staples like beans, rice, corn, sugar, oil, etc. to stock his business and increase sales and income.  He figures that the loan will be of much help for he’ll be able to invest in improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic staple products.

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Argentina es comerciante  en unos de los Mercados más concurridos de la ciudad de león, empieza sus labores a las 9:00 am preparando sus productos en su casa de habitación que posteriormente sale a ofertar de forma ambulante a  su clientela finalizado a las 5:00 pm, es madre soltera con 5 hijos de los cuales 2 están a su cargo, se dedica a este negocio desde hace doce  años para el sustento de su familia. 

El  crédito que  solicito a Ceprodel será utilizado para la reparación y mantenimiento de su vehículo con el cual se moviliza de su casa de habitación o los distintos lugares de la ciudad de león para ofertar sus productos, con créditos anteriormente brindados ha logrado mejor su vivienda, incrementar su capital de trabajo y primordialmente brindarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa Argentina’s a merchant in one of the city of León’s busiest markets.  She starts work at 9am preparing the products at home that she’ll head out later to sell from place to place.  Her day ends at 5pm.  She’s a single mother of five children two of whom are still in her care.  She’s been in this business supporting her family this way for 12 years.

The loan she’s asked from Ceprodel will be used to repair and service the vehicle she uses to go from home to the various places in the city of León where she sells her goods.  She’s used previously granted loans to do home improvements, to increase working capital and principally to improve her children’s quality of life.

loans.use: to service her vehicle.

loans.name: Irene Elena

texts.es: La Sra. Irene sigue con la misma actividad de la confección de almohadas y fundas,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de tela por cantidad para la confección de sus prendas, cuenta que le fue muy bien con el crédito ya que utilizo en la compra de distintas maquinas,  incremento sus pedidos y por ende sus ingresos ya  tiene mucha clientela.
texts.en: Irene continues with her same activity making pillows and pillowcases.  On this occasion she’s requesting the loan to buy fabric in quantity to sew clothes.  She relates that she did very well with the previous loan for she used it to buy various machines.  Her orders increased and so did her income as a result.  She has a lot of customers now.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Tuychiboy

texts.en: One day a boy came to the IMON office and asked for a loan. He wanted to pay for his education, but the salary of his parents wasn’t enough for that. He studies at Khujand State University and is majoring in accounting and finance. All weekends he spends with his parents in village. He has to study all week in another city. During the conversation he said that he wishes to work at IMON, because his parents always wanted him to work in a big city and big buildings. So, if he gets a loan to pay his tuition, hopefully he will graduate from university and will be a good employee of IMON. He is asking for a loan to pay tuition at the university. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay university tuition

loans.name: Korto

texts.en:
Korto, who is 45 years old, lives in West Point.  She’s married, with six children. Her youngest child is three, and the eldest is 24.  They all stay at home with their parents.

Korto has been making and selling Iron soap for the past 19 years.  She enjoys doing this business because she uses the profit to send her children to school.

She’s requesting a loan to purchase caustic and palm oil for her business.  She plans to expand her business and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase caustic and palm oil for making iron soap

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is married woman with eight children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her food stall

loans.name: Samean's Group

texts.en:
Samean is 30 years old and has two children.   

She is a rice farmer from the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. The rice farm has returned her for almost KHR 29,000 per day; it is a business that she has had for 12 years. 

New to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she has formed a group of four to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and insecticide for her farmland. 

She hopes to make more income from her business and to better her lifestyle in a good progress.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, and insecticide for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 54 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is single and has six children from 2 to 15 years old. Only five of them attend school and they all live with her. For two years Marie has had a table in the local market where she sells Iron soap (Local soap made from caustic and palm oil). Sometimes she has many customers and makes good money and sometimes it's very slow. She started selling for her mother and later decided to sell on her own. 

This is the first time Marie requested a loan and she plans to purchase caustics and palm oil for her business. She wants to improve and continue growing her business. She wants to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to purchase caustics and palm oil for her soap business.

loans.name: Uktir

texts.en: People all over the world are trying to get a good education. Some of them have money and the other don’t. To the IMON office one day, came a boy who is studying in Khujand State University. At the same time after studying he works. He raises the agricultural products. When the harvest is ready he sells his product to the local market and then the money from the sale he spends for his education. So, he came and asked for the loan, because this year his harvest wasn’t good enough. So, it’s so important to him to pay for his education and finish the school this year. He is asking for a loan in the amount of 500 USD. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Manuel Ignacio

texts.es:
El señor Manuel Ignacio, es docente de uno de los colegios de la ciudad de León, desde hace veinticuatro años. Sale de su casa a las 6:30 am e inicia sus labores desde 06:50 pm hasta las 05:30 pm este  horario de lunes a viernes, es padre de 5 hijos de los cuales solo 1 está a su cargo. Realiza estas labores para el sustento de su familia.

El  crédito que  solicito el señor Manuel a Ceprodel será utilizado para comprar materiales de construcción tales como: cemento, madera, pago de mano de obra, entre otros materiales, lo cual le permitirá realizar mejoras al techo de su vivienda brindándole un mejor confort tanto para el como a su familia y mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel Ignacio has been a teacher in one of the city of León’s schools for 24 years.  He leaves home at 6:30am and starts his work day at 6:50am and ends at 5:30pm, Monday through Friday.  He’s father of five children one of whom is still in his care.  He does this work to support his family.

The loan Manuel has asked from Ceprodel will be used to buy building supplies like cement and lumber, among others, and to pay labor costs to repair the roof at home not only providing more comfort for his family and but also improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy building supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Nim's Group

texts.en:
Nim is 56 years old and one of the breadwinners of her family consisting of five children. She is a villager from Pursat province. Her main sources of income are from sweet selling, maize farming, and her husband's occupation as a construction worker. She has been involved in these businesses for 15 years, earning about 30,000 KHR per day. 

With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Nim is a fifth-time borrower. The positive impact of her past loan has enabled her to build a proper fence for her house and provided timely for support her business. Now, she teams up a group of three to get a new loan. The total amount of her entire group is 3,600,000 KHR, of which 1,400,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more ingredients to make sweets for reselling. 

She hopes that she can make more money to set up a small grocery selling business in front of her front yard to earn addition income.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to make sweets for reselling

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a quarry where he sells stones. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

He will use the KES 21,500 loan to buy more stones for sale and also buy a water tank . This will enable his family to store clean water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future, he will have a healthy family. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stones for sale and also buy a water tank

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 38 years old. She is a married woman, and she supports five children, aged 22, 20, 15, 6 and 3 years.

Christine was introduced to KADET by a staff member, and she is taking her first loan from KADET, in the amount of KES 10,000. She has been running a café business located at Kibaoni, for five years. She earns monthly income of KES 7,000. She will use the loan to add utensils and stock for her business, including wheat flour, maize flour, oil, sugar, and salt.

She will use the anticipated profit to expand her cafe. Her hopes and dreams for her future are to expand her business by making it into a restaurant, and to educate her children and make sure they live well.

loans.use: to add utensils and stock for her business, including wheat flour, maize flour, oil, sugar, and salt.

loans.name: Lucila Margarita

texts.es:
En el sitio Campoverde cerca del cantón Pichincha cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Julio Cesar, este lugar se lo conoce por estar cerca de una represa donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales.
En este lugar vive la señora Lucila, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijas de  15, 13 y 10 años  de edad, las dos mayores  estudian en colegio y la menor en  escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
Doña Lucila como buena esposa realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en la agricultura, él tiene cultivos de cacao, maíz y verduras en toda época del año ya que cuentan con bombas para poder regar en toda época del año y que en el periodo invernal también siembran arroz ya que sus terrenos son  propicios para este tipo de cultivos, por su parte ella se dedica a la cría de gallinas criollas las mismas que al venderlas les  queda algo extra para el bienestar de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar fertilizantes y químicos para las plagas. Lleva más de 4 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda para ellos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y darles lo mejor a sus hijas.
texts.en:
The communal bank Julio Cesar meets every 15 days in Campoverde, near the canton of Pichincha. This region is known for being close to a reservoir, and the majority of the residents there work in agriculture and raise animals.

Lucilla, 35 years old, lives in this area. She is married and has three daughters, aged 15, 13, and 10, from her marriage. The two eldest children are in secondary school and the youngest is in primary. Lucilla's husband works in agriculture.

As a good wife, Lucilla is requesting this loan so that her husband can use it in agriculture. He has cocoa, corn and vegetable crops which grow throughout the year. They use pumps to water the fields all year long because they also plant rice in the wintertime, since their land is well-suited to this type of crop. For her part, Lucilla works raising barnyard chickens. When she sells them, she has a little extra cash to contribute to the family's well-being.

This loan will be used to buy fertilizers and chemicals to fight pests. Lucilla has been a member of the communal bank for four years, and she likes it because the loans are very helpful to her family. Her dreams are to continue to get ahead and to provide the best life possible to her daughters.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and chemicals to fight pests.

loans.name: Tereza Del Carmen

texts.es: la señora Tereza trabajadora, responsable ya con este es su cuarto credito, ella labora para el Hospital del municipio de Ticuantepe lugar donde habita junto a su familia su dos hijas le apoyan con las tareas del hogar y su esposo labora tambien para el hospital, con este credito doña Tereza quiere aumentar un cuarto para una de sus hijas y asi tener mayor espacio y comodida en el hogar. Agradece la apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic le han brindado estos años.
texts.en:
Tereza’s a responsible, hardworking woman.  This is already her fourth loan.  She’s employed by the municipal hospital in Ticuantepe where she lives with her family.  Her two daughters help her with the household chores and her husband works for the hospital too.

Tereza wants to use this loan to add a bedroom for one of her daughters to have more space and comfort at home.  She’s grateful for the support  Kiva and Afodenic have given her these years.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Don Julio Cesar de  46 años de edad, habita en Juigalpa, es casado, trabaja en la Alcaldia, como ayudante de Maquinaria pesada, padre de cuatro hijos, de los cuales dos son independiente pero habitan en la misma casa y dos menores de edad quienes estudian la Secundaria en un colegio público, ella depende económicamente de él.  El Sr. Julio con sacrificio ha realizado mejoras en su vivienda, pero aún le queda otras que necesita realizar como es la construcción de una pared vertical en la parte posterior de su vivienda, por lo que requiere ir comprando los  materiales de Construcción, como cemento, piedrín, arenilla, Hierro, para luego  Iniciar la Construcción,  permitiendo con esta mejora dar mayor seguridad a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar, 46, lives in Juigalpa.  He’s married and employed by city hall as a heavy machinery operator assistant.  He’s father of four children two of which are independent but still living at home and two minors who attend a local public secondary school and who still depend on him.

With much sacrifice he’s succeeded in making home improvements but has some to do still like erecting a vertical wall in the rear of his house.  He needs to buy the building supplies like cement, gravel, sand, iron rods, etc. to do so and then start building in order to increase security at home.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is married with three children and all her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (her mother). She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business of 7 years. 

She applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes (skirts and blouses). She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. 

She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for medical bills.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.es: El señor Cornelio tiene 25 años de edad el vive en la Población  de Tiraque, él se encuentra concubinato, tiene dos hijos,  Cornelio trabaja como chofer en un Sindicato de autotransporte de la comunidad de Tiraque. Cornelio  vivía en otro comunidad, sin embargó hace como cinco años atrás el tuvo que venir a la población de Tiraque porque no tuvo ingresos suficientes;  Cornelio dejo toda sus pertenencias por lo que se vinieron junto a su esposa a la comunidad de Tiraque, ellos se volvieron a levantar y junto a su esposa tomaron un nuevo rumbo en su camino empezaron de cero, ahora él tiene una movilidad y un lote urbano  y de la misma manera el trabaja como chofer.  El préstamo que solicita Cornelio es para comercializar  la compra y venta de ropa nueva y de esa manera podrá tener más ingresos y poder ayudar a su hijos a terminar el colegio. Cornelio sueña con un futuro mejor para sus hijos ya que el no pudo terminar el colegio ni hacer una carrera, pero él quiere que su hijos si puedan realizar una carrera y poder ayudar a las personas de la zona.
texts.en:
Cornelio is 25 years old and lives in the town of Tiraque. He lives with his wife and has 2 children. Cornelio works as a driver for an automobile transporting syndicate in Tiraque community. He used to live in a different community but 5 years ago, he had to move to Tiraque due to his insufficient income. He left everything behind and came with his wife to Tiraque. They began to advance themselves and gave a new direction to their lives, starting at zero. Now he has mobility and an urban lot and, at the same time, works as a driver. 

The loan Cornelio is requesting is to begin a business buying and selling new clothes. In this manner, he will be able to earn more income and help his children finish school. Cornelio dreams of a better future for his children, since he himself couldn't finish school or pursue a career. He wants his children to be able to achieve a career and to be able to help people who reside in their zone.

loans.use: acquire capital to iniciate a business buying and selling clothing.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en: Loice appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES (Kenya shillings) to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Sokhorn's Group

texts.en:
A 60-year-old, married, residing in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Sokhorn has five children to take care of and earns a living through farming rice. Having been in this business for 45 years, she can earn about KHR70,000 per day to make a living and can save about KHR40,000 each day for the future needs. 

Sokhorn's group consists of two members who live in the same village and she is the sixth cycled client. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Sokhorn will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more rice, thus increasing her family’s income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Habidoro

texts.en: Habidoro is a married man with two children ages 10 and 8. He trades in bananas which he sells at a profit so that he can sustain his family. He has been selling bananas for the last six years and this has helped him to earn a steady income to cater to his personal needs and the needs of the family. The business is located in a rural area in Sheema District and his clients are mainly matooke traders in the area. He hopes to be financially well especially after getting the loan of one million shillings, which he will use to buy more bananas from farmers for sell. Bacterial Wilt affects the banana plantations in the area and this is the main challenge he faces while doing the banana trade business since it affects the quality of the bananas he gets from the gardens. He is generally a hard working man who hopes to grow the business from one level to another.

loans.use: To buy bananas for resell

loans.name: Katty Cecibel

texts.es:
En el sitio Campoverde cerca del cantón Pichincha cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Julio Cesar, este lugar se lo conoce por estar cerca de una represa donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales.
En este lugar vive la señora Katty, tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad el cual estudian en escuela. El marido trabaja en una compañía privada. Ella hace un tiempo atrás aprendió belleza en un centro en su ciudad.
Doña Katty es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma y así generar sus propios ingresos en bienestar de su familia, para lo cual se dedica  tanto a realizar trabajos de arreglos y belleza como también al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo así como también zapatos y cosméticos, ella sale de su casa llevando sus materiales de trabajo y su mercadería ya que por lo general sus clientes o compran alguna prenda o se realizan algún trabajo, lleva 8 años en esta actividad con la cual se ayuda para salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos y cosméticos. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son darle siempre lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The “Julio Cesar” (Julius Caesar) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Campoverde near Pichincha Canton.  This place is noted for being near a dam and most of its residents work in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Katty, 26, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has a six-year-old son attending school.  Her husband works for a private firm.  She learned beauty some time ago in a center in her city.

Katty’s a very hardworking woman who likes to fend for herself and generate her own income for her family’s well-being.  To do so, she works in the beauty industry and also as a merchant selling clothes of all types as well as shoes and cosmetics.  She leaves home carrying her work materials and merchandise since in general her customers buy articles of clothing from her or contract her for some job.  She’s been in this activity 8 years and it helps her get ahead.

This loan is to buy clothes, shoes and cosmetics.  She’s been in the communal bank since the beginning and likes it because the loans help her much.  Her dream is to give her son the best always.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Noemí Elisabeth

texts.es:
En el cantón Pichincha cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Pichincha, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación surcada por un gran rio lo cual lo hace propicia para los cultivos.
En este lugar vive la señora Noemí, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 13, 11, 9 y 7 años de edad, los dos mayores  estudian en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Noemí es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar para ganar y con esto ayudar con los gastos del hogar, ella hace dos años arrendo un local en el centro de la ciudad en la cual tiene un cibert y papelería a la vez,  en su local además de prestar los servicios de internet también las personas llegan a sacar copias y comprar útiles escolares que vende en su local, allí ella trabaja con la ayuda de una chica a quien le paga por sus servicios. 
Este crédito es para pagar el servicio de internet y para comprar hojas de papel y útiles escolares. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda. Sus sueños son tener su local propio para ya no pagar arriendos.
texts.en:
In the Pichincha canton the Pichincha communal bank meets every two weeks. This place is known as being very dynamic. Most of its inhabitants work in agriculture and raising animals. It is an area with a lot of vegetation planted along a big river, which makes it suitable for the crops.    

This is where Noemí lives. She is 32, married, and from her marriage has four children, aged 13, 11, 9 and 7. The two oldest go to high school and the youngest are in primary school. Noemí is a woman who is a fighter and who likes to work to earn and help with the household expenses. Two years ago, she rented a locale in the center of town where she has a cyber cafe and a paper goods store. In addition to internet services, people come to make copies and buy school supplies that she sells there. She works there with the help of a girl whom she pays for her services.  

This loan is to pay for the internet service and to buy paper and school supplies. This is her third cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because the loans have been a big help. Her dreams are to have her own locale so she doesn't have to pay rent.

loans.use: to pay for internet service and to buy paper and school supplies.

loans.name: María Alexandra

texts.es:
En el sitio Campoverde cerca del cantón Pichincha cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Julio Cesar, este lugar se lo conoce por estar cerca de una represa donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 34 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esta relación tuvo un hijo de 5 años de edad el cual estudia en escuela. 
Doña María es una mujer muy luchadora que hace todo lo posible para sacar adelante a su hijo ella sola y que a este no le falte nada en su vida, para esto ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatos entre otras cosas, sale a recorrer en las mañanas ya que a esa hora su hijo está en la escuela, ella visita a sus clientes ofreciéndoles sus productos y cobrando ya que deja a crédito, así una vez que cobra ella utiliza una parte de sus ganancias para los alimentos diarios y para ciertas cosas de su pequeño y la otra la guarda para seguir adelante en su negocio. 
Este crédito es para comprar ropa y zapatos. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante sola. Sus sueños son darle siempre lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The “Julio Cesar” (Julius Caesar) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Campoverde near Pichincha Canton.  This place is noted for being near a dam and most of its residents work in agriculture and animal husbandry.

María, 34, lives here.  Her husband died several years ago and she has  five-year-old son attending school.  María’s a very hardworking woman who does everything possible to move her son forward alone and that he lacks nothing in life.  This is why she works in commerce.  She sells all types of clothes, shoes and other things.  She heads out mornings to sell when her son’s in school.  She visits her customers offering them her goods and collecting payments since she sells on credit.  When she collects, she uses part of her profits for daily food and for certain things her little one needs and saves the rest to continue moving the business forward.

This loan will be used to buy clothes and shoes.  She’s been in the communal bank since the beginning and likes it because the loans make it possible for her to get ahead alone.  Her dream is to give her son the best always.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Ricardo Alfonso

texts.es:
Ricardo de 39 años, por sus condiciones económicas, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar. Desde muy pequeño se dedicó a pescar, junto a su padrastro. La esposa se dedica, a comercializar de forma ambulante productos de belleza. Han procreado un hijo.

Ser pescador artesanal ha sido su oficio de toda la vida. Manifiesta que trabaja en el mar desde hace 22 años y que es un trabajo que le apasiona. Él no tiene otra fuente de ingreso,  más de donde obtener ingresos para los gastos de su familia.

El dinero lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de “SIMBRA” (para pescar); ya que este implemento es bastante efectivo,  para obtener buenos resultados al momento de pescar. Tiene la necesidad de tener mejores herramientas para su trabajo.

Tiene como aspiración  principal, que su hijo conozca el arte de pescar y que en un futuro, se valga de sus propios medios para subsistir. Él se está esmerando en tener un excelente equipo de pesca.
texts.en:
Due to his financial conditions, Ricardo, age 39, did not have the opportunity to go to school.  Ever since he was very little, he fished with his step-father.  His wife sells beauty products in an itinerant manner.  They have one child.

Being an artisan fisherman has been his trade all of his life.  He says that he has worked in the sea for 22 years, and it is work that stirs him deeply.  He does not have another source of income for his family’s expenses.

He will use the money to buy materials to make a “SIMBRA” (for fishing).  [A ‘simbra’ is a net of hooks that is over four kilometers long.]  This implement is very effective in getting good fishing results.  He needs to have better tools for his work.

His main aspiration is for his child to learn the art of fishing, and in the future,  stand on his own two feet with his own means of surviving.

He is devoting great attention into having an excellent piece of fishing equipment.

loans.use: to buy materials to make a fishing net of hooks that is over four kilometers long.

loans.name: Madia

texts.en:
Madia is 50 years old and lives in the Paynesville area; she’s married, and her husband works as a contractor for a construction firm. She has three children between the ages of 26 and 33.

Madia has been selling charcoal for the past five years; sometimes she experiences low sales, but most of the time her business is working well.

Madia is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business.

In the future, she hopes to buy land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret  is married with five children and three of them go to school. She also takes care of an additional family member (father). 

She has a business of green bananas and has been in this business for six years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She generates additional income through selling fruits like oranges and mangoes.  

She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells to all categories of people but on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include transportation and thieves. 

She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Carmen Indelira

texts.es:
En el sitio Campoverde cerca del cantón Pichincha cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Julio Cesar, este lugar se lo conoce por estar cerca de una represa donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 42 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos de 16, 14, 12, 11 y 6 años de edad, la mayor ya está comprometida, dos de sus hijos estudian en colegio y dos en escuela. El marido es agricultor. 
Doña Carmen para ayudarle a su marido  realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en la agricultura, ellos tienen cultivos de cacao y  maíz, estos en toda época del año y en invierno ellos también siembran arroz, maní y verduras,  en la temporada actual tienen que regar sus cultivos por la sequedad que existe en esta etapa del año para lo cual cuentan con bombas para poder llevar el agua por tuberías desde el rio que no está muy lejos de sus cultivos, por lo cual no es tan difícil su trabajo,  ella por su parte se dedica a la cría de gallinas criollas y chanchos con lo cual se gana algo extra.
Este crédito es para comprar fertilizantes y químicos para las plagas, además para comprar tubos ya que le falta para cubrir todos los cultivos. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “Julio Cesar” (Julius Caesar) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Campoverde near Pichincha Canton.  This place is noted for being near a dam and most of its residents work in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Carmen, 42, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has five children who are 16, 14, 12, 11 and 6 years of age.  The oldest is engaged, two attend secondary school and two are in school.  Her husband’s a farmer.

To help her husband, Carmen is taking out the loan so he can use it in agriculture.  They grow cocoa beans and corn every season of the year and they also grow rice, peanuts and vegetables in winter.  They need to irrigate their crops during the present season because of the drought this time of year and they have pumps available to carry water in pipes from the river that’s not too far away to their crops.  This makes their work a little easier.  She also raises chickens and pigs to earn extra income.

This loan is to buy fertilizer and pesticide and also to buy pipes because they still need some to cover their entire crop.  She’s been in the communal bank since the beginning and likes it because of the help the loans provide.  Her dream is to continue moving forward and to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and pipes.

loans.name: Lilia María Pastora

texts.es:
En el cantón Pichincha cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Pichincha, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación surcada por un gran rio lo cual lo hace propicia para los cultivos.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 50 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes. El marido es chofer. 
Doña María con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y zapatos,  su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde sus clientes llegan a comprar sus productos. Trabaja todos los días más que todo en las mañanas, ella  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad  con lo cual sale adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y zapatos. Lleva dos ciclos en el Banco Comunal. Sus sueños son  seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, the members of the Community Bank of Pichincha meet in their home region of Pichincha. This area is well known as a vibrant place, where the majority of the people are farmers or ranchers. It's a highly vegetated area, cut by a great river that nurtures the crops.

This is where María, 50 years old, lives. She and her common-law husband have two children, who are grown up and independent. Her husband is a driver. María, desiring to earn something on her own and always with the desire to get ahead, began selling clothing and shoes of all kinds four years ago. She sells door-to-door, and she also sells out of her home, where customers come to buy her products. She works every day, but especially in the mornings. She sells to her customers on credit and bills them every fifteen days. Depending on what she needs, she goes to Guayaquil to purchase more stock every fifteen days or every month.

María will use this loan to purchase additional merchandise such as pants, blouses, shirts, and shoes. She has been a member of the community bank for two terms, and she dreams of continuing to move ahead.

loans.use: purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married and has four children. Her home has no electricity nor piped water.

Amina sells charcoal from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge from the high cost of transporting charcoal from the buying place to her place of operation.

Amina decided to join Yehu to access funds that would help her boost her business. She is applying for a 50,000 KES loan to buy more bundles of charcoal to sell. She appreciates the support she received through her previous loan.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of charcoal

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio Cesar tiene 23 años de edad vive junto a su esposa e hija en la casa de sus suegros en la zona de Cayaltí donde sus pobladores se dedican al comercio de animales menores y agricultura, a una hora de la Provincia de Chiclayo en la Región Lambayeque en la costa norte del Perú.

Son una familia que se esfuerza por tener un mejor futuro se dedican a la crianza de carneros y aves de corral en la parte posterior de su domicilio, Julio Cesar también percibe ingresos como mototaxista transportando a sus clientes que a la vez son sus vecinos.

El ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para construir una parte de su casa y también para la compra de más animales generándole más ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar is 23 years old. He lives with his wife and daughter in his parents-in-laws' house in the Cayaltí area, where the residents work in the small animals business and in farming. It is one hour from the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

They are a family that strives to have a better future, They raise calves and poultry behind their house. Julio Cesar also earns income as a motorcycle taxi driver, transporting people who are his neighbors. 

He has asked for a loan of 3 000 nuevos soles to build a house and also to buy more animals, generating more income for his family.

loans.use: to build a house and buy animals.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura is married, with three school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuations as her major challenge.

With the KES 30,000 Zuhura wants to purchase tomatoes, onions, salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, and sweets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

Zuhura dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions, salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, and sweets for resale

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 31 years old and lives in the Paynesville area, she has six children between 3 and 16, who are in school and live at home. She is married to a driver.
Hawa has been in the shortbread business for four years now. She sells from Monday to Saturday spending 8 hours each day on her business.
Hawa is requesting a loan to purchase flour, sugar, butter, etc for her business, and she hopes to open a shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, butter, etc for her business,

loans.name: Sarorn's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with her family members in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Sarorn is aged 32 and married with four children. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice. Having been in this business for several years, she manages to earn about 13,000 KHR per day and can save about 4,000 KHR each day for the future needs. 

This is group loan for Sarorn’s group of two, who live in the same village, and she is the first cycled client. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Sarorn wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is from the village of Chaladidi, West Georgia. She is 47 years old and lives with her husband Gocha, who works as an artisan locally in return for a small service fee. 

Nino is involved in an agricultural business. She owns a plot of land where she grows maize. In addition, she runs a small dairy farm and has milk cows. She milks them twice a day and produces cheese. She sells her agricultural products at the local open market. 

Nino is a very hard-working woman, with a rich experience in her work. She has requested a loan to set up a grain mill. Her mill will serve the local farmers and grind their grain. 

Gocha will work as a miller and generate income. The couple awaits your support.

loans.use: to set up a grain mill

loans.name: Jartue

texts.en:
Jartue live in the Paynesville South area.  She is 27 years old and single, with a 4-year-old child who lives at home and is in school. 

For the past six years, Jartue has been selling used clothes in the market. She started this with the help of her boyfriend and learned it from her friends, She enjoys the profit market.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plans are to build her house

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Jewelyn

texts.en:
Jewelyn live in New Kru, a town in Liberia which has poor living conditions. Jewelyn is married, and her husband is a businessman. She is 28 years old, and she has completed 12th grade. For the past three years now has been selling rice, oil, and coal at the community market from a table. She started this business with a small amount of money that she earned by selling cold water. Jewelyn says that she enjoys her customers and the money she generates from her business every day.
