Jewelyn is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, and coal for her business. She plans to build a house and go back to school.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, and coal for her business.

loans.name: Matilde Floricelda

texts.es:
En el sitio Campoverde cerca del cantón Pichincha cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Julio Cesar, este lugar se lo conoce por estar cerca de una represa donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales.
En este lugar vive la señora Matilde, tiene 33 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 15, 12,  6 y 3 años de edad, la mayor ya está comprometida, dos de sus hijos estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es agricultor. 
Doña Matilde como buena esposa que es realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en la agricultura,  él tiene cultivos de cacao y maíz, esto en toda época del año ya que cuentan con bombas para poder regar sus siembras, mientras que en el invierno también siembran arroz y maní, ella también se dedica a la cría de gallinas criollas y pollos de granja los mismos que luego vende y se gana algo extra que les sirve para salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar abonos y alimento para los pollos. Lleva más de 2 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda para ellos. Sus sueños son tener una granja de pollos más grande.
texts.en:
The “Julio Cesar” (Julius Caesar) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Campoverde near Pichincha Canton.  This place is noted for being near a dam and most of its residents work in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Matilde, 33, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has four children who are 15, 12, 6 and 3 years old.  The  oldest is engaged and two of her children attend secondary and primary school.  Her husband’s a farmer.

Like a good wife, Matilde will take out the loan for her husband to use in agriculture for he grows cocoa beans and corn all seasons of the year since they have pumps to irrigate their crops.  In winter they also grow rice and peanuts.  She also raises creole chickens and barnyard chickens that she then sells to earn a little extra money that helps them get ahead.

This loan will be used to buy manure and chicken feed.  She’s been in the communal bank more than two years and likes it because the loans are of much help to them.  Her dream is to own a bigger chicken ranch.

loans.use: to buy manure and chicken feed.

loans.name: Flor María

texts.es:
En el cantón Pichincha cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Pichincha, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación surcada por un gran rio lo cual lo hace propicia para los cultivos.
En este lugar vive la señora  Flor, tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera de  dos hijos de 21 y 5 años de edad, el mayor ya es independiente y el menor estudia en escuela. Ella está desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos ella empezó su negocio con el cual se gana el sustento diario para ella y su pequeño.
Doña Flor es una muy buena madre que hace de todo para sacar adelante a su hijo, ella lava ropa ajena con lo cual se gana algo pero también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella sale  a recorrer por la localidad y también un día o dos por semana sale a los campos a ofrecer sus productos ya que en esos lugares tiene muy buenos clientes, deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de todo tipo. Sus sueños son que a su pequeño no le falte nada.
texts.en:
The “Pichincha” communal bank meets every fifteen days in Pichincha Canton, a place known because most of its inhabitants work in agriculture and raising animals and for being a place with lush vegetation cut by a mighty river that makes it apt for crops.

Flor, 43, lives here.  She’s a single mother of two children who are 21 and 5 years old.  The oldest is independent now and the youngest attends school.  She’s been in the communal bank since the beginning and likes it because she started her business she earns her and her little one’s daily sustenance from with her first loan.

Flor is a very good mother who does everything possible to move her son forward.  She takes in laundry to earn a bit but also sells all types of clothes and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumery and women’s accessories).  She heads out to cover her location and one or two days a week heads out into the countryside to offer her goods because she has very good customers in these places.  She sells on credit and collects every 8 days.  She’s been in the activity 7 years and gets ahead this way.

The loan will be used to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and all types of clothes.  Her dream is that her little one lacks nothing.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and clothes.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
This is Tabitha, a hardworking and enterprising woman. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more goats for her business. 

She would like to apply for a loan of KES 80,000 to buy five more goats for her business.  Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. 

She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy five more goats for her business.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 33 years old and lives in the town of West Point, She is married and has a 12-year-old child, who is attending school and lives at home. 

Annie runs her table business in her community, where she sells rice, pepper, vita, salt, and othe things. She has requested a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, vita, and salt so that she can produce more sales on a daily basis.

She hopes her local business can one day be an international one, and she hopes to have her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, vita, and salt

loans.name: Yan's Group

texts.en:
Yan is 46 and married with three children. Her family lives in a village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, and she and her husband earn a living through farming rice.  They supplement the income by working for others for a fee. The current business earns about 35,000 KHR per day to better support her family. 

Yan is just with VisionFund this cycle. She is now leading a group of four members to apply for a loan with VisionFund. 

As the leader, Yan is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. 

With this loan, she hopes to make more crops and sell them for a good price to make a better living. 

In the future, she hopes to make more income from her farmland.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 57 years old. She is married and has 4 adult children. She lives in Birayan, Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte. 

Cristina has a hog fattening business and she has been in this business for 2 years earning a monthly income of 3000 Philippine pesos (PHP). 

She requests a new loan to buy hog feed. Cristina is a Cumi member of Paglaum MPC, and has been since 2008. She hopes that her business activities will allow her to save more money.

loans.use: to buy hog feed

loans.name: Elsa Narcisa

texts.es:
En el cantón Pichincha cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Pichincha, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación surcada por un gran rio lo cual lo hace propicia para los cultivos.
En este lugar vive la señora Elsa, tiene 37 años de edad, está separada  pero de esa relación  tiene  4 hijos de 18, 16, 12 y de 3 años de edad, los 3 mayores estudian en colegio. 
Doña Elsa es una muy buena madre que hace de todo para sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella se dedica a la  venta de ropa de todo tipo y productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella además hace tiempo atrás logro comprar un taxi el cual trabaja realizando fletes en la localidad con lo cual le quedan muy buenos ingresos y en el cual ella también se transporta a realizar sus ventas cuando tiene que salir lejos, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 10  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual saca adelante a su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, ropa de todo tipo y algunos repuestos para mejorar el taxi. Está desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le han brindado los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “Pichincha” communal bank meets every fifteen days in Pichincha Canton, a place known because most of its inhabitants work in agriculture and raising animals and for being a place with lush vegetation cut by a mighty river that makes it apt for crops.

Elsa, 37, lives here.  She’s separated but has 4 children who are 18, 16, 12 and 3 years of age; the three older ones attend secondary school.

Elsa’s a very good mother who does everything possible to move her children forward.  She sells all types of clothes and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumery and women’s accessories).  Some time ago she also bought a taxi that she uses to make deliveries in the location earing very good income.  She also uses it to transport herself when she needs to make her sales in faraway places.  She sells on credit and collects every 8 days.  She’s been in this activity more than 10 years and supports her family this way.

This loan will be used to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and all types of clothes as well as some spare parts to improve the taxi.  She’s been in the communal bank since the beginning and likes it because of the help the loans have always provided.  Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, clothes and spare taxi parts.

loans.name: Jessenia Elizabeth

texts.es:
En el cantón Pichincha cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Pichincha, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación surcada por un gran rio lo cual lo hace propicia para los cultivos.
En este lugar vive la señora Jessenia, tiene 27 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 9, 4 y 2 años de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Jessenia es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante, ella hace mas de 6 años adecuo un local en su casa y en el mismo instaló una papelería y librería, la misma que con el paso de los días ha ido mejorando, actualmente además de libros y útiles también vende bisutería y artículos de bazar con esto sus ganancias han mejorado mucho y esto gracias a los créditos que ha recibido ya que con ellos cada vez aumenta más su negocio.
Este crédito es para comprar útiles escolares y artículos de bazar. Esta desde hace 8 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado a mejora su negocio. Sus sueños son aumentar más su negocio.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, the members of the Community Bank of Pichincha meet in their home region of Pichincha. This area is well known as a vibrant place, where the majority of the people are farmers or ranchers. It's a highly vegetated area, cut by a great river that nurtures the crops.

This is where Jessenia, 27 years old, lives with her common-law husband and their three children, aged 9, 4, and 2 years. The eldest is a student, and her husband is a shopkeeper.  Jessenia is a woman with spirit who likes to work to get ahead. For the last six years, she has run a shop out of her home that functions as a stationery shop and a bookstore. Day by day, the store has improved. Currently, apart from books and supplies, she also sells trinkets and other school/office supplies. With these products, her earnings have greatly increased, and thanks to the loans she has received, she has been able to expand her business.

This loan will be used to buy school supplies and other stationery products. She has been in the Community Bank for eight years and she likes it because the loans have helped her improve her business. She dreams of expanding it further still.

loans.use: purchase school supplies and other stationery items for her store

loans.name: Hermes Eloy

texts.es:
En el cantón Pichincha cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Pichincha, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación surcada por un gran rio lo cual lo hace propicia para los cultivos.
En este lugar vive el señor Hermes, tiene 47 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, tres mayores y el menor de 13  añosa el cual estudia en colegio. Su mujer es ama de casa. 
Don Hermes para salir adelante junto a su familia, hace 8 meses atrás decidió instalar un mini Marquet en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas además de artículos de bazar, a pesar de que no es mucho el tiempo que tiene su negocio este tiene mucha clientela ya que esta en lugar donde muchas personas se reúnen para viajar a otras ciudades, con el trabaja un muchacho a quien le paga por sus servicios.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, entre otros viveres de primera necesidad. Lleva  tres ciclos  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la rapidez de los créditos. Sus metas son seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
In the Pichincha canton the Pichincha communal bank meets every two weeks. This place is known as being very dynamic. Most of its residents work in agriculture and raising animals. It is an area that has a lot of planted vegetation because of a big river that makes the place suitable for crops.

This is where Hermes lives. He is 47 years old. He is in a common law marriage and has four children. Three are grown and the youngest is 13 and in high school. His wife is a housewife. Eight months ago, Hermes decided to open a mini-market in his house in order to get ahead with his family. He sells all types of products such as rice, sugar, detergents, legumes, vegetables and fruit, as well as miscellaneous items. Despite not having his business for very long, he has a lot of customers since it is in a place where a lot of people gather to travel to other cities. A boy works with him, and he pays him for his services. 

He is going to use this loan to stock his store more. He will buy rice, sugar, detergent, and other staple grocery items. He has been in the communal bank for three cycles and he likes it because of the speed of the loans. His goals are to keep growing his business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent and other staple grocery items.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo es un hombre de 29 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su esposa y su pequeño hijo,el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Pablo no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Pablo trabaja como encargado de un bote que traslada turistas en su ciudad,el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Pablo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara materiales para iniciar la construcción de su vivienda, así pues el brindara mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues Pablo seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su empresa de transportes.
texts.en:
Pablo, 29, is a man living in the city of Pisco with his wife and little boy.  He’s very hardworking, enthusiastic and focuses all his efforts into moving his family forward.  Unfortunately, due to the lack of economic resources and the need to start working, Pablo was unable to study a professional career.

On his own initiative, Pablo works managing a boat that transports tourists in his city.  He works every day for about 10 hours and believes he does well because of his dedication and effort.

Pablo is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will buy building materials to start building his house to provide better security and well-being for his family.  Pablo will thus continue working and striving to reach his great dream: to own a transportation firm.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos tiene 37 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia, en la zona rural del Distrito de La Matanza una comunidad que se dedica al comercio de animales menores, que pertenece a la Provincia de Morropon, ubicado en la Región Piura costa norte del Perú.

Son una familia unida que se esfuerza en la labor que realizan de comercialización y crianza de animales menores gallinas y pato; actividad que realiza desde hace 4 años en su caserío.

El ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de más animales para poder ofrecerlos a sus clientes establecidos y generar de esta manera mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 37 years old. He lives with his wife and 2 children in his own home in the rural area of the La Matanza district, a community dedicated to the sale of small animals. It belongs to the Morropon province, located in the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru.

They are a close family that strives to do the work of selling and raising small animals such as chickens as ducks. He has done this for 4 years in his community. 

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to buy more animals to be able to offer them to regular customers and thus generate more income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy small animals.

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en:
Sary, who is 43 years old, is from a rural village located in the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. She is married with two children; one of her children is still in school. 

She and her husband have earned a living through farming rice for about 25 years. Together, they can earn about KHR 26,000 per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Sary is a first-cycle client with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. 

As the leader, Sary is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Cecibel Del Rocio

texts.es:
En el cantón Pichincha cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Pichincha, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación surcada por un gran rio lo cual lo hace propicia para los cultivos.
En este lugar vive la señora Cecibel, tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3  hijos de 22, 19 y 8 años de edad, solo la menor vive con ella y estudia en escuela.
Doña Cecibel es una mujer que ha tenido que salir adelante sola y que a base de esfuerzo y trabajo está sacando adelante a sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos. Trabaja todos los días más que todo en las mañanas ya que a esa hora su pequeña está en la escuela y así se le hace más fácil salir ya luego ella regresa a ayudarle en sus tareas de la escuela. Tiene 3 años  que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está casi desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos empezó este negocio que le permite salir adelante. Sus sueños es que a su pequeña no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, the members of the Community Bank of Pichincha meet in their home region of Pichincha. This area is well known as a vibrant place, where the majority of the people are farmers or ranchers. It's a highly vegetated area, cut by a great river that nurtures the crops.

This is where Cecibel, 40 years old, lives. She is the single mother of three children, aged 22, 19, and 8 years old. Only the youngest daughter lives with her, and the child is in school.

Cecibel is a woman who has had to rely on herself to get ahead, and with her hard work and determination, she is driving herself and her children forward. For the last three years, she has worked by selling clothing of all kinds. She sells door-to-door, and she also sells out of her home to her most well-known customers. She works every day, but especially in the mornings, since that is when her youngest is in school. It's easier for her to go out then, and then return in the afternoon to help her child with her homework. 

This loan will be used to buy merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothing.  She has been in the Community Bank nearly since the beginning, and she likes it because, thanks to the loans, she was able to start this business that has meant so much to her. Her dream is that her little daughter will want for nothing.

loans.use: purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Raul Edgardo

texts.es:
Raúl Edgardo tiene 44 años de edad vive junto a su esposa en su casa propia sin hijos dependientes vive en la comunidad de Buenos Aires en la Provincia de Morropon, ubicado en la Región Piura en la parte norte del Perú.

El se dedica desde hace 5 años a la venta de plátanos que los distribuye en una unidad propia su mototaxi, cuenta con clientela fija en la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de plátanos por pedidos adicionales, permitiéndole cumplir con sus pedidos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Raúl Edgardo, 44, lives with his wife in his own house; he has no dependent children.  He lives in the community of Buenos Aires, Morropón Province located in Piura Region in northern Peru.

He’s sold bananas for five years distributing them in his own mototaxi.  He has regular customers in the zone.  He’s asked for a 1,000 new sol loan to buy extra orders of bananas to fill pending orders and generate higher income this way.

loans.use: to buy bananas.

loans.name: Erika Paola

texts.es:
Erika Paola tiene 27 años de edad sin hijos y vive junto a sus padres en la comunidad de Cayalti donde sus principales actividades son el comercio y la agricultura a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, Región Lambayeque en la costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica al servicio de peluquería y crianza de animales menores en la parte posterior de su domicilio y eventualmente brinda servicios en la atención al público en un bar del lugar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para la inversión en compra de productos de belleza y cosméticos para atender negocio, con el incremento de su negocio, atenderá la demanda insatisfecha en el lugar, ampliará su cartera de clientes, contando con clientes nuevos e ingresos adicionales a la familia.
texts.en:
Erika Paola, 27, has no children and lives with her parents in the community of Cayalti where the main activities are commerce and agriculture.  It’s an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque Region on Peru’s north coast.

She works providing barber services and raising small animals in her back yard; she occasionally also works tending a local bar.

She’s asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2,500 new sol loan to buy beauty products and cosmetics for her business.  With the increase in business she’ll meet unmet local demand, expand her client list with new ones and earn additional family income.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Leiner

texts.es:
Leiner tiene 43 años de edad vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos menores en el distrito Nueva Arica una zona rural donde sus pobladores tiene como actividad el comercio y la agricultura, que pertenece a la Provincia de Chiclayo, que se encuentra ubicado en la Región Lambayeque en la costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral y a las labores agrícolas en la misma zona, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para invertir en la compra de animales y poder ofrecerlos a sus clientes generándole así mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Leiner, 43, lives with his wife and two minor children in Nueva Arica District, a rural zone whose residents work in commerce and agriculture; it belongs to Chiclayo Province located in Lambayeque Region on Peru’s north coast.

He works raising and selling barnyard animals and in agricultural chores in the same zone.  He’s asked for a 2,500 new sol loan to buy animals to sell to his customers earning higher income that way.

loans.use: to buy small animals.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a married woman with children, all of whom still attend school. She lives in a house that has neither electricity not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates a fruit and vegetables stall where she sells at the market to town-dwellers and neighbors. She faces challenges of competition and seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 30,000 loan, Khadija wants to purchase sacks of oranges, bananas, and green vegetables for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of oranges, bananas, and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 43 años de edad vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos de los cuales el mayor de ellos le ayuda en las labores de campo y los tres pequeños estudian en la escuela del distrito de Querocotillo donde su población se dedica a las actividades de ganadería y agricultura a dos horas de la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca en la sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la criá y venta de ganado vacuno,lo comercializa en su misma zona o lo lleva a la plaza que se encuentra en el caserío de San Juan de Chiple esto lo realiza cada tres meses, los compra flacos y luego de tres meses de engordarlos y cuidarlos sanitariamente los ofrece, dicha actividad la realiza hace 8 años, cuenta con mucha experiencia en el rubro, contando con basta clientela ya establecida, también se dedica al comercio de café.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles, para invertirlos en la compra de ganado vacuno para engordarlo y venderlo, generándole de esta manera ingresos mayores para su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos, 43, lives with his wife and four children.  The oldest one helps him with the field chores and the other three attend school in Querocotillo district.  The people in his area work in animal husbandry and agriculture and are located two hours from Cutervo Province that belongs to Cajamarca Region in Peru’s northern mountains.

He works raising and selling cattle.  He sells it locally or takes it to the square in San Juan de Chiple.  He does this every three months.  He buys them skinny and after three months of fattening them up and caring for them hygienically he sells them.  He’s been doing this for 8 years and has much experience in this line of work.  He has a large, established clientele and he is also a coffee merchant.

He’s asked for a 4,000 new sol loan to buy cattle to fatten up and then sell thus generating higher family income.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Leticia's Group

texts.en:
This group was started on July 20, 2012. It is composed of three women who run revenue-generating businesses with the goal of increasing their earning capacity. The women have all been living in the same neighborhood, and their main work involves small-scale commerce (polythene products, slippers, and assorted soaps). 

Leticia (standing in the middle of the photograph) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 46 years old, married, and the mother of three children (one girl and two boys, all in high school). 

Leticia has 20 years of experience selling slippers. She purchases her slippers from the wholesale market, and sells to customers in the community. She intends to take this loan of GHS 600 to expand her business by purchasing one big bag of slippers to sell to customers. 

The total amount of GHS 2,100 will be used by the group to buy enough goods to sell to customers.

loans.use: to purchase one big bag of slippers to sell to customers.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a married woman with no children; she lives at her own house that has neither piped water nor electricity. 

Aisha has operated a cosmetic business for the past year. Her potential customers are women. 

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase body lotion, hair oil, jewelry, hair chemicals, and hair conditioners to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase body lotion, hair oil, jewelry, hair chemicals and hair conditioners to sell

loans.name: Marlitt

texts.es:
Marlitt tiene 27 años de edad vive en la casa de sus familiares desde hace más de 10 años en el Distrito de Pucará una comunidad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido, sus pobladores se dedican al comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la Provincia de Jaén que se encuentra ubicado en la Región Cajamarca sierra norte del Perú.

Ella brindar servicios de contabilidad en la Municipalidad Distrital de Pucará por un lapso de 4 años, tiene una pequeña bodega que es administrada por su madre en la ciudad de Jaén, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para invertirlos en el incremento de su bodega y poder ofrecer así a sus clientes una variedad de productos lo que le generara mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Marlitt, 27, has lived in her family’s house for more than 10 years in Pucará District, a community noted for its hot climate.   Its residents work in commerce and raising livestock.  It’s two hours from Jaén Province that’s located in Cajamarca Region in Peru’s northern mountains.

She has worked providing accounting services in Pucará District Municipality for 4 years.  She has a small store her mother manages in the city of Jaén.  She’s asked for a 2,000 new sol loan to increase stock in her store to offer a wider variety of goods to her customers thus generating higher income.

loans.use: to buy products.

loans.name: Fatu S.

texts.en:
Fatu S. is 36 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is married and has four children ages 3, 11, 17, and 22; three live with her and attend school. She was not able to complete the sixth grade. 

Fatu S. has a business selling used clothing in the local market, which she has had for 8 years now. She started with her own money. 

Fatu S. has requested a loan to purchase more used clothing for her business. In the future, she hopes to be a big business woman and have her own store.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing for her business

loans.name: Elina

texts.es:
Elina es un mujer muy trabajadora, es madre de 2 hijos a los cuales ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo gracias a su pequeño negocio de venta de comida típica, así como también vende golosinas y dulces, Elina cree que le está yendo bien en su negocio es porque es muy responsable, tiene buena sazón y trata de manera amable a sus clientes.

Elina agradece el apoyo que le brindan los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio de golosinas y también comprar insumos como arroz por saco, azúcar, fideos, entre otros al por mayor, para su negocio de venta de comida, así podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y poder tener un negocio, mas grande.
texts.en:
Elina’s a very hardworking woman and mother of two children she’s raised with much effort thanks to her small business selling traditional food.  She also sells snacks and candy.  Elina believes she’s doing well in business because she’s very responsible, her cooking is tasty and she treats her customers kindly.

Elina is grateful for the support Kiva lenders provide because thanks to it she’ll be able to buy merchandise for her sweets business and also ingredients like rice by the sack, sugar and noodles, among others at wholesale for her food sales business.  She  will be able thus to increase her income and continue striving to make her great dream reality: to provide her children with a good education and to have a bigger business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Rosalia

texts.es:
María Rosalía tiene 67 años de edad vive con su esposo e hija, en una comunidad pequeña en la zona rural de Cayalti, donde sus pobladores se dedican al comercio de animales menores y agricultura a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo en la Región norte de la costa del Perú.

Son una familia unida que se esfuerza mucho, hace más de 12 año se dedican a la crianza y venta de animales menores en la parte posterior de su domicilio.

Ella ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para la crianza y engorde de los mismos y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Rosalía is 67 years old. She lives with her husband and daughter in a small community in the rural area of Cayalti. It lies about an hour from the city of Chiclayo in the northern coastal area of Peru. Most of the people there earn their living by selling young animals and farming.

They are a hard-working, close-knit family that has spent more than 12 years raising and selling young animals out of the back part of their home. María Rosalía has requested a loan for 2000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed which she will use to raise and fatten her animals. Doing this will let her grow her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: buy nutritionally balanced animal feed

loans.name: Abdias Richard

texts.es:
Abdias  vive en la ciudad de aguaytia, trabaja como mecánica en su ciudad y con este trabajo puede obtener los ingresos para poder subsistir y sacar adelante a su familia, asimismo con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado tener 2 mototaxis, las cuales alquila y con ello obtener un dinero extra para los gastos, Abdias cree que le va bien porque es muy trabajador.

Abdias está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han dado podrá comprar otra mototaxi para poder alquilarla y así seguir creciendo en su negocio, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y luchar por hacer realidad su sueño:” Poder tener un terreno agrícola y sembrar cultivos de su región”.
texts.en:
Abdías lives in the city of Aguaytía and works as a mechanic in his city.  He’s able to earn income with this work to subsist and move his family forward.  With much effort, he’s also been able to acquire two mototaxis he leases out to earn extra income for expenses.  Abdías believes he does well because he’s very hardworking.

Abdías is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be able to buy another mototaxi to lease out and continue growing with his business which will allow him to improve his income and strive to make his dream reality: to be able to own a piece of farmland to grow regional crops.

loans.use: to buy a mototaxi.

loans.name: Carmen Cerela

texts.es:
En la  parroquia Calderón de la ciudad de Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Desarrollo Femenino. Este lugar se lo conoce por su rica gastronomía y su vegetación, la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 44 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 5 hijos, dos mayores y tres de 12, 11 y 9 años de edad, los tres menores aun viven con ella y estudian en colegio y escuela. Su marido es comerciante.
Doña Carmen es una gran ama de casa que realiza el crédito para ayudarle a su esposo, el cual tiene un negocio de venta de frutas y legumbres, el muy de madrugada se va a la ciudad de Portoviejo a abastecerse de todos los productos en el mercado de mayoristas en esta ciudad  para luego trasladarse al mercado de su localidad y poder vender sus productos a las personas que a diario acuden a este lugar a comprar los alimentos, trabaja todos los días, realiza esta actividad desde que tenía 9 años y así el logra que nada le falte a su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar frutas y legumbres para su negocio. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ella se siente útil al ayudarle a su marido. Sus sueños son tener una tienda de víveres en su casa.
texts.en:
The members of the Desarrollo Femenino communal bank meet every 15 days in the Calderón parish in the city of Portoviejo.  This place is known for its delicious cuisine and rich vegetation.  The majority of its inhabitants work in agricultural and general commerce.

Carmen, age 44, lives here.  She is in a common-law marriage and has five children.  Two of them are grown, and the other three are 12, 11, and 9 years old.  The three minor children still live with her and go to school.  Her husband is a merchant.

Carmen is a great housewife.  She will use the loan to help her husband.  He has a business selling fruit and vegetables.  In the very early morning he goes to the city of Portoviejo to stock up on all of the products in the wholesale market in this city.  He then goes from the market to his place to be able to sell his products to the people who daily go there to buy food.  He works every day.  He has been doing this business activity since he was nine years old.  This way he manages for his family to have no unmet needs.

This loan is to buy fruits and vegetables for his business.  She is a founding member of the communal bank.  She likes it because of the loans.  She feels useful upon helping her husband.  Her dream is to have a food store at her house.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a married woman with children; she owns a house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail selling business for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of theft in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sacks of rice, wheat flour, and sugar to sell. 

She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice, wheat flour, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Port's Group

texts.en:
Port is a 29-year-old mother of two children living in a rural village of the Srey Snom district, Cambodia. Both of her children are still in school. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice. The current business earns her about 44,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first microloan for Port’s group of four with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. 

Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Port, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides for her farmland. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income to make a better living, and keep her children in school until graduation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Santa

texts.en:
Santa is married and has three children, all of whom go to school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Santa has operated a coconut selling business for the past six years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase two sacks of coconuts to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 36 years old and single.

Milagros is in the agricultural businesses, raising ducks and farming rice in the Philippines. Milagros requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her ducks.

She has been raising ducks for six years.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her ducks.

loans.name: Michel

texts.en:
Michel, 29, is a married woman with four children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Michel has a fishing business in the Philippines. Michel has been in this business for five years. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

In the future, Michel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

The man in the picture is her husband.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Ma. Charina

texts.en:
Ma. Charina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a selling ready to wear business in the Philippines.

She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks like t-shirt, pants, blouse, shoes, slippers, etc to sell.

Ma. Charina has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Ma. Charina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks like t-shirt, pants, blouse, shoes, slippers, etc to sell

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 46-years-old and has two children who are in school.

Carolina is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Carolina requested a PHP 18,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy additional pellets and feed.

Carolina has been pig fattening for four years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Carolina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional pellets and feed.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna and her retired husband live in the village of Agarak in the Syunik region. They have two daughters and a son; all are married and live abroad with their families. 

Susanna for many years has worked as a saleswoman, and now she has her own clothes business. She rents a space in Kapan city where she sells mainly children clothes. Her stall assortment is very great and colorful, and both parents and their children like Susanna’s stall very much. 

She asks a loan of AMD 1,000,000 in order to buy a new warm-clothes collection for winter.

loans.use: to buy a new warm-clothes collection for winter

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with two children; one underage, and one in school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past five years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge.  

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase soap, salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

Beatrice dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase soap, salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets to sell

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is married and has three children, all of whom go to school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Patience has operated a business selling coconuts for the past ten years, selling from home to her neighbors and passerby. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase three sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Nodar

texts.en:
Nodar is 58 years old.  He is from the Zestaponi district in West Georgia.  He lives with his wife and grown son.  Nodar’s wife works at the nursery school and earns a small monthly salary.  Nodar is a construction worker and he has recently returned from abroad, where he worked on house renovations.   At present, he is unemployed and seeking a job; but there is a high unemployment rate in the region among people over 40 and it has become hard for Nodar to find suitable work.  

It is for this reason that he has decided to start his own business.  He plans to begin trading food products but he needs a van in order to make deliveries.  With the loan, Nodar will pay for the van and start buying nuts as it is now harvest season and the prices are low.  He will then sell the nuts later in the year with a price mark-up to generate income.  He will also sell various fruits and vegetables and work hard to develop his business. 

Nodar is a very hardworking man with a great desire to ensure that his family members have good living conditions.  He will earn a good income in order to satisfy the daily needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a van to use for making product deliveries.

loans.name: Ariel  De Jesus

texts.es: Don Ariel tiene 36 años de edad, casado y tiene 3 hijos a cargo. Es originario de Jinotega. Apasionado por la música, es representante del grupo musical Mariachi; un señor emprendedor que inicio su oficio con pocos recursos económicos  hace 10 años, con 8 integrantes y sin fondos para hacer sus grabaciones. Sus compañeros de trabajo y su esposa lo apoyan en esta ardua vida como músico. Su meta es viajar a Estados Unidos y prestar los servicios como es la música. Decidió solicitar el crédito para invertir en el pago de una grabación y grabar un disco, lo cual estima que lo ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Ariel is 36 years old, and he and his wife have three children in their care. He is originally from Jinotega. He is passionate about music and is the front man for a mariachi band. He's a hard-working man who began his career with very few resources ten years ago, with eight members and no money to make recordings. His colleagues and his wife support him in his difficult life as a musician. His dream is to travel to the United States and lend his services as a musician. He decided to ask for this loan which he will use to invest in paying for a recording session and recording an album, which he believes will help improve his income.

loans.use: record an album with his mariachi band.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 32 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is not married but lives with her boyfriend and has 3 children. She was not able to complete eleventh grade but all her children are currently in school. Her partner works as a journalist. 

Cecelia has a business selling onions, vita (a juice drink), salt, oil, etc. She has had her business for 11 years. Some days the business is good and some days it is very slow. She started the business by selling red oil (palm oil). Now she is proud to support herself and her children.  

Cecelia has requested a loan to purchase more onions, vita, salt, oil, etc. In the future, Cecelia hopes to build a house. She wants to be in good health so she can pay back the money and keep supporting her children.

loans.use: to purchase more onions, vita, salt, oil, etc.

loans.name: Thorng's Group

texts.en:
Thorng is 42 years old and married; she lives with her husband and two children, one of whom is still in school. She has been farming rice and growing cassava, while her husband works as a policeman. The current business earns them about 13,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

This is the first loan for Thorng with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to ask for a loan, Thorng is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and seeds for her farmland. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s business, and earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Tawanda

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Tawanda from Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe. Tawanda means "he who does not sleep"; he is married, with no children.  

Tawanda runs a retail business selling cellphones & accessories. The business has been in operation for five years. He says the main challenge is lack of working capital.

Tawanda has requested a loan of $1,000 to buy more cellphones & accessories to sell. 

He says this loan will enable him to get more income. 

In the future, Tawanda plans to operate a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy more cellphones and accessories

loans.name: Waldy

texts.en:
Waldy moved from his home in the Dominican Republic to the States ten years ago. In 2006, he began working in construction as a carpenter, and he gained administrative and management skills. Earlier this year, he put those skills to use and started his own construction business.

Based out of Union City, Waldy’s construction business is small with less than seven employees. Waldy would like to focus on better marketing his services around New Jersey and expanding those services to compete with bigger companies. 

Waldy wants to demonstrate responsibility through this small loan in order to apply for larger loans in the future. The funds will be used specifically to advance the costs of labor and materials, such as power tools, which is necessary in order to bid for larger projects.

loans.use: to advance the costs of labor and materials, such as power tools, which is necessary in order to bid for larger projects for his construction business.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with kids. She lives in a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates a fruit and vegetable stall at the market selling to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenges of competition and seasonality in her business. 

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits, oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Parviz

texts.ru: Парвиз молодой и энергичный молодой человек. Он с детства всегда мечтал стать юристом и работать в сфере суда. Он отлично учился в средней школе. Парвиз поступил в Таджикский Государственный Университет по специальности юриста. Он является студентом 1 курса. Парвиз данное время живет отдельно от родителей в городе. Во время каникулы он приезжает в свой кишлак. Когда он приезжает домой, он помогает своим родителям по скотоводству и выращивания сельхоз культур. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Parviz is an energetic young man.  Since childhood, he has dreamed of working in the judicial system.  He received excellent grades in his pre-university schooling, and is currently a freshman studying law at a state university in Tajikistan.  He lives in his own place in Gonchi separate from his parents.  During his school breaks, he goes back to his home village and helps his parents raise livestock and grow crops.  He is seeking a loan to pay his university tuition, and is counting on your goodwill to get the money to pay it.

loans.use: pay for his university education

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is a businesswoman who is very hard working.  She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor running water.  Sidi is married and the mother of 10 children who attend school.

Sidi has operated a charcoal selling business for the past five months.  Her potential clients are neighbors and passersby.  With the loan of 30,000 KES, she plans to purchase 10 sacks of charcoal to resell.  She decided to join Yehu in order to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Phok

texts.en:
Phok, age 53, is a resident, living in Kampong Chhnang province. She is in the business of weaving and selling baskets in her home province. She has a life partner with her husband who works in the same business. They have been doing this business since 1985, and earn a good profit of KHR 50,000 per day. Her oldest daughter is also involved in purchasing made baskets and sells into the market for a profitable price.

They normally go on expanding their existing business, and aim to make consistent income from this. Phok currently has 5 children; 4 married and one still lives under their roof.

Phok would like to ask for a loan in the amount of KHR 1,600,000 to increase her capital for expanding her basket selling business by purchasing made baskets from local weavers to sell in a market.

She hopes she will gain more profits from her business, and she will be grateful for Kiva’s lenders who make her life a big change.

loans.use: to increase her capital for expanding her basket selling business by purchasing made baskets from local weavers to sell in a market.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married woman with four children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees. 

For the past year, she has operated a kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. Hellen dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans and sweets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans and sweets for resale

loans.name: Chanloek

texts.en:
Chanloek is 41 years old and a resident living in her own home in Pursat province. She is married to Chea, a farmer and a loving father of six children, whom they love very much. Chanloek and her husband always help each other manage their farm, planting and harvesting rice both for a living and for sales. They have been in business for more than 10 years.
 
She has successfully repaid her previous loan that was used on her farm. Recently, she has requested her second loan of KHR 2,000,000 to build a latrine and buy its accessories because currently there is no latrine in her house. With this loan, HKL has provided her a special interest rate than that of its general loan, encouraging her to build a healthy family by releasing less pollutants. She appreciates all the help Kiva lenders give her through HKL.

loans.use: to build a latrine and buy its accessories.

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en:
Maimuna has operated a business selling charcoal. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation to her place of work.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to buy 20 bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bags of charcoal  for resale.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is married, with three children, all of whom are very young. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a business selling poultry. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu is 40 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is married and her husband works in an office. Fatu has three children between 10 and 23. They live with her and attend school. 

For 17 years, she has been making and selling local soap. Some days the business is good, other days it's not. She learned this business from her mother and the best part of her work is that she likes rolling the soap.  Fatu has requested a loan to purchase bags of caustic soda and a container of palm oil for her business. In the future, she would like to have her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase bags of caustic soda and a container of palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.pt:
Cristina é comerciante de 59 anos de idade, solteira apenas sustenta 3 netos orfãos de pai que vivem com ela na casa própria.
Com o valor irá comprar capulanas, blusas, saias, vestidos, calcas para revender  por encomenda e traz roupas da Africa do Sul.
Diz que o seu plano é crescer no negócio e comprar uma viatura para transporte pessoal.
Compromete se a pagar pontualmente o credito e diz que voltara a solicitar mais para realizar seu projecto.
texts.en:
Cristina is a trader. She's 59 years old and single. She only supports three grandchildren who have lost their fathers and live with her in the house that she owns.
With this amount she'll purchase traditional skirts, blouses, skirts, gowns and trousers in order to re-sell them by order. She brings in clothing from South Africa.
She states that her plan is to make her business grow and buy a vehicle for personal transportation.
She pledges to repay the loan in a timely fashion and states that she'll request more loans again so she can achieve her project.

loans.use: to purchase traditional skirts, blouses, skirts, gowns and trousers.

loans.name: Paulo

texts.pt:
Paulo tem 45 anos de idade é casado tem  3 filhos com 18, 14 e 9 anos a estudar . Ele trabalha como segurança numa empresa privada e vive na casa própria não sustenta ninguém além dos seus filhos.
Com o valor irá comprar cimento, chapas de zinco, portas e janelas para dar continuidade a sua obra.
Terminar a sua obra e fazer uma barraca na sua casa como forma de reforçar a renda familiar. 
Diz que irá pagar pontualmente e voltar a solicitar novo credito para concretizar o seu projecto.
texts.en:
Paulo is 45 years old and married. He has three children aged 18, 14 and 9 years who study. He works as a security guard for a private company and lives in a house that he owns. He doesn't support anyone else other than his children.
With this amount he'll purchase cement, metal sheets, doors and windows in order to continue his construction work.
He'll finish his construction work and build a sales booth in his house as a way of boosting his family's income.
He states that he'll repay the loan in a timely fashion and request a new loan again so he can achieve his project.

loans.use: to purchase cement, metal sheets, doors and windows.

loans.name: Rogerio

texts.pt:
Rogério é chefe da sala de empacotamento numa empresa do ramo agricola, tem 4 filhos  vive maritalmente além de seus filhos sustenta sua mãe enviando.
Com o valor do credito quer comprar cimento, janelas e chapas de zinco para dar continuidade a sua obra.
O seu maior sonho é comprar uma motorizada para usar  para o serviço e suas deslocação diárias e fazer com que seus filhos tenham melhor educacao.
Diz que compromete se a honrar com o plano de repagamento, e que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar seus planos.
texts.en:
Rogério is the head of packaging for an agricultural company. He's married and has four children. Aside from his children he also supports his mother.
With the amount of the loan he wishes to purchase cement, windows and metal sheets in order to continue his construction work.
His biggest dream is to buy a motorized bike to use for work and for his daily commute. He also dreams of having his children get a better education.
He states that he pledges to abide by the repayment schedule and that he'll request more loans so he can accomplish his plans.

loans.use: to purchase cement, windows and metal sheets.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.pt:
Lucia é comerciante, casada, tem 5 filhos destes  3 ja maiores de idade e os restantes 2 estudantes. Além dos filhos sustenta 1 neto que vive com ela na casa própria.
Com  o valor do credito quer comprar chapas de zinco, cimento, areia, pedra para ampliar sua casa.
Tem como plano para o futuro terminar a ampliacao de sua casa e vedar o seu quintal com muro.
Diz que conta com ajuda do seu esposo que trabalha na Africa de Sul e que ira pagar pontualmente e ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar os seus projectos.
texts.en:
Lucia is a vendor. She's married and has five children, three of whom are already adults and the remaining two are in school. Aside from her children, she supports a grandson who lives with her in the house that she owns.
With the amount of the loan she wishes to purchase metal sheets, cement, sand and rocks in order to enlarge her house.
Her future plan is to finish enlarging her house and put up a wall around her yard.
She states that she gets help from her husband who works in South Africa. She also states that she'll repay the loan in a timely fashion and request more loans so she can achieve her projects.

loans.use: to purchase metal sheets, cement, sand and rocks.

loans.name: Kai's Group

texts.en:
Kai is the featured borrower of this group. She has always been neighbors and friends with the other group member. Kai is a 49-year-old married mother of one child. 

She has been selling wax-print fabrics for six years at the central market. She has very good experience in this domain. That is why she is acquiring a loan of 1200 GHS (Ghana Cedis) from Kiva partner ID Ghana to buy more wax-print fabric to sell to her customers. This loan will improve both her business and her family situation. 

Kai is on the left in the photograph and Patience, who sells mobile phone credit, is standing on the right.

loans.use: To buy more wax-print fabric to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is married with six children; two of her children go to school. She doesn't have an additional, income-generating activity. She has a business selling sweet bananas and has been in this business for eight years. 

She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of sweet and Cavendish bananas. She works from home six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and perishability. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler of sweet and Cavendish bananas. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of sweet and Cavendish bananas.

loans.name: Rhafinos

texts.en: This is 27-year-old Rhafinos from Harare, meaning "he who does not sleep," the capital of Zimbabwe. He is single with no children. Rhafinos runs a retail business selling groceries. The business has been in operation for three years. He says that his main challenge is stiff competition from big shops within the area. Rhafinos has requested a loan of $350 to buy more groceries for resale. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will enable him to improve his standard of living. In the future, Rhafinos plans to open a big grocery shop.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items

loans.name: Libra Group

texts.es: El grupo Libra está conformado por cinco integrantes tres mujeres y dos hombres; ellos viven en una misma comunidad y tienen una gran amistad de varios años. Don Librado es un hombre muy trabajador tiene 48 años de edad, vive en unión libre desde hace nueve años y con su pareja ha formado una familia con dos que aún no asisten a la escuela. Don Librado está solicitando un crédito a VisionFund y KIVA para comprar plásticos y pencas de nopales para su nuevo invernadero. Él cometo “Desde hace ya mucho tiempo quería tener un invernadero pero por falta de dinero era imposible, pero ahora el gobierno nos apoyará y con el crédito de la institución comprare lo faltante”. Apenas están instalando su invernadero. Don Librado platica las dificultades para obtener dicho invernadero: el gobierno les solicitaban varios tramites en el proyecto se encuentra su esposa Rosa (este grupo es independiente al grupo creado para solicitar un crédito a Kiva y VisionFund). Por varios meses estuvieron solicitando este apoyo finalmente el gobierno les dio una oportunidad de iniciar con su hortalizas. Don Librado será pieza clave para sacar adelante este invernadero de nopales y verduras, trabajaron en conjuto para poder juntos obtener ganancias satisfactorias. Anteriormente Don Librado tenia una pequeña tienda de abarrotes sin embargo decidió cerrar el lugar porque sus ventas ya no eran como deseaba. Ahora ha despositado mucha fe en esta nueva aventura. Sin embargo, la preocupación mas grande de Don librado es dónde vender su producción; será difil vender su verdura en los puestos o en otros negocios, pero esta consciente de esta situación por lo que tendrá  que buscar clientes antes de iniciar a cosechar su verdura. La meta de Don Librado es poder llegar a comparar un terreno más grande donde pueda instalar otras hortalizas para poder competir con otros grandes empresarios “Me daría mucho gusto poder llegar a ser un proveedor en las grandes centrales de abasto, así podría yo mejorar la calidad de vida de mis niños”. El grupo Libra esta conformado por Vero quien invertirá en venta de zapatos por catalogo, Gilberta en la venta de bordados, Francisca en su tiendita de abarrotes Y Don Felix en la venta de frituras y botanas. Ellos están muy agradecidos con VisionFund y KIVA por el préstamo otorgado porque asi podrán invertir en sus pequeños negocios.
texts.en:
The Libra group is made up of five members: three women and two men. They live in the same community and they have a great friendship of many years. Librado is a very hardworking man, is 48, and has been in a common-law marriage for nine years. With his partner he has formed a family with two children who haven't started school yet. Librado is asking for a loan from VisionFund and Kiva in order to buy plastic and cactus pads for his new greenhouse.

He commented, "For a long time I have wanted to have a greenhouse but without money it was impossible, but now the government will help us and with the loan from the institution I will buy what I need." His greenhouse is just now being installed. Librado talks about the difficulties of obtaining the greenhouse: the government required lots of paperwork.  His wife was part of that project (this group is independent of the group created to take out credit with Kiva and VisionFund). For many months they were applying for this help and finally the government gave them an opportunity to start with their vegetables.

Librado will be a key part of moving this cactus and vegetable greenhouse forward. They worked together to be able to obtain satisfactory earnings. Before, Librado had a small grocery store but decided to close the place because his sales weren't what he desired. Now he has put much faith in this new venture. Without doubt, Librado's biggest worry is where to sell his crops. It will be difficult to sell his vegetables in stalls or in other businesses. He is aware of this situation, therefore, he will have to look for customers before starting to harvest his vegetables.

Librado's goal is to be able to buy a larger plot of land where he can plant other vegetables to be able to compete with the other large businesses. "I would really like it if I could become a provider in the large wholesale market. Thereby, I would be able to improve the quality of life of my children." The Libra group also includes Vero, who will invest in the sale of shoes by catalog, Gilberta who sells embroidery, Francisca who has a small grocery store and Felix who sells fried foods and snacks. They are very thankful for VisionFund and Kiva for the provided loan because with this, they will be able to invest in their small businesses.

loans.use: to buy plastic and cactus pads.

location.town: San Pablo Tlachichilpa, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is 43 years old and she lives in Kapan city. Karine has a specialty of nurse but she has never worked. She got married very young, at just 18 years old. Her life turned out to be very difficult and full of problems during her married years. When her elder son was 5 years old, and the younger one 3 years old, she divorced her husband. Since then, she was alone with her children with great responsibility to bring up honest people as well as feed and dress them properly. So, she began working at different places and now she works as an inspector at a reserve. Her sons are already grown-up men and both of them have higher education degrees and already work.

Karine asks for a loan of 700,000 Armenian drams since her younger son is going to get married. She needs this money to organize his wedding party.

loans.use: to organize her younger son's wedding party

loans.name: Suren

texts.en:
Suren is a young farmer from the Griboyedov village in the Armavir region. He lives with his parents, sister, wife, and one-year-old daughter. Suren works in the village local self-governance body. However, his salary is so low that he cannot afford a living based on that salary alone. 

To be able to meet the daily needs of the family, Suren is engaged in breeding a livestock of cows and piglets. He also cultivates alfalfa and grapes. Farming is a very important source of income for them. To be able to meet the increasing needs of his family, Suren needs to expand his agribusiness. 

A loan of $3,000 will be a great support to this hard-working, young farmer, and will enable him to purchase two steers for the livestock, to buy some forage for them, and to make previous credit repayments. Suren and his family will be grateful to all the lenders for their help in collecting the amount needed for the loan and sustaining their lives.

loans.use: to buy forage for livestock and make previous credit repayments

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu is 49 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She lives with her husband, who is a local businessman. They have four children between 12 and 26 years old. Only two of her children live at home with them and are attending school. 

For 10 years, Musu has been cooking and selling delicious Liberian food. Sometimes she doesn't have enough money to buy her ingredients wholesale and has to buy retail which is much more expensive. She likes to talk with her customers and learned how to cook from her auntie a long time ago. 

Musu has requested a loan to buy fish, meat, onions, vita, peppers, oil, rice, etc. for her business. In the future, she would like to have her own place in the market and build a house for herself and her children.

loans.use: to buy fish, meat, onions, vita, peppers, oil, rice, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anitha

texts.en:
Anitha is a 34-year-old woman who lives in the West Point area. She and her partner are living together and have a one-year-old child. 

Anitha runs a table where she sells pepper, rice, oil, salt, vita juice, etc. in her area. Sales are not always good because she has few goods on her table. Anitha is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, rice, oil, salt, vita juice, etc., for her business.

She hopes to build a house for her child in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, rice, oil, salt, vita juice, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 39 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, with two of them currently in school. For the past two years, Robert has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, soap, and salt. 

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of UGX 3,000,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items for the shop to sell.  It will help Robert to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children in better schools. 

Robert hopes that in the future he will be able to build more rental houses. 

Robert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robert who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to purchase more items for his shop to sell,

loans.name: Alba Estela

texts.es:
Alba de 38 años, vive junto a sus hijos: una hembra y un varón de 16 años de edad (gemelos) que estudian 9° grado y un varón de 10 años que estudia 4° grado, viven en casa propia que les heredó su esposo y padre respectivamente.

 Ella Vende pupusas los días sábados y domingos en el garaje de su casa, esto lo hace desde hace 10 años, e inicio haciéndolo como una iniciativa de apoyo económico para su esposo; también, venden bebidas gaseosas, refrescos naturales y productos congelados como charamuscas, hielo y choco bananos.

 Estos Productos aprendió a elaborarlos cuando tenía 20 años y que trabajo como empleada.


El préstamo será invertido, en la compra de una cocina para la elaboración de pupusas, mesas, sillas y adecuación de un local que desea rentar en la zona comercial de la ciudad.


Con el  fallecimiento del esposo los ingresos de la familia han disminuido, solo reciben $86.00 mensual de  pensión, y necesitan generar mejores ingresos; debido a que los gastos de vida se mantienen y podrían ir en aumento conforme el avance en el estudio sus hijos.


Al mejorar las condiciones de sus equipos de trabajos, se espera que tengan mejores oportunidades de ventas y esto signifique mayores utilidades comerciales, esperando que sus condiciones de vida mejoren.

Ella dese, establecer  su  negocio en la zona comercial de la ciudad, esforzándose,  para apoyar a sus hijos en el estudio académico.
texts.en:
Alba is 38 years old. She lives with her children: 16 year old twins, one male, one female who study in Grade 9 and a 10 year old son who is in 4th grade. They live in their own house that they inherited, her from her husband, the children from their father. 

Alba has been selling pupusas from the garage of her house on Saturday and Sunday for ten years now. She started it as a way to help her husband financially. She also sells soft drinks, natural drinks, and frozen products like charamuscas (like a frozen smoothie), snow cones and chocolate bananas. She learned how to make these products as an employee when she was 20 years old.

Alba will invest the loan to buy a kitchen to make pupusas, tables, chairs and to adapt the space she wants to rent in the city center. With the passing of her husband, the family's income has fallen. They get $86 monthly as a pension and they need to generate more money given that their expenses are the same as before and might increase as the children advance in school.

Improving the condition of her work environment, she hopes to enjoy greater opportunities for sales and this would bring greater business profits. She hopes to improve their standard of living. She wants to establish her business in the city center, trying very hard to support her children in their studies.

loans.use: to buy a kitchen to make pupusas, tables, chairs and adapting the place she wants to rent in the center of the city.

loans.name: Azat

texts.en:
Azat is from the Pshatavan village of the Armavir region. He lives with his mother and wife. 

Azat is a contractual serviceman in the army. He and his family are engaged in breeding piglets and in cultivating wheat, apricots, and grapes. Azat's mother and wife help him greatly in his every-day activities related to farming. 

He currently needs to enlarge his livestock to be able to address the growing costs of his family more effectively. A loan of US$ 3,000 will be a huge support to Azat and his family.  It will enable him to purchase seven steers and some forage for them. 

The family highly appreciate the lenders' support and will be very thankful to them for helping them in collecting the needed amount of loan to develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase seven steers and some forage for them

loans.name: Vazha

texts.en:
Vazha is a 39-year-old married man living in the coastal town of Kobuleti with his wife and two school age children. The only source of income for the family is a small-sized social assistance from the local government as they live below the poverty line. 

Vazha is jobless but owns a car and plans to use it as a taxi and start a business, but he needs money to change his car’s fuel system.  A loan of $600 will help Vazha to pay for changing his car's fuel system from petrol (gasoline) to natural gas, which is cheaper than petrol and will reduce the cost of transportation by 40 to 45 per cent. It will allow Vazha to offer cheap service to his customers and attract them. 

His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative of Kiva and MFO, permitting the vulnerable poor to start or re-start businesses. With this Startup loan, Vazha will start a taxi business and generate income for food and everyday expenses. The increased income will be used for his family's well-being.

loans.use: to change his car's fuel system and start a taxi business

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a 21-year-old, married female. She has one child who is 3 years old and whom she supports. She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer. 

She has a cafe. She has been in this business, which is located at Kijiwetanga, for five years. In her business, she earns a monthly income of 6,000 KES. She is taking her first loan of 10,000  KES which she intends to use to add stock to her business by buying wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking oil. Mwanaisha will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family are to grow her business and also educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking oil to make food for her business.

loans.name: Jafete

texts.pt:
Jafete  de 30 anos de idade é balconista , tem 1 filho com 4 anos de idade é casado vive na casa própria sustenta  2 irmaos que vivem com ele.
Com o valor ira comprar porta, areia, ferro, cimento, pedra para dar continuidade a sua obra.
Planos para o futuro ter um restaurante proprio, adiquirir um espaco no campo onde passa servir  de quinta para criar gado e fazer machamba.
Diz que  compromete se a pagar pontualmente e solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar  seus projectos
texts.en:
