For the past 9 years, Indu Devi has been selling different types of mobile phones in the local market with help from her son. She is doing well in mobile phone selling.  As mobile coverage is increasing in rural areas, she is getting more demands for mobile phones.

Indu Devi has requested a loan amount of 50,000 Nepalese Rupees to increase her stock of different brand mobiles phones so that she can meet the increasing  demand by offering a variety of mobile phones to her customers. In the future, she would like to expand her business and continue adding wealth to live in prosperity.

loans.use: buy mobile phones to sell

loans.name: La Provincia Group

texts.es: El grupo está formado por tres mujeres luchadoras y trabajadoras una de ellas es Tania tiene la edad de 19 años, casada, con un hijo en camino, su negocio es la venta de cosméticos generales y por catálogos de Vogue y Zermat  desde hace 3  años, sus productos los comercializa en su comunidad. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de productos como crema corporal, shampoo, tintes para el cabello, cremas facial, bloqueadores, maquillaje. Celina tiene la edad de 49 años su negocio es una pulpería desde hace año y medio y Yessenia  tiene la edad de 34 años su negocio es la venta de tortillas desde hace año y medio.
texts.en: This group consists of three hardworking women who are fighters. One of the members is Tania, who is 19 years old, married and has a son on the way. She has made a living selling general cosmetics and Vogue and Zermat catalog items in her community for the past three years. She is requesting the loan to purchase products like body and facial creams, shampoos, hair dyes, sun block and makeup. Celina is 49 years old and has had a convenience store for a year and a half, and Yessenia is 34 and has made a living selling tortillas for a year and a half.

loans.use: to purchase body and facial creams, shampoos, hair dyes, sun block and makeup.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a 31-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband who is also shown in the photo. Her husband assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over the time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products, and they make enough to meet the expenses of their household. Currently, Naseem has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is a 45-year-old lady; she has been stitching clothes for the past several years. She stitches the garments with the help of needy women living in her locality, in this way she indirectly helps the needy women and earns income for her family. All the ladies are sewing clothes with love and good spirits.

Nowadays, two more needy women want to join their company, but there are no more sewing machines available for them. Therefore, Najma requested a loan so that she could buy two more sewing machines to provide a source of income to both ladies to create a means of increasing revenue.

Najma hopes that this loan will prove positive and beneficial for her and for all needy women. Najma says thank you to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy two sewing machines for tailoring business.

loans.name: Mehfooz A Aziz Group

texts.en:
Mehfooz is 60 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her eight children. She requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. This amount will help her to expand her husband's auto workshop by purchasing a variety of auto parts which are required.

She wants the financing to invest in the expansion of her husband's workshop, which is the only source of income for their family. 

She believes in working together (with her husband) and honesty and is confident that the loan will bring positive changes to their business and will increase monthly profits.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of auto parts

loans.name: Waleed

texts.en:
Waleed is 29 years old, married, and has three children. Waleed works hard to provide his family’s income all by himself. He owns a small shop where he sells stationery, desk supplies, and books, etc. He established his business three months ago and has gained good experience in this field. Waleed now has one employee hired and is becoming well known for copying book reports for his customers.

Waleed is requesting a loan to purchase a copier machine, stationery and copying requirements. Waleed aims to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may be able to provide a good life for his family.

Waleed with his business is just one of many examples of Izdiharona for Economic Development's clients.

loans.use: to purchase a copier machine, stationery and copying requirements.

loans.name: Fany Margarita

texts.es:
Fany, solicita un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio de licuados, golosinas y bisutería, comprara ingredientes para los licuados (leche, naranjas, zanahorias, guineos, etc.), diversificara las golosinas y material para bisutería que ofrece a sus clientes. Tuvo resultados positivos con el crédito anterior que le ayudaron a generar más ingresos, ampliar su negocio y tener clientes nuevos.
Su núcleo familiar es el mismo, ella ya cuenta con trabajo fijo  y el negocio está siendo administrado por su madre, sus condiciones de vida son mucho mejores.
texts.en:
Fany is requesting a new loan to invest in her business of smoothies, sweets and costume jewelry.  She will buy ingredients for the smoothies (milk, orange, carrots, bananas, etc.), a variety of sweets, and materials to make costume jewelry.  She obtained positive results from the previous loan as it helped generate more income, expand business and attract new customers.

Her family situation is the same.  She has a permanent job and the business is being managed by her mother, so her living conditions are much better.

loans.use: To buy smoothie ingredients (milk, oranges, carrots, bananas, etc.), a variety of sweets and materials to make costume jewelry.

loans.name: Unido Group

texts.es:
Ida, es una mujer emprendedora, originaria de la ciudad de Bilwi, casada y con 6 hijos. Desde hace 5 años vende en el mercado mondongo, pellejo, carne de cerdo y bastimentos como: yuca, malanga, quequisque, plátanos, bananos, filipitas. 

Actualmente solicita financiamiento para comprar 3 cerdos, engordarlos y después vender su carne y obtener más ganancias. Ella está luchando por lograr mejorar el local donde tiene su venta de productos, actualmente está en mal estado; su mayor anhelo es construirlo de cemento.

John, es un señor amable, cuya principal actividad económica y fuente de ingreso es su taller de ebanistería, fabrica muebles de madera por encargo. El préstamo que solicita es para comprar máquinas para el taller que le faciliten elaborar muebles con mayor rapidez y calidad.

Marcela, es una señora jovial, tiene un tramo en el mercado de Bilwi donde vende granos básicos: arroz, frijoles, maíz, yuca, malanga, quequisque, plátanos, bananos. Solicita financiamiento para surtir su tienda con otros productos que demanda la población.
texts.en:
Ida is an entrepreneur from the city of Bilwi who is married and has six children.  For five years she has been running her market stall selling pork meat and other goods such as yucca plant, malanga (edible root), quequisque (coco yam), bananas and filipitas.

She is requesting a loan to buy three pigs to fatten and then sell at her shop.  She is struggling to improve the stall where she works since it is in disrepair.  She wants to build a stand out of cement.

John is a kind man who earns a living with his carpentry business.  He makes furniture on an order basis and plans to use the loan to buy machinery for his workshop so he can improve the quality of his products and shorten delivery time.

Marcela is a cheerful woman who has a stand at the Bilwi market where she sells basic goods: rice, beans, corn, yucca plant, malanga, quequisque, and bananas.  She wants a loan to stock her business with other products in popular demand.

loans.use: To buy three pigs for her butcher shop.

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es: Herlinda es una joven de 23 años, está casada con Zosimo y tiene una hija de 2 años que viven con ella en su casa hecha de adobe . Hace 5 años se dedica a la agricultura y producción de cacao orgánico en su parcela de 1 hectárea que compró con ayuda de su pareja y sus padres por ser muy trabajadora. Al iniciarse en esta actividad contó siempre con el apoyo de su esposo realizando las tareas cotidianas con el objetivo de lograr que sus cultivos frutos de calidad. Uno de los principales inconvenientes que afectaron su labor fue el ataque de plagas que intentaron perjudicarlo, sin embargo gracias a charla informativas y asesoramiento por parte de una entidad agraria logro manejar el problema de la manera mas adecuada y sin complicaciones. Para obtener una mejor calidad de frutos en cada campaña suele aplicar abono orgánico a sus cultivos. Este es el primer préstamo con Kiva y agradece por la confianza que les brinda a otros agricultores de su zona como ella. En esta ocasión desea solicitar S/.1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Herlinda, 23, is married to Zosimo and they have a two-year-old daughter.  The family lives in an adobe house.  For five years Herlinda has been involved in agriculture and organic cocoa production on the one-acre patch of land she bought with help from her husband and her parents, because of her hard work.  Since starting the activity she has always had the support of her husband in the daily chores in an effort to produce a quality crop.  One of the main challenges they have had to face was a plague affecting the crop; but thanks to informative talks and advice from an agriculture entity, they managed to overcome the problem without complications.

In order to obtain a better harvest each season, Herlinda treats the soil with organic fertilizer.  This is her first Kiva loan and she is grateful for the confidence shown in farmers in the area, like herself.  She is requesting 1,000 PEN to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Talula Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman tres socias de éxito una de ellas es Soraya tiene la edad de 31 años, casada, con dos hijos menores, su negocio es la venta de sopa de mondongo desde hace 7 años, tiene de ser cliente de la institución 5 años, el crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de materia prima como leña, yuca, repollo, quequisque, mondongo, cebolla, chiltoma, tomate,ayote, chayote, naranja agria etc. Jeysi tiene la edad de 44 años su negocio es la venta de café, pan y leche ambulante y María tiene la edad de 50 años su negocio es taller de costura y bordado en su domicilio.
texts.en:
The Talula group is comprised of three successful members, one of whom is Soraya.  She is 31 years old, married and has two minor children.  She has been in business selling tripe soup for seven years and has been a client of the institution for five years.  She is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as firewood, yucca plant, cabbage, tuber, tripe, onion, sweet pepper, tomato, squash, bitter orange, etc.

Jeysi, 44, is a street vendor and sells coffe, bread and milk.  Maria, 50, has a sewing and embroidery shop that she runs from home.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her business.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 33 years old married to Alice. Together they are blessed with two children ages thirteen and five years old.

He has a general shop in Ndunyu njeru which he has been running for ten years with an average monthly income of ksh 48,000. He has applied for a second loan from Kadet ltd after paying his previous loan successfully. This loan will enable him to buy stocks of sugar, flour, cooking fat, etc. With the anticipated profit he plans to add more inventory.

In the near future, he hopes to boost his business to increase his income and uplift his family living standards.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, cooking fat, etc.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
María de 42 años, vive junto a sus tres hijos: una hija de 19 años de edad, que estudia el cuarto ciclo en licenciatura en comunicaciones en la universidad (becaria) y es locutora en una radio en la ciudad; un varón de 17 años, graduado de bachillerato general, este desde los 11 años se dedica a la música y es miembro de la banda del colegio, aprendió de la música con el papá en la 3ª. Brigada de infantería (cuartel Militar); también, vive con  una hija de 9 años de edad, que estudia 3ª grado.

Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta  de tamales y atoles, tres veces por semana hace atoles de diferentes productos, en promedio vende $17.33 por día,  los días lunes hace $35.00 dólares de tamales para  la venta, los días viernes y sábado hace empanadas, en promedio $30.00 por día. Vende sus productos yendo de casa en casa, por la colonia  donde reside y en las comunidades vecinas. La materia prima para sus productos las adquiere en el mercado municipal de la ciudad,  y hace un  recorrido de 5 kilómetros aproximadamente en buses. 

El préstamo servirá para adecuar el área de cocina en el patio de la vivienda; pues, la familia está afrentando enfermedades respiratorias, por el exceso de humedad y  de humo dentro de la vivienda.  

 
 Al no cocinar dentro de la vivienda, se espera que los padecimientos de alergias, por el exceso de humo y la humedad que genera el cocinar dentro se disminuya.


Desea, seguir con el  negocio y apoyar a sus hijos, para que puedan seguir con sus estudios, especialmente al hijo para que estudie la licenciatura en música en la capital.
texts.en:
Maria, 42, lives with her three children: a 19-year-old daughter who studies communications at the university, where she is in her fourth year, and works as a radio announcer in the city; a 17-year-old son who has a high school diploma and has been involved in music since the age of 11 and is a member of the school band (He learned music from his father who is in the Third Infantry Brigade); and her nine-year-old daughter who is in third grade.
 
Maria makes and sells tamales and "atoles" (drinks).  Three times a week she makes drinks out of different products and sells an average $17.33 worth a day.  On Mondays she takes in $35.00 from sales of tamales.  And on Fridays and Saturdays she makes empananas (meat pies), with average daily sales being $30.00.  She sells her products door-to-door throughout the community where she lives and in neighboring communities.  She buys the ingredients for her products at the municipal market in the city, which is about 5 kilometers away by bus.

The loan will be used to install a kitchen area on the patio of her house because the family is suffering from respiratory illnesses due to the excess humidity and smoke inside the house.  By not cooking inside the house she hopes the allergies due to to excess smoke and humidity from the cooking will diminish.

She wants to continue with her business to support her children so they can continue with their education, especially her son who is studying toward a music degree in the capital city.

loans.use: To install a new kitchen.

loans.name: Joyce Del Carmen

texts.es: La joven Joyce del Carmen habita en Managua, tiene 22 años de edad, es casada y tiene un bebe en quien ha dedicado todo su esfuerzo por culminar sus estudios universitarios.  En la actualidad Joyce se encuentra culminando su carrera de Ingeniería en Sistemas, la cual a pesar de estar embarazada no los ha interrumpido. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de una computadora, ya que esta es una importante e indispensable herramienta de estudio y trabajo que le permitirá adquirir mayor experiencia y competir con otros profesionales de su misma área.
texts.en:
Young Joyce del Carmen lives in Managua. She is 22, married and has a baby, who is the reason why she has put a lot of effort into finishing her university studies. Joyce is currently in the last phase of her Computer Engineering studies, and she has not interrupted them, despite her pregnancy.

She is requesting a loan to buy a computer, which is an important and indispensable study and work tool that will help her acquire more experience and be more competitive in her professional field.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Ilsia Evelyn

texts.es:
Ilsia, está nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para compra de leña, maíz, queso, telas, zippers, hilos, etc., todo lo necesario para mantener activa su actividad económica, con el préstamo anterior adquirió los insumos necesarios para seguir trabajando, con la mejora que ha tenido en sus ingresos incluyo la venta de queso.
Su núcleo familiar sigue siendo el mismo, su negocio no le ha dado ningún problema, todos están muy saludables y sus hijos siguen siendo apoyados en sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Ilsia is requesting a new loan in order to buy firewood, corn, cheese, fabric, zippers, thread, etc.  All of these items are necessary for her to actively maintain her tortilla and sewing businesses.  With the previous loan, she was able to purchase the necessary supplies in order to continue working.  Her income has increased because she is now also selling cheese.

Her family continues to feel the same; her businesses have not presented any problems and all of her family members are healthy.  Her children continue to feel supported in having their needs met.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn, cheese, fabric, zippers, thread, etc.

loans.name: José Noe

texts.es:
José de 24 años, vive junto con su compañera de vida y un hijo de 4 años  de edad. Convive con la suegra. Tienen, 4 años de estar acompañados. Se graduó de bachiller General.

Después de graduarse de bachiller, presentó currículum en una Farmacia y fue aceptado, trabaja en este  lugar desde hace más de 3 años y goza de la confianza de la empresa y se desempeña como cajero.

El préstamo servirá para comprar materiales de construcción: bloques, cemento y hierro, esto es para edificar una habitación que les permita, tener su espacio íntimo familiar.

El préstamo permitirá  a esta pareja,  convivir con mejor plenitud, gozar de un espacio de privacidad, donde puedan  solucionar sus problemas sin dificultad.

Él desea estudia licenciatura en comunicaciones en la Universidad.
texts.en:
José is 24 years old. He lives with his life's companion and a 4 year old son. They live with his mother in  law and have been together for 4 years. He graduated from high school. 

After graduating from high school, he gave his resume to a pharmacy and was accepted. He has worked there for more than 3 years and has the business' trust. He works as  a cashier.

The loan will be used to buy construction materials such as blocks, cement and iron. This is to build a room that will allow them to have private family space. The loan will allow this couple to live more fully and have some privacy where they can solve their problems without difficulty. 

He wants to major in communications at the university.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as blocks, cement and iron in order to build a room that will allow them to have private family space.

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es: Rosa, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada, tiene un hijo y reside en La Masica, Atlántida. Siempre se a dedicado al comercio, lleva 8 años de vender achinería, cosméticos, bisutería, ropa, lociones, joyas etc. La mercadería la vende por pedidos o encargos y entrega a domicilio. Ha solicitado varios prestamos para su actividad de negocio, el préstamo que solicito actualmente es el ciclo numero 12, el cual es por 22,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de mas mercadería para la venta como ropa, aretes, pulceras, cadenas, lociones, cosméticos, bisutería y otros encargos,y va utilizar un 20% para cancelar una deuda adquirida en otra institución en donde paga muchos intereses. Su meta es crecer con el negocio, incrementar las ventas y así poder obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Rosa is 49 years old. She is married, has a son and lives in La Masica, Atlántida. She has always worked as a merchant. She has been selling miscellaneous items, cosmetics, costume jewelry, clothes, lotions, jewelry, etc. for 8 years. She sells the merchandise on order and delvers to people's homes. She has taken out several loans for her business activity. The loan she has taken out now is her 12th cycle. It is for 22,000 Lempiras and she is going to invest it in buying more merchandise to sell such as clothes, earrings, bracelets, necklaces, lotions, cosmetics, costume jewelry and more. She will use 20% to pay off a loan she acquired in another institution where she pays a lot of interests. Her goal is to grow her business, increasing sales and thus obtaining more profits.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell such as clothes, earrings, bracelets, necklaces, lotions, cosmetics, costume jewelry, and more. She will use 20% to pay off a debt acquired in another institution.

loans.name: Mujeres Al Progreso Group

texts.es: El grupo “MUJERES AL PROGRESO” está conformado  por 08 socias y socios que se encuentran muy contentos por estar pasando el 04 ciclo. Andrea tiene 45 años es soltera con 02 hijos educando hace varios años implemento un restaurant en su vivienda en el  cual ofrece desayuno almuerzo. Y a la vez se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza. Su mayor deseo es implementar su  restaurant con la venta de cerveza y gaseosas. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de víveres: pollo, verduras, tubérculos arroz, aceite.  El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Andrea es la que se encuentra incluida en la parte superior derecha que no puedo estar presente en la reunión del grupo.
texts.en:
The Mujeres al Progreso group is comprised of eight male and female members who are very happy to be in their fourth cycle.  

Andrea is forty-five years old, and is single with two children.  For several years she has had a restaurant that she runs in part of her home; she offers both breakfast and lunch.  At the same time, she also sells beauty products.  Her greatest dream is to provide beer and carbonated beverages at the restaurant.  

She will invest the loan in the purchase of supplies, including chicken, green vegetables, root vegetables, rice, and oil.

The entire group is grateful to the Kiva investors and for the loan.  Andrea is the individual pictured in the upper right hand corner; she could not be present at this particular group meeting.

loans.use: to buy chicken, root vegetables, green vegetables, rice, and oil.

loans.name: Irsa Dolores

texts.es: Irsa, tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Hace 3 años que se dedica a la venta de ropa como camisas, jeans, short, blusas, ropa interior, etc. esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante ofrece de casa en casa el producto. El préstamo que ha solicitado es el tercer ciclo y es por un monto de 8,000 Lempira con el cual va comprar mas productos  para la venta como ser pantalones, blusas, camisetas y vestidos, con el propósito de aumentar sus ingresos. Su meta es establecer el negocio en un local fijo y poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Irsa, 46, is a single mother. She has two children and lives in Macuelizo, a municipality located in Santa Bárbara. She has been selling clothes (e.g. shirts, jeans, shorts, blouses and underwear) for three years as a street vendor, selling door-to-door.

This is Irsa’s third cycle and she is requesting a loan of 8,000 Lempiras [HNL] to buy more products to sell, such as pants, blouses, shirts and dresses, with the intention to increase her income. Her goal is to have her own establishment, where she can run her business and be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell, such as pants, blouses, shirts and dresses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a second hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, opta por otro crédito para su negocio de venta de mariscos. Lo invertirá en la compra de pescados, camarones, conchas, etc., frescos que le ayuden a mantener sus clientes satisfechos. Con el capital que se facilito ella pudo surtir el negocio y ha seguido trabajando sin ningún problema.
La familia de María sigue luchando junto a ella para salir adelante con el negocio y seguir mejorando su entorno.
texts.en:
María chooses to take out another loan for her seafood business. She will use it to buy fresh fish, fresh shrimp, fresh shellfish, etc. which will help her to keep her customers satisfied. With the capital she has obtained she could stock her business and has continued to work without any problems.

María and her family continue to strive to get on with the business and to improve their environment.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish, fresh shrimp, fresh shellfish, etc.

loans.name: Lizeth Estefania

texts.es: Lizeth, tiene 31 años de edad,  está casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de La Masica, Atlantida. Lizeth, decidió poner su propio negocio para generar ingresos para su familia y estableció una pulpería hace 3 años que lo tiene donde ofrece diferentes tipos de productos alimenticios como ser carnes, granos básicos, lácteos, embutidos, refrescos, churros, pan, azúcar, manteca y otros. El prestamo que solicito es por 15,000 Lempiras, el cual es el segundo ciclo con ODEF y lo va invertir en la compra de más productos alimenticios para la venta como ser arroz, frijoles, azúcar, manteca, refrescos, carnes, lácteos, embutidos etc. y asi poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos, obteniendo mejores ganancias. Su plan es sacar adelante a la familia y que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Lizeth is 31 years old, she is married, has two children and lives in the town of La Masica, Atlantida. Lizeth decided to establish her own business in order to earn the income for her family and opened a grocery store. She has had this store for 3 years and sells various types of food, for example meat, bulk grains, dairy, cold cuts, soft drinks, donuts, bread, sugar, lard, and more. 

The loan she requested is for 15,000 lempiras. It is her second cycle with ODEF and she will use to loan to buy more food products for her store, like rice, beans, sugar, lard, soft drinks, meat, dairy, cold cuts, etc. By this she will be able to offer a greater variety of products and to make more profit. 

It is her plan to get her family ahead and she wants her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy food products like rice, beans, sugar, lard, soft drinks, meat, dairy, cold cuts, etc. to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel lives in a small town in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, and is the southernmost Kenyan county. Though some of the towns along the beach see benefits from tourism, the majority of people living inland are farmers, and the region's inconsistent rains can make agricultural yields unpredictable. Beekeeping is a relatively new activity in the area, but many farmers here are enthusiastic at the prospect of owning their own hives.

Samuel is married, and has four children. Both he and his wife work as farmers, and they are currently growing an assortment of crops on their land as well as tending to a tree plantation. He was interested in becoming involved with beekeeping because it will be a chance to train the younger generation about this valuable skillset. 

This is Samuel’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to start horticulture farming on his land. In the future, he hopes to start a demo farm, with livestock, grain crops, trees and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed lives near Kikoneni, in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers  in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives, and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.  

Mohamed, who runs a small business in town, is married to a teacher and has two children. A farmer for 15 years, he is currently growing mangoes on his land. He is interested in starting beekeeping because it will be a good source of income for his family, and his bees will also help pollinate his crops, leading to higher production.

This will be Mohamed’s first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to increase the stock in his business.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives on a farm outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping. 

Rose is widowed, and has nine children. She is currently keeping chickens, goats and cows on her land, and has been doing so for five years. Rose likes beekeeping because it is an income-producing project, and she plans to use the income generated by her hives to help her take care of her cows, by buying them feed and medicine. 

This is Rose’s first loan with Kiva, and she hopes to save up enough money to “build a big house for my family.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William lives on a farm outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential region for beekeeping. 

William is married, and has seven children. He has been farming for forty-one years, and is currently tending to a maize crop and rearing livestock. William likes keeping bees, because it is not a taxing activity. The bees generally take care of themselves. 

This is William’s first loan, and he plans to use the profits from his hives “for general family upkeep.” His hope for the future is “to have a stable family in all scopes of life.”

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives on a farm close to Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage. 

Susan is married and has two children. Both she and her husband have been farming for six years, and are currently growing maize, bananas and beans as well as tending to livestock. Susan likes beekeeping because “It doesn't require constant supervision.”

This is Susan’s first loan with Honey Care, and she plans to use the profits generated by her beehives to educate her young children. Her hope for the future is “to see my children getting the best education.”

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu lives on a farm in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and large passion fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about keeping bees. 

Mariamu is married, and has five children. Both her and her husband are farmers and have been farming for twenty-five years. They are currently tending to an orange orchard, which will be an excellent source of nectar for their bee colonies. Mariamu is excited to become a beekeeper because it will give her family a source of natural honey to eat. 

This is Mariamu's first loan with Kiva, and she plans to use the income from her hives to pay her children's school fees. In the future, Mariamu hopes to save up enough money to build a new family house.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production
